story:
Who am I?

My name is D. Foy, and I'm a writer living in Brooklyn by way of Oakland. My work has appeared in Salon, BOMB, Frequencies, Post Road, The Literary Review, and The Georgia Review, among others, and has been included in the books Laundromat and Forty Stories: New Writing from Harper Perennial. My debut novel, Made to Break, will be released on March 18, 2014 from Two Dollar Radio, the indie publishing house that Kyle Minor recently said is "the hippest, most adventuresome publisher in America today."

Why am I raising funds?

I want my novel in the hands of as many people as I can reach. If you're reading this, it's likely that you want that, too.

Bringing attention to a book in a hyper-promotional world is hard enough. Without the support of booksellers and readers alike, the chances for a book's success are exponentially reduced.

The writer Ann Patchet couldn't have made this pickle any clearer when she said, "The only thing worse than going on a book tour is not going on a book tour."

Since I want to increase the chances for my book's success, I'm taking a tour through nearly 30 cities around the country, from February 26 to mid-April.

Here's why I need your help:

As with most indie publishing houses, once they've invested in the book itself, there's little money left to promote them the way large publishers can, much less to send their authors on book tours. While Two Dollar Radio is quite literally changing the face of American letters, its promotional activities are confined by a micro budget.

The truth is, the financial burden of this tour rests on me alone.

The $3500 I'm hoping to raise with this campaign will cover a fraction of the actual costs a national tour will incur, things like a rental car, gas, and a few nights in a hotel when I’m not staying with the kind souls who’ve offered to host me along the way.

For a full inventory of the costs your contribution will help to meet, check out the section below, "What  your contribution will support."

Made to Break, the novel

Made to Break recently made Flavorwire’s 15 Most Anticipated Books of 2014, and Anthony Swofford says, “Reading D. Foy's prose is like watching Robert Stone and Wallace Stevens drag race across a frozen lake at midnight.”

Two days before New Years, a pack of five friends—three men and two women—head to a remote cabin near Lake Tahoe to celebrate the holidays. They've been buddies forever, banded together by scrapes and squalor, their relationships defined by these wild times.

After a car accident leaves one friend sick and dying, and severe weather traps them at the cabin, there is nowhere to go, forcing them to finally and ultimately take stock and confront their past transgressions, considering what they mean to one another and to themselves.

From Two Dollar Radio’s jacket copy:

“With some of the most luminous and purple prose flexed in recent memory, D. Foy is an incendiary new voice and Made to Break, a grand, episodic debut, redolent of the stark conscience of Denis Johnson and the spellbinding vision of Roberto Bolaño.”

What they're saying about Made to Break

“D. Foy’s writing is so rich, so saturated in both life and literature, that one is tempted to strain for comparison, to find whatever madcap equivalencies (“It’s X meets Y!”) might begin to describe it accurately. Yet its whorl and grain, the fantastical strangeness of Foy’s sentences and the astonishing accuracy of his perception, amounts to something I can only call new. Made To Break is that rare thing: a truly original, and ferociously necessary, book.”
          —Matthew Specktor, author of American Dream Machine

“D. Foy’s Made to Break is a fiercely engrossing story of isolation, decaying friendships, and what people are capable of when they become, in body and in soul, trapped, all set against a dangerous winter landscape. These characters are so richly alive, these sentences so stormy and beautiful, this novel reads less like a debut than an assured, indelible work of art.”
          —Laura van den Berg, author of The Isle of Youth

“Made to Break is a fearless exploration of fragility–the fragility of friendship, the fragility of romance, the fragility of human life–but the book itself, trussed by D. Foy’s lavishly constructed sentences and astute psychological observations, is built to last. Think: Celine. Think: Burroughs. Think: Denis Johnson. Or better yet, think: D. Foy, poet laureate-elect of that marginal America filled with  junkies and drunks, where death is omnipresent, and the refuge of an open diner on a stormy night is the closest one gets to the American Dream.”
          —Adam Wilson, author of Flatscreen and What’s Important Is Feeling

“Stand back—D. Foy has ignited a big bad bacchanal where the sentences—if not whole pages—sear your skull. And buckle up, too, because the characters in Made to Break don’t. Here is a novel to cheer and to foist upon others.”
          —Terese Svoboda author of Tin God, Black Glasses Like Clark Kent, Bohemian Girl

“While reading Made to Break I just couldn’t believe it was the author’s first novel. The characters are deadly, troubled, vibrant, and their world is suffused with evil—not the manufactured evil of a Hollywood horror movie, but the carefully paced malevolence of a world doomed to swallow its inhabitants, consuming their shallow, fucked up memories in a swell of amoral darkness. D. Foy is not just a writer. He’s the kind of archangel Stanley Kubrick would have built wings for. Don’t just read this book. Revel in it. I swear you won’t be able to stop.”
          —Samuel Sattin, author of League of Somebodies

“Made to Break is a debauched Decameron for the punk and pills age. The group of friends in this excellent debut novel hit bottom together, and hit it hard. D. Foy sets his characters in motion and sends them reeling, one sure hand on the reader’s throat in a gorgeous, exhilarating tumble.”
          —Cari Luna, author of The Revolution of Every Day

“If Jonathan Ames, David Lynch, and Jack Kerouac banded together to pen a cautionary tale about Peter Pan and his drug- and alcohol-addled Lost Boys-as-Donner Party refugees, it would look like Made to Break. In D. Foy’s hands, men and women too old to behave like the impetuous teens they once were still cling to the dying code of what made their youth survivable.  This book is one wild, wild ride.”
          —Christian Kiefer, author of The Infinite Tide

The tour

The official launch date for Made to Break is March 18, but I’ll be kicking off my national tour starting with AWP Seattle on February 26, where I’ll read with Jeff Jackson (Mira Corpora), Matt Bell (In the House Upon the Dirt Between the Lake and the Woods), Sean Madigan Hoen (Songs Only You Know), and that great insurgent siren, Cari Luna (The Revolution of Everyday). This event is sponsored by Two Dollar Radio, Soho Press, Bookforum Magazine magazine. I'll also do two other gigs at AWP with a giant crew from Lazy Fascist Press (and others). You can see the full slate of venues and writers for all of the Seattle events here.

As for Cari Luna: immediately following the lollapalooza that is AWP, she and I are going to do a Bonnie-and-Clyde on the northwest, taking the region by storm. The itinerary will include Bellingham, WA, Vancouver BC, Olympia, WA, and Portland, OR, at Powell’s. More details are forthcoming on these, too. We can assure you, however, that the ride will include videos, goofy or otherwise, podcasts, radio shows, and blog entries, then—in all likelihood—a joint, post-recovery, tell-all essay about our adventures. I'll also be blogging about my adventures once a week over at Electric Literature's site The Outlet.

While Cari may be headed back home after all of that fun, however, I’ll only be getting started. From Portland, I’ll roll into the Bay Area, where the ass-kicking Joshua Mohr (Damascus and others.) and I will appear “in conversation” at San Francisco’s famed City Lights Books. I’ll do the same with Samuel Sattin at Green Apple Books in SF and with Christian Kiefer at Books Inc. in Alameda, as well. After these appearances, I head to the Kreuzberg Cafe in San Luis Obispo, an oasis on Cali’s central coast and the town of my conception, and from there to LA to rock it out at two different events, one in conversation with God of Letters Matthew Specktor (American Dream Machine) and another with a couple of Two Dollar Radio’s living legends, Grace Krilanovich and Karolina Waclawiak.

At home in NYC for two days, I’ll be joined by Anthony Swofford for a talk/reading/Q&A/signing at SoHo’s McNally Jackson Books, followed by a racous sort of event with Paula Bomer and Sean H. Doyle at Brooklyn’s own BookCourt, hosted by the boys from Vol. 1 Brooklyn, Jason Diamond and Tobias Carroll.

From Brooklyn, I head straight to Philadelphia and from there to Richmond and a number of events in North Carolina. Columbus, OH (hometown of Two Dollar Radio) is the first town I'll hit in the Midwest, followed by Cleveland, Ann Arbor, Chicago, Minneapolis, and Iowa City. After these, I head to Washington, D.C. for a literary conference and reading at Three Tents Reading Series.

Back at the ranch again on April 7, I’ll read at the now world-famous Franklin Park Reading Series, hosted by Penina Roth. Dates in Providence, Boston, and Portsmouth will follow. On April 28, I'll hit the STARTS HERE! Reading Series in Baltimore, and, finally, on May 1, I’ll get on the stage at Pete’s Reading Series in Brooklyn with Ben Dolnick.

Whew!!!

What your contribution will support

HOTELS
Seattle: $448
Bellingham: $100
SF: $200
Philly: $99
Iowa City: $82

Total: $930

CAR RENTAL
$965

GAS
$954.20 (at $3.67 per gallon)
http://fuelgaugereport.aaa.com/?redirectto=http://fuelgaugereport.opisnet.com/index.asp

MILEAGE
West Coast

Seattle/Bellingham: 89 miles
Bellingham/Vancouver: 52 miles
Vancouver/Olympia: 203 miles
OIympia/Portland: 113 miles
Portland/SF: 636 miles
SF/SLO: 231 miles
SLO/LA: 189 miles

East Coast, Midwest, and East Coast Redux

NYC/Philly: 95 miles
Philly/Richmond: 250 miles
Richmond/Greensboro: 202 miles
Greensboro/Charlotte: 290 miles
Charlotte/Chapel Hill: 140 miles
Chapel Hill/Columbus: 457 miles
Columbus/Cleveland: 148 miles
Cleveland/Ann Arbor: 167 miles
Ann Arbor/Chicago: 241 miles
Chicago/Minneapolis: 409 miles
Minneapolis/Iowa City: 304 miles
Iowa City/Columbus: 534 milieus
Columbus/DC: 402 miles
DC/NYC: 225 miles
NYC/Providence: 181 miles
Providence/Boston: 50 miles
Boston/Portsmouth: 57miles
Portsmouth/NYC: 264 miles

Total: 5,929 miles

At approximately 23 mpg (Subaru Outback 2005!), I'll use 260 gallons.

$3.67 x 260 = $954.20

PARKING
$200

MISCELLANEOUS
$500

GRAND TOTAL: $3,550

Other ways you can help

You may not be able to contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help. I'll love you all forever and a day if you:

  • Get the word out about me, Made to Break, and the tour I'm taking to support it
  • Holler at others about my campaign to raise funds for the tour
  • Buy Made to Break from Two Dollar Radio or from your local indie bookseller

I thank you all in advance for any help you may offer and for your energy and your eyes!

Big hearts!

D

story:
Story of My Book

The Fire to Inspire 

My name is Ethan Miller and I am the author of The Fire to Inspire. I wrote this book because I wanted to leave this world a little bit better than I found it.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover what it means to live a life of meaning and to stand for something. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for YOUR LIFE . And then ultimately I want you to see this book as a tool to help you take back control of your life and see the little things, for that is what makes life meaningful.

In this book, you'll learn about Motivation and Inspiration through:

Personal accounts of people with near death experiences and their takeaway from it

What it means to truly live life to the fullest, each and every day!!

What it really takes to survive in this brave new world, how to thrive and go about each day like it’s your last

I can’t promise you’ll love this book, hell even like this book. I can promise that there will be many things you can take away from it to help you in the long run of your life. You will learn things you never knew, see things you’ve never seen, and do things you’ve never done just because you read this book and you took action in your life. So what are you waiting for? 

The Fire to Inspire is a non-fiction book that speaks to everyone and anyone who is looking at their life and may be happy or unhappy. While this book won’t solve every problem, it will help you see the world differently and realize that not everything is as it seems and show you that life really is simple. Just like Florida Georgia Line says. 

The Book - “The Fire to Inspire”


The book is written in 5 Parts....

Part 1 contains the introduction + additional chapters. This section starts off by explaining what motivation and inspiration can do for you, my definition of it, and a little bit about me, my past, and my future. 

Part 2 contains stories about using motivation to your advantage, creating an impact on this world and really making a difference in not only your life, but the lives of those around you. 

Part 3 talks about how to lead in this crazy world we find ourselves in, using empathy and perspective to create balance in the workplace, living a life worth living, and many, many other things. 

Part 4 introduces the educational system, it’s ups and downs, and some fixes on how to help struggling kids. It also touches on subjects about drug addiction, loneliness, and how ALL lives truly matter. 

Part 5 contains interviews conducted with dozens of people, their perspective on the subjects introduced in the chapters beforehand, and differing opinions to see what the world has to say about motivation and inspiration and it’s impact on their life. 

What I Need & What You'll Get


This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
 

The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2020

The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!

The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)

The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication

The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this December!!! HOAHHHH

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook. 

So let’s get crack-a-lackin and read read read, (Spoiler, it may be addicting)

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

A personally signed copy of my book when I publish

A personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book

Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)

Early access to the Introduction of my Book and some additional sections of my manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback

The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover

I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book

You can be eligible for an interview with me (probably on zoom depending on the COVID-19 situation) 

Everyone that pre-orders the book will be entered to win a $50 gift card to a restaurant of their choice, and if they want I’ll take them out to eat? Date night anyone? 

Anyone who pre-orders can also send in their favorite quotes to be posted at the back of the book for everyone around the world to enjoy. 

About the Author


[CREDIBILITY: Ethan Miller (me) is an aspiring author and motivational speaker. I am looking to use the proceeds of the book to start my own non-profit and conduct motivational speaking across the world. 

I’ve seen so many acts of heroism and kindness — it just warms my heart; just to turn on the news and see greed and darkness. I want to show the world that it isn’t as bad as they say it is, it is beautiful. I want people to know that they can make a difference and they do. You have the power to CHANGE THE WORLD!!

I am passionate for helping others, it is what I do each and every day. I want to make a difference in this world. I want someone to look at me in 10-15 years, and say “Because of you I didn’t give up. Because of you I am where I am. I saw you work your ass off so I worked mine off too. Because of you I have a life.” 

If you want to reach out for any reasons, or follow me, my email is emill46@u.rochester.edu. My phone number is (717) 919-8461. My instagram is eeff_keef (inside joke). 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #THEFIRETOINSPIRE and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Ethan Miller

So what are you waiting for? The Fire to Inspire is a non-fiction book that speaks to everyone and anyone who is looking at their life and may be happy or unhappy. While this book won’t solve every problem, it will help you see the world differently and realize that not everything is as it seems and show you that life really is simple. Just like Florida Georgia Line says. The Book - “The Fire to Inspire”
The book is written in 5 Parts....Part 1 contains the introduction + additional chapters. This section starts off by explaining what motivation and inspiration can do for you, my definition of it, and a little bit about me, my past, and my future. Part 2 contains stories about using motivation to your advantage, creating an impact on this world and really making a difference in not only your life, but the lives of those around you. Part 3 talks about how to lead in this crazy world we find ourselves in, using empathy and perspective to create balance in the workplace, living a life worth living, and many, many other things. Part 4 introduces the educational system, it’s ups and downs, and some fixes on how to help struggling kids. It also touches on subjects about drug addiction, loneliness, and how ALL lives truly matter. Part 5 contains interviews conducted with dozens of people, their perspective on the subjects introduced in the chapters beforehand, and differing opinions to see what the world has to say about motivation and inspiration and it’s impact on their life. What I Need & What You'll Get
This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following: The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2020
The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this December!!! HOAHHHHWhen I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook. So let’s get crack-a-lackin and read read read, (Spoiler, it may be addicting)I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:A personally signed copy of my book when I publish
A personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
Early access to the Introduction of my Book and some additional sections of my manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
You can be eligible for an interview with me (probably on zoom depending on the COVID-19 situation) 
Everyone that pre-orders the book will be entered to win a $50 gift card to a restaurant of their choice, and if they want I’ll take them out to eat? Date night anyone? 
Anyone who pre-orders can also send in their favorite quotes to be posted at the back of the book for everyone around the world to enjoy. 
About the Author
[CREDIBILITY: Ethan Miller (me) is an aspiring author and motivational speaker. I am looking to use the proceeds of the book to start my own non-profit and conduct motivational speaking across the world. I’ve seen so many acts of heroism and kindness — it just warms my heart; just to turn on the news and see greed and darkness. I want to show the world that it isn’t as bad as they say it is, it is beautiful. I want people to know that they can make a difference and they do. You have the power to CHANGE THE WORLD!!I am passionate for helping others, it is what I do each and every day. I want to make a difference in this world. I want someone to look at me in 10-15 years, and say “Because of you I didn’t give up. Because of you I am where I am. I saw you work your ass off so I worked mine off too. Because of you I have a life.” If you want to reach out for any reasons, or follow me, my email is emill46@u.rochester.edu. My phone number is (717) 919-8461. My instagram is eeff_keef (inside joke). Risks & ChallengesThe biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. story:
Story of My Book 

The Long Way Home is a never-ending quest to find the most balanced, happy, imperfect version of yourself. This book will inspire readers toward bridging the gap between societal pressures and choosing their own path in life.

My name is Rachel Riccobono and I am the author of The Long Way Home. I wrote this book because I’m passionate about personal development and human connection. I’m a lifelong learner; constantly searching for the answers to life’s mysteries and most asked questions. I may have the wisdom of an old soul, but I’m looking at life with a fresh pair of eyes. 

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover your most authentic self, and learn how to care for yourself mentally, physically, and emotionally. I hope you choose to look past the unrealistic standards and pressures that society places on you. The Long Way Home will encourage readers to choose paths that serve them, rather than ones that please those around them. 

In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for personal growth. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you find more balance, gain a better understanding of yourself and others around you, and use your passions to find your niche along this messy, confusing journey of life. 

In this book, you'll learn about topics like growth mindset, healthy boundaries, life purpose, trauma, and coping. You'll hear stories such as...

  • My journey to now; a deeper look inside my personal growth, from passionate child to an ambitious woman conquering adulthood and her autoimmune disease. 
  • Insights from extraordinary individuals like the Wright Brothers, Audrey Hepburn, and F. Scott Fitzgerald. 
  • Inspiring stories and wisdom from experts, creators, and speakers like Spencer Harrison and Jon Cohen, Bob Borchers, Tim Tamashiro, and Susan David.

 

You will love this book if you are open-minded, value self-improvement, and enjoy learning new things.

The Long Way Home is a nonfiction book that speaks to readers everywhere, from adolescents to adults. The book aims to prepare future generations for the ever-changing world we live in, help those still navigating adult life and heal those searching to find balance and peace. The Long Way Home is for individuals who want to look at personal growth, happiness, and achievement in a new light. 

 

The Book - The Long Way Home 

The book is written in 3 parts.

Part 1 contains the prologue + chapters 1-4.
A journey has to start somewhere! In this first section, readers will learn more about different generations of people in the United States, current issues we face in this technological age, how to stay curious, and how to identify their primary needs. These chapters will dive deep into societal pressures, unconventional routes to success, and straying from the pack. Part 1 will include research and insights from Pew Research Center, TIME Magazine, Walt Disney, Albert Einstein, Abraham Maslow, Mayo Clinic, and much more. This section will embrace ideals of originality, reminding readers that there’s no “right way” to live their life or achieve greatness in this world. 

Part 2 contains chapters 5-7. 
In this section, readers will learn how to create healthy boundaries in relationships, cope with trauma, and embrace the never-ending struggle to find balance. Part 2 will include personal stories, insights, and research from The National Council for Behavioral Health, Psychology Today, Mental Health America, Oprah Winfrey, Elizabeth Gilbert, and many more. This section will inform readers while encouraging them to find the beauty in even the ugliest parts of life. 

Part 3 contains chapters 8-12 + the epilogue. 
Part 3 of The Long Way Home will teach readers about topics like self-love, acceptance, life purpose, the pursuit of happiness, and how to maintain growth over time. This section will include personal stories, research and insights from Brené Brown, Dr. Viktor Frankl, Carol Dweck, and more! 

 

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August, 2021. 
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this summer. 

 

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

 

About the Author 

Rachel Riccobono is an upcoming graduate of Arizona State University, with concentrations in Psychology and Special Events Management. She is a UDA All-American dancer, published writer, devoted daughter, sister, friend, and leader within her community. 

Rachel is an eternal optimist with a fresh, realistic outlook. Playing devil’s advocate is a favorite past-time of hers. She’s passionate about the human mind, experience, and connection. She hopes to impact the way people communicate, perceive, and interact with one another. She’s inherently curious and hopes to bring new perspective to readers everywhere. 

When she’s not pondering life’s many mysteries, she loves to cook, hike, travel, and play with her puppy Carson. Friends would describe her as passionate, strong, funny, and determined. Some would even say she’s their personal therapist. Rachel is a warm, loving spirit and friend to all she meets. 

For more information, you can connect with Rachel at rachhricc@gmail.com and at @rachh_ricc (IG), Rachel Riccobono (LinkedIn), Rachel Riccobono (FB). 

 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please send me a private message.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #TheLongWayHome and tag me (@rachh_ricc) as well as my publisher, New Degree Press (@newdegreepress), so that we can help amplify your efforts.

  • You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

With gratitude, 

Rachel

story:
My name is Dallas Freeman. I am a woman whose history is filled with abuse, depression and addiction. I was bullied, neglected and rejected, forced out of my home before I could even drive. I tried to cope with it all which led to my own addiction, sexual promiscuity, and even an abortion. 

When I was 22 I came to a place where I wanted to die. I couldn’t handle my reality anymore. In the middle of all of that mess, I learned who God was and what it meant to have a relationship with Him and it was life changing for me.

Overcoming my personal battle with addiction and abuse and now living a life on purpose is something I want to share with others who are struggling with those same issues. My hope is to show them that someone who has been where they are has found a real way out and up through the power of Jesus Christ. I want to give them hope that they too can overcome and gain a purpose worth living for even in the aftermath of their own bad decisions. 

By contributing to this project you will help get my story into the hands of people who need to be encouraged to keep fighting, and who need to see there is an amazing life beyond abuse and addiction. 

Please donate to this project. Together we can help save and change lives! 

ANY DONATION OF $25 OR MORE WILL RECEIVE AN AUTOGRAPHED ADVANCE COPY!

story:
Story of My Book 

The Apprentice Mindset is a book about how mastery, purpose, and success can be found by apprenticing experts.

My name is Katarvia Taylor, and I am the author of The Apprentice Mindset. I wrote this book because after years of observing, working with, and studying people who achieved stratospheric success, I wanted to share what I discovered was that catalyst and most important key to their achievement – without fail, 100% of them either had an apprenticeship relationship and/or an apprentice mindset. I then decided to take a deeper dive and explore their stories, the notion of apprenticeships, and how since the beginning of time apprenticeships have been the key to unlocking potential and helping humanity find purpose and success.  

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will become inspired and motivated by the stories of well-known and not so-well-known individuals who deliberately sought out and/or submitted themselves to the masters of their fields. And because iron sharpens iron, these apprentices discovered, honed, and developed their potential to a point where they achieved mastery and went on to make significant contributions in their industries, society, and the world. In this book, I hope to share with you the same sort of passion and excitement that I found in learning more about the master/apprentice pairs presented. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you realize that purpose, mastery, and success are not solely discovered through an internal introspective process but also by taking on the mindset of an apprentice and placing oneself in the orbit of a master. A well-developed internal compass is not always the primary key to finding your way in life. Taking a journey with experienced masters will guide you toward finding your own path toward destiny and success.

In this book, you'll learn about how apprenticeships lead to the acquisition of tacit knowledge and mastery through observation, imitation, and eventually finding one’s voice and way.    You'll hear stories such as...

  • How Jamie Dimon’s decision to turn down offers from Goldman Sachs, Morgan Stanley, and Lehman Brothers to apprentice Sandy Weill when he was President at American Express gave Dimon the opportunity to learn how to successfully manage billion-dollar mergers and acquisitions fresh out of Harvard Business School.
  • How Congressman Charlie Rangel and the first-ever US Trade Representative for Africa Rosa Whitaker were two of the key architects of the African Growth and Opportunity Act (AGOA), the cornerstone of the United States’ trade policy with Africa. Whitaker worked with Congressman Rangel and learned how relationship building, negotiation, and consensus building are key to getting tough things done.
  • Cellists Pablo Casals and Bernard Greenhouse and how apprenticeships among top musicians is a lesson in how imitation can lead to improvisation and innovation.

You will also hear stories of how:

  • An ocean enthusiast apprenticed his father to become one of the top dive instructors and foremost experts on marine conservation.
  • A church’s protégé program became the ultimate apprenticeship model for creating a pipeline of leaders to drive the expansion of its programs in Washington, DC.

The Apprentice Mindset is a nonfiction book that speaks to students, recent college graduates, young professionals, and those looking to change their careers. It provides a new way to look at the notion of finding purpose and success.

The Book - The Apprentice Mindset

The book is written in 3 parts.

Part 1 contains the introduction + chapters 1-3. In the section, I present the case for apprenticeships. I look at the history and benefits of apprenticeships and show how they are different from other key relationships – advisory and mentorships. I argue here that what makes an apprenticeship particularly powerful is that it is formalized and intentional.


Part 2 contains chapters 4-8. The focus of the main part of the book is on the Apprentice Mindset. Here I share stories of master/apprentice pairs and use research to dissect and explore what made the apprentice a success. I look at concepts such as the acquisition of tacit knowledge through observation; imitation v. emulation; learning unwritten rules; and how masters in the end are gatekeepers and door “unlockers” who consciously and unconsciously guide their apprentices to success.  

Part 3 contains chapters 9-10. In this application section, I look at how masters and apprentices can make the most of the relationship. I also explore the the inevitable challenges and difficulties that come with any relationship and how they can be navigated.   

What I Need & What You'll Get

  • This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2021.
  • The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Winter.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish and a handwritten thank-you note.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

Campaign Goals

Tier 1: Hit $5,500 and the ebook/softcover editions get published (this is the minimum needed)
Tier 2: Hit $6,500 and the book will get a hardcover edition
Tier 3: Hit $8,500 and we’ll get an audiobook edition.

About the Author

Katarvia Taylor, a native of The Bahamas, has spent the past twenty five years studying, working and living throughout Africa, Europe, Latin America, and North America. During this time, she has worked with global experts in a range of disciplines including international finance, transaction advisory services, and renewable energy project development amongst others.

Her inaugural book is the outcome of her desire to understand the why and how of successful individuals. In it she posits that success can be achieved and purpose discovered by developing the apprentice mindset.

Katarvia holds a Master of Science degree in Information Systems Technology with honors (Beta Gamma Sigma) from The George Washington University and she graduated Phi Beta Kappa from Georgetown University with a Bachelor of Arts in French, German, and Latin American Studies.

For more information, you can connect with Katarvia at katarvia@tasg.co.uk and www.linkedin.com/in/katarviataylor

International Preorders

For international preorders, please do the following:

  • Identify the perk that interests you, e.g. 1 or 2 paperbacks
  • Select the pink "Back it" button to "Make a contribution" for the same amount (this choice bypasses the shipping address page)
  • Use this form https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdOhmWTFkHhekWWI4pgkGjXRIEgH42Bq7yNRK_yY14WNNLUDw/viewform  to share your mailing address, so I can calculate the international shipping costs and invoice you for that amount via PayPal/Venmo

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can support, but that doesn't mean you can't help.

  • Please feel free to share my pre-sale campagian on LinkedIn, Twitter, and Facebook with your friends. Please use #apprenticemindset and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts!
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sales Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. You can do so via text or direct message on social media:
    • Instagram - @katarviataylor / @newdegreepress
    • Twitter - @katarvia / @NewDegreePress

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Katarvia Taylor

Story of My Book The Apprentice Mindset is a book about how mastery, purpose, and success can be found by apprenticing experts.My name is Katarvia Taylor, and I am the author of The Apprentice Mindset. I wrote this book because after years of observing, working with, and studying people who achieved stratospheric success, I wanted to share what I discovered was that catalyst and most important key to their achievement – without fail, 100% of them either had an apprenticeship relationship and/or an apprentice mindset. I then decided to take a deeper dive and explore their stories, the notion of apprenticeships, and how since the beginning of time apprenticeships have been the key to unlocking potential and helping humanity find purpose and success.  My hope is that, in reading this book, you will become inspired and motivated by the stories of well-known and not so-well-known individuals who deliberately sought out and/or submitted themselves to the masters of their fields. And because iron sharpens iron, these apprentices discovered, honed, and developed their potential to a point where they achieved mastery and went on to make significant contributions in their industries, society, and the world. In this book, I hope to share with you the same sort of passion and excitement that I found in learning more about the master/apprentice pairs presented. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you realize that purpose, mastery, and success are not solely discovered through an internal introspective process but also by taking on the mindset of an apprentice and placing oneself in the orbit of a master. A well-developed internal compass is not always the primary key to finding your way in life. Taking a journey with experienced masters will guide you toward finding your own path toward destiny and success.In this book, you'll learn about how apprenticeships lead to the acquisition of tacit knowledge and mastery through observation, imitation, and eventually finding one’s voice and way.    You'll hear stories such as...
How Jamie Dimon’s decision to turn down offers from Goldman Sachs, Morgan Stanley, and Lehman Brothers to apprentice Sandy Weill when he was President at American Express gave Dimon the opportunity to learn how to successfully manage billion-dollar mergers and acquisitions fresh out of Harvard Business School.
How Congressman Charlie Rangel and the first-ever US Trade Representative for Africa Rosa Whitaker were two of the key architects of the African Growth and Opportunity Act (AGOA), the cornerstone of the United States’ trade policy with Africa. Whitaker worked with Congressman Rangel and learned how relationship building, negotiation, and consensus building are key to getting tough things done.
Cellists Pablo Casals and Bernard Greenhouse and how apprenticeships among top musicians is a lesson in how imitation can lead to improvisation and innovation.
You will also hear stories of how:
An ocean enthusiast apprenticed his father to become one of the top dive instructors and foremost experts on marine conservation.
A church’s protégé program became the ultimate apprenticeship model for creating a pipeline of leaders to drive the expansion of its programs in Washington, DC.
The Apprentice Mindset is a nonfiction book that speaks to students, recent college graduates, young professionals, and those looking to change their careers. It provides a new way to look at the notion of finding purpose and success.The Book - The Apprentice MindsetThe book is written in 3 parts.Part 1 contains the introduction + chapters 1-3. In the section, I present the case for apprenticeships. I look at the history and benefits of apprenticeships and show how they are different from other key relationships – advisory and mentorships. I argue here that what makes an apprenticeship particularly powerful is that it is formalized and intentional.Part 2 contains chapters 4-8. The focus of the main part of the book is on the Apprentice Mindset. Here I share stories of master/apprentice pairs and use research to dissect and explore what made the apprentice a success. I look at concepts such as the acquisition of tacit knowledge through observation; imitation v. emulation; learning unwritten rules; and how masters in the end are gatekeepers and door “unlockers” who consciously and unconsciously guide their apprentices to success.  Part 3 contains chapters 9-10. In this application section, I look at how masters and apprentices can make the most of the relationship. I also explore the the inevitable challenges and difficulties that come with any relationship and how they can be navigated.   What I Need & What You'll Get
This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2021.

The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)

The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).

The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.

The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Winter.
I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish and a handwritten thank-you note.
Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).
You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
And much more!
Campaign GoalsTier 1: Hit $5,500 and the ebook/softcover editions get published (this is the minimum needed)Tier 2: Hit $6,500 and the book will get a hardcover editionTier 3: Hit $8,500 and we’ll get an audiobook edition.About the AuthorKatarvia Taylor, a native of The Bahamas, has spent the past twenty five years studying, working and living throughout Africa, Europe, Latin America, and North America. During this time, she has worked with global experts in a range of disciplines including international finance, transaction advisory services, and renewable energy project development amongst others.Her inaugural book is the outcome of her desire to understand the why and how of successful individuals. In it she posits that success can be achieved and purpose discovered by developing the apprentice mindset.Katarvia holds a Master of Science degree in Information Systems Technology with honors (Beta Gamma Sigma) from The George Washington University and she graduated Phi Beta Kappa from Georgetown University with a Bachelor of Arts in French, German, and Latin American Studies.For more information, you can connect with Katarvia at katarvia@tasg.co.uk and www.linkedin.com/in/katarviataylorInternational PreordersFor international preorders, please do the following:
Identify the perk that interests you, e.g. 1 or 2 paperbacks
Select the pink "Back it" button to "Make a contribution" for the same amount (this choice bypasses the shipping address page)
Use this form https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdOhmWTFkHhekWWI4pgkGjXRIEgH42Bq7yNRK_yY14WNNLUDw/viewform  to share your mailing address, so I can calculate the international shipping costs and invoice you for that amount via PayPal/Venmo
Risks & ChallengesThe biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies are expected to ship. Other Ways You Can HelpNot everyone can support, but that doesn't mean you can't help.
Please feel free to share my pre-sale campagian on LinkedIn, Twitter, and Facebook with your friends. Please use #apprenticemindset and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts!
You can easily share my Pre-Sales Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. You can do so via text or direct message on social media:
Instagram - @katarviataylor / @newdegreepress
Twitter - @katarvia / @NewDegreePress


Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!Thanks again,Katarvia Taylor

story:
Que?

O coala preséntase como un ollar  paródico sobre a Galicia contemporánea, no que as visións simplificadoras e estereotipadas do mundo, ben máis complexo, son postas en cuestión.

Thomas Reed, un mozo galés afeccionado á música de R.E.M. e á Wikipedia, trasládase coa súa familia a Galicia para traballar como profesor de inglés nun colexio privado de Santiago de Compostela. Será alí testemuña dun acontecemento que crebará a convivencia dunha sociedade galega en tempos de crise: a misteriosa aparición dun coala nunha antiga carballeira, transformada agora en eucaliptal.

Trátase dunha fantasía, descontrolada, sobre a inevitabilidade de que os lugares que sentimos coma propios muden. Dunha chamada a acción, para que fagamos que as cousas sexan, non como unha vez foron, senón coma nós queiramos construílas.    

Quen?

Do Peirao é unha editorial con vontade de cambio, de dar a alternativa a autores que non a atopan noutro lugar, con novas e refrescantes ideas como é o empregar unha campaña preventa para valorar a aceptación e viabilidade de cada título.

Deste xeito es ti, agora que te estás expondo como colaborar, o que decide se a obra que che presentamos verá a luz pasando a formar parte do noso catálogo... porque consideramos ao lector parte fundamental do proceso.

Hoxe presentámosche a Daniel Ugarte.

Nado en Santiago de Compostela en 1981, é licenciado en CC Políticas e especialista en Dereito da Propiedade Intelectual. Desde 2007, reside en Bruxelas onde traballa como Xestor de proxectos na Axencia Europea para as Pequenas e Medianas Empresas (EASME).

Membro da Asociación Cultural Couto Mixto, o contacto cos numerosos autores/as que viven en Bruxelas ou visitan a capital belga fixolle retomar unha vocación literaria que ficara conxelada na adolescencia.

O coala é a súa primeira novela.

Por que?

Por aquí un fragmento do texto como mostra:

«Non era nin moito menos a primeira vez que nos acontecía, así que a pregunta de Jesús non nos colleu por sorpresa. Cando viaxabamos por Inglaterra moita xente se sobresaltaba ao escoitaren parte dunha das nosas conversacións bilingües. De contado identificaban a Lizzy como galesa. O seu inglés delatábaa. Pola contra, a miña procedencia era máis difícil de situar. O meu galés era habitualmente tomado por sueco, danés ou ruso. Mesmo nunha ocasión, facendo turismo por Middlesbrough, unha señora preguntara se por casualidade eu era checo ou húngaro, porque a súa filla estaba a preparar unha viaxe co instituto ás cidades imperiais; Viena, Praga e Budapest.
          En Gales non era tan habitual que iso acontecese. A maior parte das veces tomábanme por galés. Pola contra, alá era máis frecuente que xente á que acaba de coñecer me preguntase desacougada se sempre lle falaba en galés a Ceri».

Como?

Para arrincar o proxecto fixámonos como obxectivo 880€; esta é a cantidade que recadariamos se ao redor de cincuenta mecenas se fixesen, cada cal, cun exemplar desta primeira edición.

  • Tendo acceso ás galeradas de edición.
  • Recibindo un exemplar semanas antes da saída ao mercado da obra.
  • Aínda que, tamén poderías ver o teu nome nos agradecementos achegando un pouco máis.

Ademais...

Sabemos que son tempos difíciles, tamén nós os sufrimos, e é posible que non esteas en disposición de apoiarnos co teu mecenado nestes momentos... pero agardamos que se isto te chegou á alma, mesmo se talvez coñeces en persoa ao autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-orella... ) para que academos a nosa meta e Daniel Ugarte vexa publicada a súa obra.

Grazas polo voso tempo.

Política de privacidade

story:
Summary

There are 2 book series being written.

The first is a series of 5 picture books for infants & toddlers (birth to age 4) that center on two honeybees who visit local creatures . Two of these books are already written and currently being illustrated.

The second is a series of 5 story books for slightly older children (ages 3 to 6) that are meant to be read aloud for bedtime stories. Three of these stories are currently written, and one is already published as an ebook.

What We Need & What You Get

In order to make these books accessible to all children and schools, we need funding to cover some of the bigger expenses such as graphic design & editing, marketing & publicity, and most of all, the printing & distribution. 

The Impact

As more & more research is showing, early childhood exposure to nature has tremendous mental & physical health benefits that last a lifetime. My books help fill a niche that allows for nature connection to be touched upon even when stuck inside during inclement weather. These stories also promote literacy & language development and social & emotional intelligence.

Risks & Challenges

The big challenge is to keep costs low for maximum distribution. This can only be achieved with bulk printing. Otherwise, the risk is low due to the ease of publishing ebooks and print-on-demand services.

Other Ways You Can Help

Another way to help is to share & promote via social media and leaving reviews on the book store sites. If someone really skilled at social media and online marketing is looking for a project to support and add to their resume, i could really use the help in this arena and may even be able to hire you to get things rolling for me.

I also have a store on etsy.com, Sylvan Arts & Crafts, where i sell nature-inspired arts & crafts.

I am also open to any & all referrals, connections, and feedback.

story:
My name is L. D. Robwell and I'm creating a new genre.

This project is an anthology of short stories by several different writers in a brand new genre of modern fantasy that rejects the tropes and cliches of the Urban Fantasy genre.

By helping me, you're helping several writers. The world doesn't pay writers much and I am trying to change that. I'm paying the writers a decent amount if we can raise the funds. We want to make the lives of various writers better, and then continue to do so as the Mystic Punk genre gains a fan base. We want the next trend to be one of substance, so we're creating it from scratch.

What is Mystic Punk, exactly?

I tapped into some common themes that run through my favorite bands, movies, comics and television shows and came up with those criteria. This is what I'm looking for in literature and I think the rest of us are too:

  • Minorities! Why does "Urban Fantasy" have to be so white and hetero? It's so DULL. There is no URBAN environment in the world that is exclusively white and heterosexual. I simply don't get it!
  • Mysticism! This is not a religious book. This is a book that explores the connection between YOU and YOUR SPIRIT, or the characters and their spirits. All religions seek to make a connection with the divine but I don't fit in with any mainstream religion. Neither do most people in our age group. The fastest growing religion, in the U. S., is non-religious. But that doesn't mean we aren't interested in the spiritual.
  • Ambiguity! I'm tired of stories that exist with only one thing to talk about: which boy should she date, the hot one or the REALLY hot one? We seek to create stories that readers can share with their friends, have different understandings and communicate their understandings with each other. We want to make reading a communal activity the way other art is!
  • A Punk Edge and Aesthetic! These stories look and feel like the counter culture it gets it's name from, like Cyber Punk. It is anti-authoritarian, individualistic, counter culture and even a bit confrontational. Plus, you know, weird hair, boys in make up, girls in fishnet stockings, ripped jeans, etc.
  • Music! Music is one of the most precious mystical experiences we can have. Writers often use music to help them build the worlds in their head but we, the mystic punk anthology, seeks to put the music back out into the world through our stories.
  • Hidden Faces! This is a unique visual cue; like goggles in Steam Punk. The faces can be hidden behind a mask, face paint or environmental elements such as smoke.

That's it! That's all it takes! 

What We Need:

We need $3000 to make this happen. Why do we need so much?

We're paying the authors between $100 and $300 dollars. There are currently 11 authors on board, but we are still accepting submissions. I capped the potential goal at $3000 so I could continue to attract writers and to hopefully get some who are more successful to add their names to the list.


Because we plan to self publish the book through lulu and smashwords(for the ebook) we don't need to pay up front printing costs except for the perks that you'll receive.


We'll also need to set up a website with information about the Mystic Punk anthology and advertising but this will only come out of what ever does not go to pay the contributing authors.


I am not taking a payment for editing or writing the anthology though my partner James is taking $100 for his story and $100 for editing.

Perks? What are these... Perks?

I'm so glad you asked! The perks start small and get bigger and better as the donation size increases. You can read more about them on the side bar but here is a rough breakdown:

  • Your name tweeted, tumbled, facebooked and more to all our fans. If you are a writer or are in a band, we'll promote your project instead of your name. If you have an indiegogo campaign, we'll plug that too!
  • A short story from the anthology, your pick! You can choose which story you'd like to read in various ebook formats!
  • A personalized thank you letter written on the back of a post card and mailed to you, signed by L. D. Robwell (myself). This will either be postcards from my box of Sandman post cards that I've never used or home made post cards in a collage style.
  • The full ebook!
  • A mystic punk soundtrack featuring songs by artists from a variety of genres that tap into some of the themes we're trying to write about. So far, Insane Poetry, Bad Mind and Divisible have all given me OKs to use their music. We're reaching out to several other artists though. It's been exciting!
  • An ebook with interviews with the writers! This is the ultimate in "dvd" extra's! This is a great way to learn more about the writers and their work.
  • A Mystic Punk art project in ebook format! Lots of art that taps into the mystic punk genre!
  • The full book in paper back!
  • An additional story by myself!
  • And the big one: a Hard Cover, limited edition version of the book with the extra story by myself included in the book, the books dedication to yourself or a loved one and a personalized thank you letter included in the introduction. This book will be a one of a kind collectors item!

I have over estimated my goal so I can continue to look for new writers to add to the project. If we don't meet the $3k, we'll use what ever funds we have to pay off as many of the writers as we can so we can still move the book forward. If we don't raise enough to pay the writers, we'll issue refunds. 

The $40 perk comes with a paper back copy of the book, why is it so expensive?

This is an unfortunate side effect of budgeting. I wanted to pay the contributors, with the price we've set we can meet our goals by selling about 100 copies, how ever, that will cost about $1000 dollars more. We're hoping that more people will preorder the ebook to help lower the actual prodcution costs. With e-books, the only cost is paying the writers for their work. With physical copies, we have to have them printed and then shipped, which costs a decent amount. 

What's going in the book, so far?

  • An introduction to the anthology and the new genre by L. D. Robwell
  • (title pending) by L. D. Robwell
  • (title pending) by James O'Neil
  • Aperture by Andrew Henderson
  • Ocean by H. C. Bunn
  • Fire Crest by Anastasia Olashaya-Grill
  • Shades of Color by Jennifer R. Povey
  • (title pending) by Christian Crews
  • Cloud Nine by J.L. Knight
  • Enhance by David Herbert
  • Lifelong Joy in Dreamland City by Bartholomew Klick
  • Reflections by R.L. Sentance
  • The Bowery by Darron Parker
  • (title pending) by Jamie Kelly

Why should you care about this new genre and my writing career?

Even though I am a white, heterosexual male, I tend to write minorities of various stripes. The novel I am currently writing is about a teenage black lesbian who rejects society, including her family, because of sexist and homophobic attitudes. It is a YA novel set in the near future.

We need stories like this because it more accurately reflects the world we live in. Although women and gay characters are getting more attention there are other types of minorities, such as religious groups, the neurologically different, queer minorities who are not simply gay (such as asexuals, transgender men/women, bisexuals), mental and physically handicapped and more. Mystic Punk wants to put these kinds of people into the forefront of modern American fantasy literature.

The stories also ask important questions about reality and the human experience. These are not simple adventure stories, they are complex and emotional views into various truths that the authors have in their hearts.

I am a budding writer and when I was told that agents and publishers do not like to hear "this is a new genre" or "this isn't like anything else that's out there" they usually cringe. I don't blame them. But I was in a pinch because my writing did seem to be in a new genre. I could point to a few books that were close to the right genre but nothing matched perfectly. My coeditor, a good friend of mine named James O'Neil, and I talked the problem out. We came to the conclusion that releasing my own stories would not be enough to set a precedent. I could have done all that for free through smash words but we wanted something more, something bigger.

We decided on an anthology. The funds that we raise go to pay the contributing authors and to pay for the perks. That's it. The more we raise, the more stories we can have in our anthology and the stronger the book will be. That's why we need you.

If we can pull this off, we'll have set a precedent for the publishing industry that fights back against the bland, white, heterosexual and trope filled world of Urban Fantasy. I love Buffy the Vampire Slayer but it seems that the genre hasn't done much since then to warrant it's massive presence. Publishers are currently in a mode that they'll primarily only invest in things that have established markets. We're creating that market. We're helping science fiction and fantasy authors who are tired of being told that a book needs a vampire or romance love interest.

I've been unemployed for several years and have recently gone back to school. By helping me publish this anthology you are helping to open a world where the kinds of stories I like can be published without lengthy meetings about the severe lack of market for the strange kinds of stories I want to tell.

Many of the authors who are already on board are working tirelessly to expand their writing credentials so that they can turn their passion into what they do for a living. You're helping that come true, a few hundred bucks at a time.

I want this anthology to be like the Odd Future Wolf Gang Kill Them All of the literary world. If we can pull this off, you'll be helping create an entire community of artists, not just one or two.

Other Ways You Can Help that can help just as much as a donation!

As I said before, I'm unemployed, which means that I often can't contribute to indiegogo campaigns even when I think they are amazing. If you love this concept but do not have the money, there are three simple ways you can help and one of them will help you earn some money!

You can also tell everybody you know about this project! Indiegogo even makes it easy for you to do this by providing share tools that will help you pass the link along through social media sites. Blogging about our new genre is a big help too.

Finally, and this one would be a huge help, if you send an email to writers you like who are not as famous as they should be, and tell them that they should get in on this, you would be helping us out a lot. Having an author with a decent sized name would help us out a lot.
story_txt:
My name is L. D. Robwell and I'm creating a new genre. 
This project is an anthology of short stories by several different writers in a brand new genre of modern fantasy that rejects the tropes and cliches of the Urban Fantasy genre.
By helping me, you're helping several writers. The world doesn't pay writers much and I am trying to change that. I'm paying the writers a decent amount if we can raise the funds. We want to make the lives of various writers better, and then continue to do so as the Mystic Punk genre gains a fan base. We want the next trend to be one of substance, so we're creating it from scratch.
What is Mystic Punk, exactly?
I tapped into some common themes that run through my favorite bands, movies, comics and television shows and came up with those criteria. This is what I'm looking for in literature and I think the rest of us are too:


Minorities! Why does "Urban Fantasy" have to be so white and hetero? It's so DULL. There is no URBAN environment in the world that is exclusively white and heterosexual. I simply don't get it!

Mysticism! This is not a religious book. This is a book that explores the connection between YOU and YOUR SPIRIT, or the characters and their spirits. All religions seek to make a connection with the divine but I don't fit in with any mainstream religion. Neither do most people in our age group. The fastest growing religion, in the U. S., is non-religious. But that doesn't mean we aren't interested in the spiritual.

Ambiguity! I'm tired of stories that exist with only one thing to talk about: which boy should she date, the hot one or the REALLY hot one? We seek to create stories that readers can share with their friends, have different understandings and communicate their understandings with each other. We want to make reading a communal activity the way other art is!

A Punk Edge and Aesthetic! These stories look and feel like the counter culture it gets it's name from, like Cyber Punk. It is anti-authoritarian, individualistic, counter culture and even a bit confrontational. Plus, you know, weird hair, boys in make up, girls in fishnet stockings, ripped jeans, etc.

Music! Music is one of the most precious mystical experiences we can have. Writers often use music to help them build the worlds in their head but we, the mystic punk anthology, seeks to put the music back out into the world through our stories.

Hidden Faces! This is a unique visual cue; like goggles in Steam Punk. The faces can be hidden behind a mask, face paint or environmental elements such as smoke.
That's it! That's all it takes! 
What We Need:
We need $3000 to make this happen. Why do we need so much?
We're paying the authors between $100 and $300 dollars. There are currently 11 authors on board, but we are still accepting submissions. I capped the potential goal at $3000 so I could continue to attract writers and to hopefully get some who are more successful to add their names to the list.
Because we plan to self publish the book through lulu and smashwords(for the ebook) we don't need to pay up front printing costs except for the perks that you'll receive.
We'll also need to set up a website with information about the Mystic Punk anthology and advertising but this will only come out of what ever does not go to pay the contributing authors.
I am not taking a payment for editing or writing the anthology though my partner James is taking $100 for his story and $100 for editing.
Perks? What are these... Perks?
I'm so glad you asked! The perks start small and get bigger and better as the donation size increases. You can read more about them on the side bar but here is a rough breakdown:

Your name tweeted, tumbled, facebooked and more to all our fans. If you are a writer or are in a band, we'll promote your project instead of your name. If you have an indiegogo campaign, we'll plug that too!
A short story from the anthology, your pick! You can choose which story you'd like to read in various ebook formats!
A personalized thank you letter written on the back of a post card and mailed to you, signed by L. D. Robwell (myself). This will either be postcards from my box of Sandman post cards that I've never used or home made post cards in a collage style.
The full ebook!
A mystic punk soundtrack featuring songs by artists from a variety of genres that tap into some of the themes we're trying to write about. So far, Insane Poetry, Bad Mind and Divisible have all given me OKs to use their music. We're reaching out to several other artists though. It's been exciting!
An ebook with interviews with the writers! This is the ultimate in "dvd" extra's! This is a great way to learn more about the writers and their work.
A Mystic Punk art project in ebook format! Lots of art that taps into the mystic punk genre!
The full book in paper back!
An additional story by myself!
And the big one: a Hard Cover, limited edition version of the book with the extra story by myself included in the book, the books dedication to yourself or a loved one and a personalized thank you letter included in the introduction. This book will be a one of a kind collectors item!
I have over estimated my goal so I can continue to look for new writers to add to the project. If we don't meet the $3k, we'll use what ever funds we have to pay off as many of the writers as we can so we can still move the book forward. If we don't raise enough to pay the writers, we'll issue refunds. 
The $40 perk comes with a paper back copy of the book, why is it so expensive?
This is an unfortunate side effect of budgeting. I wanted to pay the contributors, with the price we've set we can meet our goals by selling about 100 copies, how ever, that will cost about $1000 dollars more. We're hoping that more people will preorder the ebook to help lower the actual prodcution costs. With e-books, the only cost is paying the writers for their work. With physical copies, we have to have them printed and then shipped, which costs a decent amount. 
What's going in the book, so far?

An introduction to the anthology and the new genre by L. D. Robwell
(title pending) by L. D. Robwell
(title pending) by James O'Neil
Aperture by Andrew Henderson
Ocean by H. C. Bunn
Fire Crest by Anastasia Olashaya-Grill
Shades of Color by Jennifer R. Povey
(title pending) by Christian Crews
Cloud Nine by J.L. Knight
Enhance by David Herbert
Lifelong Joy in Dreamland City by Bartholomew Klick
Reflections by R.L. Sentance
The Bowery by Darron Parker
(title pending) by Jamie Kelly
Why should you care about this new genre and my writing career?
Even though I am a white, heterosexual male, I tend to write minorities of various stripes. The novel I am currently writing is about a teenage black lesbian who rejects society, including her family, because of sexist and homophobic attitudes. It is a YA novel set in the near future.
We need stories like this because it more accurately reflects the world we live in. Although women and gay characters are getting more attention there are other types of minorities, such as religious groups, the neurologically different, queer minorities who are not simply gay (such as asexuals, transgender men/women, bisexuals), mental and physically handicapped and more. Mystic Punk wants to put these kinds of people into the forefront of modern American fantasy literature.
The stories also ask important questions about reality and the human experience. These are not simple adventure stories, they are complex and emotional views into various truths that the authors have in their hearts.
I am a budding writer and when I was told that agents and publishers do not like to hear "this is a new genre" or "this isn't like anything else that's out there" they usually cringe. I don't blame them. But I was in a pinch because my writing did seem to be in a new genre. I could point to a few books that were close to the right genre but nothing matched perfectly. My coeditor, a good friend of mine named James O'Neil, and I talked the problem out. We came to the conclusion that releasing my own stories would not be enough to set a precedent. I could have done all that for free through smash words but we wanted something more, something bigger.
We decided on an anthology. The funds that we raise go to pay the contributing authors and to pay for the perks. That's it. The more we raise, the more stories we can have in our anthology and the stronger the book will be. That's why we need you.
If we can pull this off, we'll have set a precedent for the publishing industry that fights back against the bland, white, heterosexual and trope filled world of Urban Fantasy. I love Buffy the Vampire Slayer but it seems that the genre hasn't done much since then to warrant it's massive presence. Publishers are currently in a mode that they'll primarily only invest in things that have established markets. We're creating that market. We're helping science fiction and fantasy authors who are tired of being told that a book needs a vampire or romance love interest.
I've been unemployed for several years and have recently gone back to school. By helping me publish this anthology you are helping to open a world where the kinds of stories I like can be published without lengthy meetings about the severe lack of market for the strange kinds of stories I want to tell.
Many of the authors who are already on board are working tirelessly to expand their writing credentials so that they can turn their passion into what they do for a living. You're helping that come true, a few hundred bucks at a time.
I want this anthology to be like the Odd Future Wolf Gang Kill Them All of the literary world. If we can pull this off, you'll be helping create an entire community of artists, not just one or two.
Other Ways You Can Help that can help just as much as a donation!
As I said before, I'm unemployed, which means that I often can't contribute to indiegogo campaigns even when I think they are amazing. If you love this concept but do not have the money, there are three simple ways you can help and one of them will help you earn some money!
You can also tell everybody you know about this project! Indiegogo even makes it easy for you to do this by providing share tools that will help you pass the link along through social media sites. Blogging about our new genre is a big help too.
Finally, and this one would be a huge help, if you send an email to writers you like who are not as famous as they should be, and tell them that they should get in on this, you would be helping us out a lot. Having an author with a decent sized name would help us out a lot.

story:
My Story

My name is Reggie, and I am following my dreams of becoming an author. The name of my first young adult novel is The Power Chronicles. Since I can remember, I've had the wildest imagination a boy could possibly have. 

Now, I'm stepping out to put those ideas in writing to share with everyone who is willing to take this journey with me. 


My Novel

My first novel is about a young man that has abilities that allow him to do things he should not be able to do. He goes on a quest to find his father who may be the key to unlocking all the questions he has about himself. During this quest he learns he is not the only one searching for his father, and most importantly, he isn't the only one that has "powers". 


What Is Needed 

Being a first time writer, I never knew what it would take to get your ideas off the ground. I have one part down and that is creating a good quality story. 

The part I need help on is hiring a "professional" editor ($1500-$2500) to edit, refine concepts, fine-tune, and pre-wash the manuscript before it's finally presented to a publisher. 

It is my goal to present publishers the best work possible. Your donations would help me get this done. 

Other expenses include, research (money spent on books), creating a quality website ($300-$750) to peek interest before publishing and professional drawn artwork ($300-$500). Even though this type of artwork is not cheap, I believe it is necessary in creating a fan base or following. 

By helping me with my vision, YOU CAN be apart of something that can possibly turn out to be great. This could be the beginning of a whole new series of books. 


PERKS!

I have some exclusive PERKS for those who donate!


Other Ways You Can Help

Sharing this on your Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, Wordpress, or any other avenues to help spread the word would be great!



Thank you so much,

Reggie Davis

Writer
