story:
Agency Philosophy

"Providing environments where children and adults with developmental disabilities and autism live, work, and play in their community."

In 1980, Smithwright was founded on the philosophy of "Fostering Human Potential." During our over 30 years of service, the goal of this agency has been to provide a safe, structured living environment for our developmentally disabled clients, while at the same time promoting a positive atmosphere which fosters personal independence, a sense of meaning and purpose and a true understanding of self-worth.

The Staff and Board of Directors are also committed to the valued outcome of community integration.

To accomplish this, we seek to provide multiple opportunities for our clients to interact with neighbors and businesses in our community.

The need for a van is crucial to help the kids and adults get out and experience these opportunities in the communities. Right now, employees use their own cars, and can't truly enjoy many things as a group.

Your contributions will be used help enhance the quality of life for so many of our family! 

If you can't personally donate, we are always looking for corporate sponsors for our yearly fundraiser. For more information on that, please visit www.smithwright.org and contact us for more information. If serving on the board interests you, we are always looking for caring individuals.

Thank you for your consideration!

story:
EXTRA PERK I will send any contributor the first chapter of the book!

 Here is what folks are saying:


"I read the chapter.  You really have a talent for writing in the same way that you would speak.  I can really hear your voice, your sense of humour.  I know that’s not easy. S. Nussbaum."

Help me make it to $400 today and $500 by this weekend. Your support is inspiration and is making me sit down and finish this book. If we can make it to $500 this weekend- I will release chapter 2.

 

Recent Radio Interview with me on Brooklyn College Radio

http://sexandpolitics.podbean.com/2012/09/20/the-difference-between-sins-and-felonies-john-edwards-trial/

 

Short Summary

June 6th, 2011 I received a call from Iceberg News asking if I would cover the hearing of John Edwards, he has just been indicted by the Grand Jury. I was so excited when I got off the phone I turned to my wife and said, "I just got a call from Everywhere, they want me to cover the John Edwards," I paused, "Didn't he kill somebody or something like that?"

This book from the point of view of a guy who wrote a few small time non fiction books, worked as a telephone psychic and who found himself in a media frenzy covering the historical trial of Senator John Edwards, once presidential candidate.

I was there, and this is my story.

The background is based upon a trial that took over a year to complete. I sat everyday at my chosen place on the bench, with pen in hand and a red notebook with the words inscribed over and over on the cover, "All Work and No Play Makes Jack a Dull Boy."

"So John," asked the girl from the Rox Affiliate,"What "J" school did you go to?"

"Oh no, I'm not Jewish, just a recovering Catholic," I chuckled.

" No, silly, I meant what Journalism school did you go to?" she asked again.

" I never went to any journalism school, I went to an arts school and then got a degree in psychology."

She looked incredulous. " So how did you get this big assignment with Iceberg?"

"They found me on LinkedIn."

She shook her head in awe," Who ever finds a job on LinkedIn? I did it the hard way I guess."

 

My first concept of this book was going to be a straight recollection of what happened from a documentary point of view of what really happened at the John Edwards trial, but I even got bored writing it. I decided at 4:00 AM one morning that it would be far more interesting to write the story as a semi-fictional tale. I have numerous notebooks with notes of every court hearing that occured from the Grand Jury Indictment to the final moment when the jury read out the results of their deliberations.

I had some agents interested in the original version of the book, but they wanted cold boring facts about campaign finance, and PACS and SuperPacs, ect... This is really not me at all. I have written 12 non fiction books and numerous articles, not to mention my coverage with Bloomberg News, the NY TIMES and Reuters.

I also have experience with self publishing, as I am a freelance ghost writer, who has helped dozens of writers self publish their own masterpieces, so I know the industry quite well.

Many people in the United States, and around the world in fact, are looking at how elections are run and the integrity of our future world leaders. This was a landmark trial that explored both- money and sex. There have been a couple of other books written about John Edwards concerning his affair- one by his assistant and now the other by his mistress. Aren't we tired of the self serving crap? The "Rimless Wheel Conspiracy," while funny also drives some hard truths home about how men in power behave, how people with money lose all reason. and what sleeping with a woman you just met in a bar can cost you. If we can't laugh about it, we will just get pissed off.

 

Here’s what I need and what you’ll receive:

My Estimate:

Printing: $10,000 (220 pages/5,000 copies)

Editing & Proofreading: $3,000

Publicist: $6,000

Cover Art: $2000

Typesetting: $2,000

Print Production & Shipping: $2,000

 

What You Get

Please choose from these expressions of appreciation for your generous support!

Priceless: You will help me create a historical book that will serve as a warning to current and future politicians to clean up their acts, unless they wish to face losing not only their reputations, but their freedom, money, and most importantly their families.

EXTRA BONUS PERK: Now, EVERYONE contributing to this campaign will receive a "Sneak Preview" chapter from the my upcoming book, "The Rimless Wheel Conspiracy."

$10 Donation:  A personal “thank you” e-mail from me and a digital download of The Rimless Wheel Conspiracy when it is released.

$25 Donation: An autographed copy of the, The Rimless Wheel Conspiracy, written with your name and signed by yours truly. A personal thank you email from me.

$25 Donation:  Digital download of The Rimless Wheel Conspiracy with an signed autograph with your name. (Yes this is possible)  Plus a personal “thank you” e-mail from me. 

$35 Donation: A personally handwritten “Thank You” note written on paper from the journals used to take notes in the trial. plus your choice of and autographed copy of the digital or paperback version of Rimless Wheel Conspiracy Plus two "Sneak Preview" chapters of The Rimless Wheel Conspiracy!

$50 Donation: A copy of the book (both versions), a printed and signed set of photos from the first day of the trial taken by me that were never published. A personal “thank you” e-mail from me.

$100 Donation: A first edition, autographed, advance copy of The Rimless Wheel Conspiracy This will be a special edition with special cover(HARD COVER).  Shipped to you prior to the official release date.

$250 Donation: Your name, listed as a Sponsor on the Acknowledgments page of the book, The Rimless Wheel Conspiracy. Plus a personal "thank you" e-mail from me and signed photos from the first day of the trial. Plus an autographed copy (print or electronic public version)  

$350 Donation: Your name, listed as a Sponsor on the Acknowledgments page of the book, The Rimless Wheel Conspiracy. Plus an autographed advance copy of the book (special edition)(HARD COVER). The photos, plus a personal "thank you" e-mail from me.

$500 Donation: Your name, listed as a Sponsor on the Acknowledgments page of The Rimless Wheel Conspiracy, plus three autographed advance copies of the book for gifting to friends! (special edition) (HARD COVER)

$1000 Donation: The actual coveted red "All Work and No Play Makes Jack a Dull Boy," notebook that was used during the trial. Plus your name listed as a Sponsor on the Acknowledgments page of The Rimless Wheel Conspiracy. Plus an autographed, advance copy of the book. (HARD COVER)

$1000 Donation: You will have a cameo appearance in the book- you were there right? Impress your friends, make your spouse begin to ask questions of where you were that day. Plus your name listed as a Sponsor on the Acknowledgments page of The Rimless Wheel Conspiracy. Plus an autographed, advance copy of the book. (special edition) (HARD COVER)

$2500 Donation: A copy of a sketch made by the court sketch artist during the trial of the key journalists that were there. This was made special for those journalist (yes, yours truly was one) It has the signatures of the journalists next to their faces.  Plus your name listed as a Sponsor on the Acknowledgments page of The Rimless Wheel Conspiracy. Plus an autographed, advance copy of the book. (special edition)

(HARD COVER) 

There are many other expenses that go into creating and marketing a book. I am the sole source of income in my family, and so while I really want this book to make it into the world- I have a wife, two teenage daughters and a nine month old son to answer to. Any funds overage contributions will go into marketing this book and spreading the word.

 

 

The Impact

I am a freelance writer and like many people in the United States I find myself raising a family on my own, without any assistance, and no health insurance. Much of this is due to our current adminstration, and it is my hope, that with your help, that I can finish this book that will say " Hey you guys in Washington, it's not ok to act like Neanderthals. It is not right to pile up all of our hard earned money like Daffy Duck, and say, 'It's mine, mine, all mine.' You can't just fleece America, act morally irreprehensible and get away with it. You will have to answer to us- your bosses."

This book is about sex, greed, and power and how when combined make the modern politician. Enough is enough, and this book will take a serious , yet satirical look, at modern campaigning practices, and how power, money and hormones can make educated men act really stupid.

I have 12 published non fiction books, that even after 4 years are selling moderately well. I know what it takes to get a book self published, because I help people do that every day.  Here are some examples:

http://www.amazon.com/John-N.-Peragine/e/B001JP0XU2

http://articles.chicagotribune.com/2012-05-27/business/sns-rt-usa-northcarolinagayl1e8gr0y2-20120527_1_peaceful-protest-great-big-large-fence-gays

http://www.nytimes.com/2012/01/14/us/politics/edwards-needs-heart-surgery-delaying-trial.html

http://www.bloomberg.com/news/2012-04-12/john-edwards-faces-hometown-jury-in-campaign-finance-trial.html

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

$350 Donation: Your name, listed as a Sponsor on the Acknowledgments page of the book, The Rimless Wheel Conspiracy. Plus an autographed advance copy of the book (special edition)(HARD COVER). The photos, plus a personal "thank you" e-mail from me.
$500 Donation: Your name, listed as a Sponsor on the Acknowledgments page of The Rimless Wheel Conspiracy, plus three autographed advance copies of the book for gifting to friends! (special edition) (HARD COVER)
$1000 Donation: The actual coveted red "All Work and No Play Makes Jack a Dull Boy," notebook that was used during the trial. Plus your name listed as a Sponsor on the Acknowledgments page of The Rimless Wheel Conspiracy. Plus an autographed, advance copy of the book. (HARD COVER)
$1000 Donation: You will have a cameo appearance in the book- you were there right? Impress your friends, make your spouse begin to ask questions of where you were that day. Plus your name listed as a Sponsor on the Acknowledgments page of The Rimless Wheel Conspiracy. Plus an autographed, advance copy of the book. (special edition) (HARD COVER)
$2500 Donation: A copy of a sketch made by the court sketch artist during the trial of the key journalists that were there. This was made special for those journalist (yes, yours truly was one) It has the signatures of the journalists next to their faces.  Plus your name listed as a Sponsor on the Acknowledgments page of The Rimless Wheel Conspiracy. Plus an autographed, advance copy of the book. (special edition)
(HARD COVER) 
There are many other expenses that go into creating and marketing a book. I am the sole source of income in my family, and so while I really want this book to make it into the world- I have a wife, two teenage daughters and a nine month old son to answer to. Any funds overage contributions will go into marketing this book and spreading the word.
 
 
The Impact


I am a freelance writer and like many people in the United States I find myself raising a family on my own, without any assistance, and no health insurance. Much of this is due to our current adminstration, and it is my hope, that with your help, that I can finish this book that will say " Hey you guys in Washington, it's not ok to act like Neanderthals. It is not right to pile up all of our hard earned money like Daffy Duck, and say, 'It's mine, mine, all mine.' You can't just fleece America, act morally irreprehensible and get away with it. You will have to answer to us- your bosses."
This book is about sex, greed, and power and how when combined make the modern politician. Enough is enough, and this book will take a serious , yet satirical look, at modern campaigning practices, and how power, money and hormones can make educated men act really stupid.
I have 12 published non fiction books, that even after 4 years are selling moderately well. I know what it takes to get a book self published, because I help people do that every day.  Here are some examples:
http://www.amazon.com/John-N.-Peragine/e/B001JP0XU2
http://articles.chicagotribune.com/2012-05-27/business/sns-rt-usa-northcarolinagayl1e8gr0y2-20120527_1_peaceful-protest-great-big-large-fence-gays
http://www.nytimes.com/2012/01/14/us/politics/edwards-needs-heart-surgery-delaying-trial.html
http://www.bloomberg.com/news/2012-04-12/john-edwards-faces-hometown-jury-in-campaign-finance-trial.html
 
 


Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!


And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Our Story

I am a poet and the author of me and Nina, a 2010 Kinereth Gensler manuscript award, which is due out this month. At 58, me and Nina is my debut poetry collection, a milestone I have been working towards for a very long time.  In March, I have the opportunity to feature me and Nina at the Association of Writers and Writing Programs (AWP) conference in Chicago. AWP is one of the largest and most influential literary communities in the U.S. To cover my travel and living expenses for four days, I am asking for your donation.  


The Impact

At AWP, the opportunity exists for me and Nina to be heard by thousands.  With this call I also have the chance to reach out and give back to fellow writers and readers of poetry.


Writing for "The Library Journal," Karla Huston states that the collection, "...gives readers poems in concert and communion with soul great Nina Simone--like "two souls in a duet." While Simone's songs are a fusion of gospel, pop, and classical music, Hand's poems are a fusion of free verse, blues, torch songs, and songs of the tortured, many with formal elements and many cases using her own original forms...These poems deal with hard times, poverty, violence, the abuse of power, and abused dreams."   


Participating at AWP could lead to additional engagements and creative collaborations.


What We Need & What You Get

My campaign goal is $1000.  This would cover AWP registration fee, airfare and baggage fees from New York to Chicago, shared hotel accommodations, food, and ground transportation. Any funds I am unable to raise, I will attempt to borrow.  What you get:  writing services (see perks )and my extreme gratitude.   Go to "Made by Hand" facebook page to view my hand made books.


Other Ways You Can Help


Spread the word, share with your friends, and send "me and Nina" manifestations of safe travels.

story:
This book has been a labor of love and a God dream from the very start. What began with a simple blog, http://lindasunporch.blogspot.com/  became a daily devotional written for my church. This devotional was co-written by me and my two pastors, Pastor Brian Law and Pastor Geoff Geyer. We wanted our church to have a special book to read together - Summer Reading 2013. We wrote a devotional book that focuses on what we call "The Journey" - 5 intentional habits that follow how Jesus lived His life on earth: prayer, study, worship, service and connection. Our book also encourages the reader to not just read about these habits, but challenges them to put them into action in their lives and to also journal about that action. We printed the book ourselves and handed it out to our congregation at the beginning of June. The response has been amazing and very positive. Many people sent notes, cards, messages and told me in person how much this book has meant to them. Several people suggested we should get the book published so more people could be touched by it as well.

I never planned to be a writer, but God had other plans for me! He has shown me that He can do amazing things THROUGH the people who trust Him enough to obey and follow his guidance. I believe God has moved me to write and has given me the talent and will to write and share God with others around the world.

Publishing is a difficult business to break into. I used to think that you wrote a book, sent it to several publishers and MAYBE one would like it enough to publish it and pay you for your work. Well, it isn't quite that simple now. In order to get established as a publishable writer, you have to publish. Unfortunately, publishing on your own costs money.  I have found a publisher who is interested in publishing this book at a cost of $4000. That seems like a fortune to me, and without help from my friends and supporters, it will continue to be just a dream.

I have signed a contract with 5 Fold Media, a Christian publisher out of Syracuse, New York. If I raise the funds to pay my portion of the co-publishing fees, they have committed to publishing my book and helping to promote it. The book will go through two editing sessions and I will be responsible for making changes they suggest. There is the possibility, I suppose that I will not complete the suggestions they make, but I feel that is a VERY slim possibility! Author training is also part of my 5 Fold Media contract, so they will help me succeed. I feel God leading me through every step of this project, giving me the courage, wisdom and guidance and support I need to move forward. "With Christ, all things are possible!" There is no guarantee that my book will become popular and sell as many copies as I would like to see so that the Living the Journey Day by Day  message touches as many hearts as it can. But, I am confident that I have done my part to obey God's call to me and where it goes from here is up to Him!

Please consider giving to the "Living the Journey Day by Day" project! You will be part of making this God dream come true!

THANK YOU!

story:
The Long Road Home
One woman's true story of reclaiming her life along the legendary Camino de Santiago

When Alesa sets off on a 500-mile pilgrimage across Spain known as the Camino de Santiago, she can’t yet fully express why she would undertake such a challenging trek. All she knows is she needs to get far, far away from her pain and everything she knows … an irretrievably broken marriage, a traumatic bout with cancer, a deep river of depression leaving her little desire to even continue living and isolating her further from her beloved teenage daughter. Desperate to reconcile her past and find meaning again, she sells her business and abandons her life for five weeks to walk the Camino with just a backpack and a prayer. Little did she know that something had to die on the journey in order for her to really live again.

Author's Bio:

Alesa and her twin were born in a small town in the wilds of Wyoming where antelope outnumber people 1,000 to 1. Soon a brother came along whom they could torment by dressing him up as a girl as often as possible. Despite their best efforts, he remains as manly as ever. When she wasn't torturing her brother, Alesa enjoyed writing every day, and in fact, she won a Young Author's Award in junior high. Somewhere along the road to adulthood, she gave up her dreams of writing creatively to pursue the corporate dream. After stepping into the telecommunications world where she wrote technical publications, the dot-com bubble burst and she jumped into another hot market: real estate. We all know what happened there! That is when she decided owning a coffee shop could be really awesome. And it was. For five years, she enjoyed being her own boss. Always brave, she is now fearlessly authoring her first book, raising a teenage daughter, and hoping to inspire others to live their dreams unashamedly and unafraid.



Notes from Alesa

This book will be an inspiration to anyone who has ever felt less-than someone else, depressed, oppressed, ashamed, or any other equally debilitating feeling. After I walked the Camino, I realized I had gone there for many reasons. All of them having to do with an area of my life I needed to either see differently, forgive, or just plain let go of. Hanging on to some that old grief, though I didn't necessarily know I still carried it, wasn't helping me dig out of my deep-rooted depression. I hid it very well, though. Most of us do.

This memoir is about my journey on the Camino de Santiago, during which, I processed the loss of my great love of 18 years while suffering a debilitating depression combined with a battle with cancer. Bruised and bewildered, I fought to maintain a facade of serenity while running my business and subjecting myself to the public eye. This caused moments of panic induced anxiety. I don't cry. I mean, never. The need to spontaneously emote in great quantities frightened the daylights out of me. The only option for me was to go away, go somewhere, anywhere where I could safely process my emotions away from anyone I felt would judge me. Yes, many walls were torn down along The Way.

Prior to embarking on this great adventure, familial influences had begun to take root. Maybe I just needed to become happy! (oh, is that all?) So I could find the right Husband or the right career. Aha! The more I thought about my families attitudes and their ultimate affect on my well-being, the more I felt inadequate. Finally, bucking their ideas in my traditional, rebellious sort of attitude, I threw my hands up and abandoned everything. I sold my business, made arrangements for my daughter's care and took off for five weeks to walk 500 miles across Spain by myself in an attempt to find answers.

I was unprepared for the healing that started in the most bizarre ways from my first night in Spain until the last. This memoir will inspire people as they follow me through some unexpected spiritual experiences and self-discoveries along the way. I hope to reach as many people who battle some of the demons I had. Will you help me?



What I Need & What You Get

Well, what's next? It's written and that is only the first step. Your support will help me bring this project to life. I focused on writing. My only goal was to finish the book. Now the manuscript is done but the costs are mounting to publish. I hope to raise $7,900 for this uplifting book. I plan to have it ready for publishing and marketing by mid-January! To make sure I stay on track with my self-imposed deadline, I am already scheduling reading events at local coffee shops and bookstores for late January!

This is where you come in. I need a few Angel sponsors who can help me create the cover, and get it ready for print and on-line publishing. Then, I'll need to publish, print, and market them. This requires converting the documents into other e-book formats for Amazon's Kindle, Barnes and Nobles' Nook, and the ibook, etc. If you are willing to sponsor this book, I will be forever grateful to you! Let's spread this story to anyone who has ever felt less-than adequate in any way!


Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to help but can't make a monetary contribution, don't despair, there are other ways to help. You can share this Indiegogo campaign by spreading the word on Facebook or other social medias. Tell a friend or family member about my campaign. I thank you for your assistance.

story:
Short Summary

Imagine a media company which centered diverse and marginalized points of view, designed from the ground up to tell more stories in more compelling ways, using every platform at the Internet’s disposal. Imagine a place where people could have coffee with journalists, contribute easily to the news, and form a community of like-minded bridge builders both online and in real-time. Welcome to TribeHerald. A new family of media properties for people who want to “know more about more.”

TribeHerald Media, LLC was founded in 2020 by Yitz Jordan (Y-LOVE) and Rabbi Shais Rishon (MaNishtana), two African-American Jewish activists who have been executing programming in the Jewish community for over 15 years. Yitz is a hip-hop artist, the first hip-hop artist to come out as gay mid-career and the first to come out as a faith-based musician, and a web developer who brings over twenty years coding experience to his role. MaNishtana is a three-time published author and international speaker on topics of Jewish diversity and black Jewish experience, his latest release “Ariel Samson: Freelance Rabbi” was a top seller on Amazon upon its release.

We are creating the first news outlet to tell our readers what the world means to them, in their diverse communities, in their languages. Our hybrid subscription/advertising model, prevalent in digital publishing, promotes longevity, and our location promotes our positioning as the face of journalism “in the hood”.

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise $75,000 for capital equipment purchases and furniture to get our space off the ground and to make the best environment we can for our reporters and our customers. And we want our contributors to be the first to benefit:

  • For $100, receive our undying thanks, a one-year subscription to TribeHerald’s properties, and priority access to TribeHerald’s app when it’s released.
  • For $250, receive everything at the $100 level for two years, get access to all members-only content via all the sites and apps, as well as invitations to TribeHerald members-only events for the first two years. You’ll also get a cool TribeHerald tote bag.
  • For $1000 (limit 100), receive everything at the $250 level, plus a custom verse and video from Y-LOVE thanking you for your investment. You’ll receive a TribeHerald T-shirt (please specify size), as well as an invitation to a special Founders’ only event on launch day.
  • For $2500 (limit 40), receive everything at the $1000 level, plus a TribeHerald branded laptop or other electronic device. You'll also get a special shoutout on TribeHerald.com for one year following launch.

The Impact

Media representation matters. It matters in Disney and it matters in movies. It matters in commercials and it matters in sitcoms. And, while much attention has been given to newsroom diversity, news too often consists of the same stories – told by different people. TribeHerald looks to center a different group of stories, stories that affect our communities, stories from our communities, stories told from a perspective of bridge building and diversity. Stories told from angles that no one else is asking about. And we think our stories are important enough to be told.

Y-LOVE has been a senior developer at Quartz for six years, and has been writing for 15 years on issues of diversity and struggles against racism and anti-Semitism. MaNishtana has been a writer and an editor for over a decade, and brings his unique perspective – of a life lived at the intersection of African-American culture and Orthodox Judaism – to all of his acclaimed content.

Risks & Challenges

Since our main revenue streams will come from our utilization of the space for events, co-working and other bridge building and networking activities, any downturn in the neighborhood in which we are located could negatively affect our business. Also, a decline in subscriptions or sharp downturn in traffic could also negatively impact our bottom line.

Other Ways You Can Help
Venmo: @tribeherald
PayPal: https://PayPal.Me/tribeherald

Support us with Bitcoin: 1H8CN6k1vueQYjysBjSjGBKQZbyDofsyH9
Ethereum: 0x511af7d71a251fcfbc694b7b282f49e0c7d62adf
Litecoin: LbM9dK3r1ZtToYg2MsS2YCPAmpLVsXdj9E

Can’t invest in us at all right now? No problem! Don’t forget to share – and remember, we’ll be taking donations on social media and our websites as well.

Thank you! And share, share, share!

Thank you! And share, share, share!

story:
Story of My Book

My name is Nikki Groom and I am the author of A Power of Your Own: How to Ignite Your Potential, Uncover Your Purpose, and Blaze Your Own Trail in Life & Business (previously titledYour Story is Your Message), a non-fiction book that speaks primarily to women business owners, but also to anyone who has ever felt underestimated because of who they are and who the world says they should be. 

I wrote this book because I believe our world is indisputably better when we decide to become more powerful in the way that we see ourselves and each other, and use our collective strength to build a future that is worthy of all of us. 

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover what it means to not only own your inner power, but also be inspired to make a bigger impact - no matter what it takes or what other people might say. 

Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool: to help you uncover your purpose and align it with the core mission of your business or work to create a life that is impactful and meaningful. 

In this book, you'll learn powerful strategies for:

  • Igniting your highest potential so you can live a life that honors the truth of who you are
  • Uncovering your purpose so you can spend your days engaged in work that is deeply fulfilling 
  • Getting into action without letting fear or perfectionism get in your way

You will love this book if you have a vision for a better future, but are hesitant to embrace that - or perhaps don’t believe you have what it takes.

This book will reflect back to you the possibilities, and remind you - over and over again - that you matter, your voice matters, your work matters, and we need you on this planet... now more than at any other time in history.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press in July, 2020.

I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book.

Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in July, 2020
  • The cover design of my book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The copyediting for my book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The launch and promotion efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this in the summer


When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your name will appear in a special Acknowledgements section of my book (“with special thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • Exclusive access to a workshop where I’ll share my experience of writing the book, and inspire you to write your own
  • And more...

 

About the Author

Nikki Groom is a business, brand and marketing strategist and the creator of the Movement Makers Mastermind: a business growth accelerator for budding change makers and entrepreneurs. Hailed as “a force of nature” and “a rising superstar”, Nikki is on a mission to help women entrepreneurs recognize their worthiness, own their power, and amplify their impact - without checking their integrity at the door. Nikki is the host of the Movement Makers podcast, founder of The 100 Stories Worth Telling Project, and acts as an adviser for social entrepreneurs and enterprises. She has been involved in dozens of projects and partnerships that focus on empowering women in business. Learn more at nikkigroom.com.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, that doesn't mean that you can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #YourStoryIsYourMessage and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my pre-sale campaign page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. You can do this as a text message or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

With gratitude,
Nikki Groom

story:
Why Hair & Self Acceptance?

Self Acceptance is a habit. It can form at any age. It simply requires a healthy celebration of self.

We seek media that projects images of us back to ourselves. This is why representation matters. My Dear Queen is about more than representation. It provides a message of self love.

This year, I'm becoming a first-time father. This journey makes me realize the love and strength I want to pass to my unborn child. We haven't had the gender reveal yet, but if I have a daughter, I hope she foregoes the struggle with adoring her hair that her aunt and I have experienced. This hope led to me writing a poem that I realize needs to be a book for not just my daughter, but for every daughter.

Every woman deserves to know her hair is her crown and she is a queen.

Joy Donnell is on board to creative direct and artist Yetunde Sapp is creating the visual illustrations. This funding will pay for the 15 pages of original artistic visuals and the materials needed to complete the artwork in the book.

Why An Illustrated Book?

These illustrations go beyond Colorism and Texturism to showcase beauty and hair in a completely different way. Yetunde Sapp combines warm colors and mixed media to present an almost aura-effect that isn't centered on skintone. She highlights this with freestyle kinetic ink that gives each illustration a unique beauty that is thoughtful, glorious and engaging.

Yetunde's style and application honors the intention for all daughters, regardless of their skintone or hair texture, to embrace Self Acceptance.

The Impact

Our stories are more than stories. Our stories become our beliefs which become our reality. The stories we share can heal.

We hope this book will help heal those who need healing and fortify those who need fortifying. This book is intended for young and grown alike. There are few things are freeing as loving yourself for the unique expression of life you are. If that is strong enough, mixed messages from media and society don't matter.

This video showcases a round table read and discussion we had in Los Angeles, CA around the book and self acceptance. We believe this book can be used as a tool for open discussion and growth for women of all ages.
 
 

Risks & Challenges

I've put together a team of dedicated professional creators and artists. I have a creative director and visual artist who are both skilled in smooth fulfillment to backers. I've had successful crowdfunds in the past and readily maintain fluid communication throughout the process. Should something unforeseen and unavoidable occur, I will maintain transparency with all backers to fully deliver the campaign.

Other Ways You Can Help

Get the word out! Sharing this campaign through social media and email makes a BIG difference. We appreciate you taking time to share. Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

About Lawrence Charles

 

Lawrence Charles is a publicist, writer, former E! TV personality and father-to-be. As a professional publicist with a background in events at some of the top nightlife and hospitality establishments in the US, Lawrence has keen insight in storytelling, strategy and pitching the media.

About Yetunde Sapp

Yetunde Sapp is an artist based in Los Angeles, CA. She uses mixed media, pop culture, modern techniques and Old World reverence to create commentary about society, celebrate beauty and forge new narratives.

About Joy Donnell

Joy Donnell is a media entrepreneur dedicated to creating media that increases humanity. She owns Parajin Media where she combines publicity, branded and content strategy to create and launch  branded content campaigns with major brands. Most of her campaigns have gone viral, generating over a 1 Billion media impressions each on average. Joy also builds media platforms focused on entertainment, society, pop culture and luxury. She speaks internationally about branded, media and entrepreneurship best practice with recent engagements at UCLA, Mount Saint Mary's University, United State of Women and LA Women's International Film Festival.

story:
Story of My Book

College Admissions of Guilt: How the Underserved Student Can Still Succeed in Higher Ed is a comprehensive college prep course in book form, offering guidance on all things collegiate (from choosing a school to navigating graduation). This book is more than self-help, as it is the personal story of a black transracial adoptee going through undergrad during the Trump Administration, and the mistakes made and lessons learned along the way. And don’t just take my word for it, as I’ve compiled the advice of EdTech CEOs, college presidents, award-winning professors, and Ivy League alumni on how to navigate academia as a lower-income, nonwhite, and/or first-generation college student.

My name is Noah Fenstermacher and I am the author of College Admissions of Guilt. I wrote this book because, as someone in all three of these subgroups, I am uniquely positioned to help navigate the higher education process. We often ‘don’t know what we don’t know' about higher education, and this book provides a guideline for some common questions asked and strategies for student success.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover the power of telling your story on paper (resume) and in-person (interview). I want you to see this book as an opportunity to engage with self-help, escape from your comfort zone, and learn alongside first-gen success stories about the importance of finding your focus in life!

In this book, you'll encounter multifaceted dimensions of intentional intersectionality and the principles of fairness in a school setting through narratives like:

Race relations are not black and white...literally. As a transracial adoptee growing up in central Pennsylvania, I get that it’s complicated. To make my point, I went out to interview some talking heads with pointed white hoods. While I absolutely don’t advise doing it yourself, read on to discover the best advice concerning race relations on campus!

I’ve always heard, “Those who can’t do teach,” but have you heard of those that "can do and teach?" I interviewed a few colorful folks though educational technology company founder and CEO Samyr Quershi offers amazing insight for those with a passion for education and a pursuit of profit.

Did you know you can “haggle” your college tuition prices like a car dealership? Okay, it’s a little more complex than that, though what I learned from Harvard alum and current Ivy League recruiter, Gaelle, sheds light on college admissions scandals and what opportunities exist in scholarships and financial aid for students like me.

You will love this book if you are an underrepresented student, an educator working with underrepresented students, or have family and friends seeking knowledge.

College Admissions of Guilt speaks to current college students and college students-to-be who want to grapple with race relations on campus and equity in education in a new way.

Ultimately, I hope that College Admissions of Guilt inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

What can I do to elevate my chances of success as a college student?

How can a better understanding of self contribute to a better campus culture?

What questions do I have about college that I hoped are answered before I attend?

I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. I believe discussing educational equity will change us all for the better.
 

The Book - College Admissions of Guilt


The book is written in 6 parts.

Part 1 contains the author’s note + chapters 1-7. You will have a better understanding of the college admissions process, how to choose your school, and a vocabulary list of words to know before you go to higher ed. We’ll delve into my Pain Point Approach to pursuing passion and profit, specifically designed for underrepresented students to get the grade and the job.

Part 2 contains chapters 8-12. We’ll go over why it’s not about the brand name of the school, but the brand behind your name as a student. We'll further discuss how to navigate the two.

You’ll read about what it means to build your own personal brand, and how one student’s path from homelessness to head of the class at Penn can help you articulate your wants and goals both in the classroom and outside of it.

Part 3 contains chapters 13-17. We'll discuss how colleges collect social capital, how you can start stockpiling early, and what that means for your internship search during your second and third years at university. You’ll also read about my first school scandal story and the lessons learned that led to my student leadership on campus.

Part 4 contains chapters 18-22. We’ll explore financial and other forms of literacy you’ll need to not only survive, but thrive on campus. In fact, building off the Pain Point Approach, you’ll find out how to possibly make one thousand dollars every two weeks!

Part 5 contains chapters 23-26. Your mind is the muscle that matters most...well, the brain’s technically an organ, but you get the point! Mental health is important. Here, we will discuss tips gathered from counselors, as well as suggest collegiate resources available.

Part 6 contains chapters 27-30. We'll bring it all together here and talk about “cause marketing your character” to better sell the story of yourself. We'll attempt to solve that permission paradox: You want to get a job right out of college, but you need experience to do so, which requires your getting a job. Then, enjoy some parting words from college presidents and state senators on how best to navigate leaving academia for “the Real World”.

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August,2021.

The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)

The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).

The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.

The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this summer.


When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.

Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.

You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.

You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.

You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

 

About the Author


Noah James T. Fenstermacher is a junior college admissions professional for Penn State University and the founder of the student success coaching company, 1st Gen Class.

A lifelong learner, Noah wrote this book to combine his passion for education and his pursuit of profitable impact, and a goal of helping other lower-income, nonwhite, first-generation college students accumulate similar wealth. He will donate ten percent of proceeds toward creating a new community college for his hometown, where he plans to provide access and resources to underfunded school districts through similar passion projects.

In his spare time, Noah enjoys civil service and serial entrepreneurship, hoping to give back to his community through future endeavors. In addition, he plans on pursuing a law degree alongside his PhD in education.

For more information, you can connect with Noah Fenstermacher at noahjtf@gmail.com.
 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please send me a private message.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #1stGenClass and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Noah James T. Fenstermacher

You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
And much more! About the Author
Noah James T. Fenstermacher is a junior college admissions professional for Penn State University and the founder of the student success coaching company, 1st Gen Class.A lifelong learner, Noah wrote this book to combine his passion for education and his pursuit of profitable impact, and a goal of helping other lower-income, nonwhite, first-generation college students accumulate similar wealth. He will donate ten percent of proceeds toward creating a new community college for his hometown, where he plans to provide access and resources to underfunded school districts through similar passion projects.In his spare time, Noah enjoys civil service and serial entrepreneurship, hoping to give back to his community through future endeavors. In addition, he plans on pursuing a law degree alongside his PhD in education.For more information, you can connect with Noah Fenstermacher at noahjtf@gmail.com. International Preorders For international preorders, please send me a private message. Risks & Challenges The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship. Other Ways You Can Help Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #1stGenClass and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.
You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.
Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!Thanks again,Noah James T. Fenstermacher

story:
I needed something new.

 

This book took shape at the beginning of our global quarantine.  In a life turned outside-in, the Psalms changed for me.  I saw poets reaching out from their personal turbulence, assuring themselves and one another of the peace that comes from expression, from art, and from God.  I made my form of art in response, and now I want to invite you in.

Ships in Small Bottles is a daisy chain of inspiration beginning with Creator and ending in a new opportunity to create.  In Ships in Small Bottles, you'll find:

  • 40 psalms,
  • each with a view of what the psalmist sees of God,
  • a poem making art from a line in the Psalm,
  • and a project for you to engage the Psalm actively. 

 

Some projects may require a trip to the craft store.  Others you can engage with only your body and breath.  However you engage, this book is an invitation to variety.  Look to that turtle in the drawings above.  Look to the ship sailing an orchid sea.  Addie Willsrud, visionary, captures the beauty of variety in all its whimsy and depth in her cover art for the book.  Let the book be your invitation to expression and play.

 

What do you need?

 

There are dozens of ways to use this book.   It can be a daily reminder to slow down, weekly craft club, re/connection with a child or a sibling or a friend.  Turn this into what you need.  Don’t want to do the art projects?  Fine.  Visualizing them can be enough.  Don’t “get” the poems?  That’s okay.  You don’t have to be the audience for every single one.  Psalms too heavy or harshly human for you in places?  You only need a verse.  Where there is a fire hose, bring your teaspoon.  Where there’s a buffet, bring your salad plate.  There’s no One Right Way to use what you find here, only an open palm saying, Take what you can use.

 

Welcome to a golden age of permission.

 

We have fresh freedom to express ourselves to God and dialogue about that relationship in ways that perhaps have never been this open.  God is available to and for every individual regardless of gender, race, class, or location.  Fewer believers are bound to sacred men speaking in sacred spaces.  Instead, materials for personal study and individual spiritual formation flood every platform.  We are a generation embracing God’s permission to approach the throne directly and personally.  And I want to mark the occasion.  I’m in the mood to celebrate.

 

We're all Ships in Small Bottles.

 

We are fabulous souls in fragile bodies, big ideas in small spaces.  If you're ready to see abundance instead of restriction in 2021, try the book.  I'm eager to put life back in your hands.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Flora Yang and I am the author of Unanswered. I wrote this book because I am compelled to share my journey of finding my true self and staying true to myself while doing so. I hope to inspire those who are pursuing their answers.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover the uncertainty, the fear, and the sense of being lost isn’t exclusive to just you. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for self-discovery. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a contribution to your own journey of self-discovery. 

In this book, you'll learn about my perspective in a relationship, moving to a new country as well as my making difficult decisions. You'll hear stories such as...

  • Where did all the unanswered questions start?
  • How did a cat inspire me to give support to others?
  • How was I changed by a biased dance?

You will love this book if you understand the feeling of being lost or confused about life, if you are pondering to leave a bad relationship or if you should take the leap of faith to enter an unknown situation.

Unanswered is a nonfiction book that speaks to people looking for an answer and those who want to look at self-discovery journeys in a new way.

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August 2021. 
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this summer.

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book ($5,000), I will publish a paperback and ebook.
When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book ($6,000), I will also publish a hardcover edition.
When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book ($8,000), I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

About the Author

Flora Yang is a life experiencer currently working as a business consultant. She is intensely curious about herself, others, and various cultures, and how they all interact in the real world. She loves travelling and experiencing different cultures first hand.

She is compelled to write because this is how she meditates, how she processes her thoughts and her experiences, and how she connects them. She is bubbling inside to share her thoughts, experiences and what she has learned in the hope that it may resonate with readers and comfort or inspire them.

She is a naturally vibrant person, energized by meeting and learning about people. She loves dancing and the feeling and energy it brings to her. She appreciates beauty in many forms from vivid sunsets or seeing the blossom and flowers in spring, to vintage clothing and jewelry or lovingly designed and crafted objects. She relaxes by learning about good food of all styles and cooking and sharing it with good friends and good conversation. 

For more information, you can connect with Flora Yang at flora@parasamgate.ca and at LinkedIn, Facebook as well as Instagram @florayang_author.
 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please send me a private message.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #unanswered and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Flora Yang

story:
LES ARBRES ET LE CIEL / TREES IN THE SKY

Objectif atteint ! 

Vous pouvez toujours réserver un livre sur cette plateforme, ou bien en prendre un le jour de sa présentation lors du vernissage de l'exposition le 17 mars.

La réalisation du livre, prise en charge par LIENART édition, s'élève à 17000 euros.

Merci encore à tous d'avoir permis à cette campagne d'atteindre son objectif de financement. 

L'argent récolté couvre exclusivement les dépenses que l'association L'Arbre en lumière engage pour ce projet. ( éditeur, traducteurs, graphistes ... )

 

L'association "L'Arbre en lumière" vous invite maintenant chaleureusement à l’exposition du 17 au 28 mars 2019 à la Salle des fêtes du Théâtre de Fontainebleau. Quelques dates :

Vernissage le 17 mars à 17h avec présentation du livre bilingue Les Arbres et le ciel / Trees and the Sky

Rencontre avec le poète Jean-Pierre Lemaire le vendredi 22 mars à 19h : "L'appel muet du monde"

Rencontre avec le peintre Alexandre Hollan le dimanche 24 mars à 16h : "L'arbre est invisible"

 

Deux artistes en résidence en forêt de Fontainebleau

A travers le regard d'un poète et d'un peintre, la forêt de Fontainebleau révèle toute sa beauté et son mystère. La plume de Jean-Pierre Lemaire et le pinceau de Mathieu Wührmann renouvellent la vision d'un espace d'une singularité exceptionnelle. Une exposition et la publication d'un livre d'art sont au cœur de ce projet. C'est notre association "l'Arbre en lumière" qui en est à l'origine.

"L'Arbre en lumière" est une association à but non lucratif qui a pour but de créer, promouvoir ou soutenir des événements culturels en lien avec la peinture et la poésie. Elle fait connaître et accompagne des artistes qui, par leurs œuvres ou leur origine, ont un lien avec Fontainebleau et sa région et dont les œuvres s'inspirent librement de la thématique de l'arbre.

Edition du livre Les Arbres et le ciel - Trees in the sky

Le livre sera intégralement bilingue. Sa réalisation est prise en charge par les éditions LIENART.

23x25 cm, 128 pages, 80 illustrations couleurs, couverture à rabats, broché, cahiers cousus collés.

Prix de vente public : 25 €

Un extrait de la maquette du livre: 

 

Exposition au théâtre de Fontainebleau - Mars 2019

(vue de l'exposition "Portraits d'arbres", Fontainebleau 2017)

Le livre paraîtra à l'occasion d'une exposition qui commencera le dimanche 17 mars 2019 et se terminera le vendredi 29 mars au soir. Vous pourrez également y découvrir le travail d'Alexandra Serrano, photographe, qui présentera des œuvres issues de sa série "Nesting in the Wolf Tree". 

 

 

(Photographies d'Alexandra Serrano)

Nos partenaires 

En devenant partenaire, votre logo apparaîtra sur une page réservée dans le livre. 

Ils nous soutiennent déjà :

L'INSEAD, Le "Printemps des poètes"

L'Hôtel L'Aigle Noir, l'Hôtel Mercure de Fontainebleau, l'Imprimerie artisanale de Fontainebleau, la Maison Dominique Désiré,

Le département de Seine-et-Marne

La Ville d'Avon, La Ville de Bois-le-Roi, La Ville de Fontainebleau

 

                        

 

    

 

 

                            

 

 

JEAN-PIERRE LEMAIRE

Poète reconnu résidant près de Fontainebleau. Plusieurs de ses recueils ont paru chez Gallimard. Il a reçu en 1999 le Grand prix de poésie de l'Académie française pour l'ensemble de son œuvre. Son dernier recueil, Le Pays derrière les larmes, est une anthologie. (Poésie / Gallimard, 2016)

Un poème qui sera présent dans le livre :

Arbres

Les arbres restent toujours nos parents

et nous marchons à côté d'eux

dans l'ombre et la lumière

tandis qu'ils regardent un peu plus loin

vers l'avenir tout proche

murmurant sur le monde au-dessus de nos têtes

des paroles encore insaisissables

Les Marges du jour, La Dogana, Genève, 1981

Trees

Trees remain forever our parents

and we walk by their side

in the dappled light

while they look on ahead

towards the near future

whispering about the world above us

words we still fail to grasp

Poème traduit par Claire Gerolemous et Isabelle Lucas

 

MATHIEU WÜHRMANN 

Jeune peintre franco-américain originaire de Fontainebleau, diplômé de l'Académie royale des beaux arts de Bruxelles et de l'Ecole des beaux-arts de Nantes. Après l'exposition Portraits d'arbres en 2017, il s'est mis en résidence parmi les arbres et rochers de la forêt de Fontainebleau.

Voir davantage d'œuvres : www.mathieuwuhrmann.com

Pour les francophones : 

Nous avons choisi une plateforme américaine pour créer cette cagnotte ( indiegogo ) car elle facilite les paiements par carte bancaire pour une période plus longue. Si vous êtes moyennement doué en anglais, n'hésitez pas à vous faire aider ou à nous contacter par e-mail : arbreenlumiere@gmail.com

story:
Welcome to my Train of Thought!


Howdy! I'm humor writer and novelist Linda M. Au.  You probably haven't heard of me yet. Yet. If you have heard of me, then you're probably related to me or sat next to me in math class in the 1970s. But let's move right along... 

A cross-country train trip has always been at the top of my bucket list. And, let's face it, I ain't gettin' any younger. So, what happens when a humor writer decides to finally live her dream? (Not the one where I marry Gene Wilder and we live on a cruise ship. THIS dream! The bucket list thing!)

Naturally, she gets on that train and brings along her laptop and writes about the experience. In glorious, humorous detail.

This is how the book Train of Thought: Travel Essays from a One-Track Mind  will be born.

And YOU can be part of it!

 

What I Need & What You Get

The trip itself will occur in  EARLY MAY 2017.

Here are all the gory details:

  • Sitting on a train, sleeping in a tiny cubicle, staring out a window, and eating dining car food all cost money. I'm hoping to fund half the trip through this campaign. 
  • The end result will be a book. A hilarious, marvelous, clever book.
  • A few months after the trip, contributors at various levels will receive copies of the completed book: the Kindle edition, the paperback edition, etc. Higher contributions will include copies of my other books as well (to be chosen by the contributor).
  • All contributors will also receive exclusive updates during the trip itself. I'll post interesting tidbits and snippets en route at Wi-Fi hotspots along the way.

All contributions will go toward the cost of the train ticket, which will be about twice what I hope to raise here. The rest of the costs of the trip will come from me. After all, I'm the one who gets to sleep in a tiny cubicle, to meet people I may not like, and to get stuck on a loud, moving vehicle for two weeks straight with fewer clothes and toiletries than I am comfortable with.

ALSO: ALL contributors will be asked if they want to be included in the book's Acknowledgments!
 

Risks & Challenges

There is the risk that the trip will be a completely smooth, wonderful, beautiful experience and that absolutely nothing funny will happen for the entire two weeks.

But, c'mon. Anybody who knows me knows that that's not going to happen. The challenge is going to be quite the opposite ... shutting myself up once I start yammering on about all the outrageous, silly, crazy stuff I'll experience as I cross the country by myself, all alone for two solid weeks on a tra--- oh geez, what was I thinking??

Oh, sorry. Did I just type that out loud? Carry on. Nothing to see here.


 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute right now, that's totally fine. I still need to get the word out about the trip, about the book, about any of my books. Use the Indiegogo share tools here to pass the word along to others who might be interested. You know:  other writers, fellow readers, train enthusiasts, people with a sense of humor, introverts ... and, of course, introverted train enthusiast writers with a sense of humor. Both of them.

 

Thanks!
story_txt:
Welcome to my Train of Thought!
Howdy! I'm humor writer and novelist Linda M. Au.  You probably haven't heard of me yet. Yet. If you have heard of me, then you're probably related to me or sat next to me in math class in the 1970s. But let's move right along... 
A cross-country train trip has always been at the top of my bucket list. And, let's face it, I ain't gettin' any younger. So, what happens when a humor writer decides to finally live her dream? (Not the one where I marry Gene Wilder and we live on a cruise ship. THIS dream! The bucket list thing!)
Naturally, she gets on that train and brings along her laptop and writes about the experience. In glorious, humorous detail.
This is how the book Train of Thought: Travel Essays from a One-Track Mind  will be born.
And YOU can be part of it!
 

What I Need & What You Get
The trip itself will occur in  EARLY MAY 2017.
Here are all the gory details:


Sitting on a train, sleeping in a tiny cubicle, staring out a window, and eating dining car food all cost money. I'm hoping to fund half the trip through this campaign. 
The end result will be a book. A hilarious, marvelous, clever book.
A few months after the trip, contributors at various levels will receive copies of the completed book: the Kindle edition, the paperback edition, etc. Higher contributions will include copies of my other books as well (to be chosen by the contributor).
All contributors will also receive exclusive updates during the trip itself. I'll post interesting tidbits and snippets en route at Wi-Fi hotspots along the way.

All contributions will go toward the cost of the train ticket, which will be about twice what I hope to raise here. The rest of the costs of the trip will come from me. After all, I'm the one who gets to sleep in a tiny cubicle, to meet people I may not like, and to get stuck on a loud, moving vehicle for two weeks straight with fewer clothes and toiletries than I am comfortable with.

Use the Indiegogo share tools here to pass the word along to others who might be interested. You know:  other writers, fellow readers, train enthusiasts, people with a sense of humor, introverts ... and, of course, introverted train enthusiast writers with a sense of humor. Both of them.
 
Thanks!

story:
For $17, this early bird campaign allows you to preorder a signed copy of Spokes of Dream or Bird. For these preorders, the author will pay the sales tax and the publisher’s shipping and handling cost (approximately $8).  

For $25, you have the option to obtain a signed copy of Spokes of Dream or Bird as well as a signed copy of my first book, Among the Shapes That Fold & Fly.

Or, if you are so moved, you can simply make a donation toward printing, marketing and distribution costs.

The Back Story

I have been working for many years with the “Activist” group of poets formerly led by maverick poet-teacher Lawrence Hart and now led by his son, poet John Hart.

Lawrence played a major part in the Twentieth Century history of San Francisco Bay Area poetry. In the 1930s, he made the ambitious claim that he could teach the new techniques unlocked by the Modernist poets to almost any willing student. He succeeded in producing a number of accomplished, award-winning poets who rose to prominence in the 1940s and 50s and continued to publish through the 1970s.

A different style, less wedded to technique and more focused on raw emotion and political rebellion, took center stage in the 1960s, while further generations of students continued to pass through Lawrence’s hands and his rigorous poetic training. One of these students, Lawrence’s son John, characterized this situation as a division between “raw” and “cooked” poetry, with the Activists being unapologetically “cooked.” And “Activist” doesn’t mean political (or non political) necessarily, but a focus on making each word poetically active, whatever the subject of the poem.   

What Does Spokes of Dream or Bird Do?

This book is part of a resurgence of publication by a new generation of Activist poets who believe that the territory Lawrence opened up is still vital and interesting. It employs a lot of metaphoric imagery, one of the techniques taught by the Harts.

Terry Ehret said of the book: “In Patricia Nelson’s poems, language is a vessel—sometimes a jeweled container to catch the ineffable, to harness or restrain its power like a djinni; sometimes a boat on the vast sea–surface, catching the winds of exhilarated flight or foundering in storms. This is the vessel with which the poet sets out, and we, her readers, are along for the journey. Through ancient Celtic forests, Dante’s landscape of the damned, and the garden of wordless, singing light from which our consciousness exiles us, Nelson’s poems offer a riddling map home—a way to reach one another, to counter the loneliness of our human being.”

story:
Summary

Hi, I'm Andrew!  I'm graduating from Carleton University in June from Communication Studies (with a double minor in Business and Entrepreneurship).  I love marketing, fun-times, beer, and sunshine.

I'm raising money to help fund my travels and living expenses in Malawi, Africa for two months.  I will be working with local farmers and journalism outlets for radio and other media to help teach value chain proposition and improve their farming business.  Here's a link with a better description of what I will be doing. The end goal though is simple: change a life.

Any amount of help and funding will help me accomplish this goal, immensely.  I need to pay for food, housing, travel expenses, immunizations and medicine, insurance, and any equipment I'll need while abroad.  That's a lot!  I need help so that I can make a difference.  My school was generous enough to give us a travel grant that basically covers my plane ticket there and back.  The rest is on me!  

Any dollar left over from this campaign when I get back from Malawi in September will be donated to Farm Radio International so that they can keep doing an amazing job.  

Important Links

Here are some important links for my adventure. 

My website andrewnewton.ca

My blog (to host updates on this adventure)

What We Need & What You Get

My budget for this trip is roughly $5000, and it will go entirely to my vaccinations, my living expenses, my food, and my equipment.  I'll be working with farmers, not-for-profits, and small radio outlets, so they can't afford to spend money on my help. 

I'm hoping to get involved in local villages with farmers to help them in any way I can.  Farm Radio International will help me accomplish this goal.  Even if I don't reach my goal of $5000, any amount will help me make a difference!  We can do this together.

The Impact

By funding this project you can be a part of making a life-changing difference in a lot of people's lives.  I've never done something like this, but my experience is what got me hired with Farm Radio and I plan on using that and every dollar donated to help share this and make a positive difference in our world.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're unable to contribute any money to this project, that's okay!  Help me help these farmers by spreading the word of this campaign.  Hit the share button, and I will be eternally grateful!  If you would prefer, here is a link to Farm Radio International where you can make a donation directly to them. 

Donations to Farm Radio International

Every time I get a backer of $200, I will donate 50% of the proceeds to FRI as soon as the money hits my account (By Mid-June).  I will screenshot and share images of your donation with your name on it for the world to see your generosity!  When I get back, if there's any money left over from this campaign I will donate it to FRI, and do the same: I will screen shot and share this picture thank all of you for making a continued effort to help make a difference!

Please note that due to the nature of the campaign platform, I won't be able to issue a charitable receipt.

Why $5000?

$5000 might seem steep, so I figured I would show the cost of going to Malawi.  Some of the prices show variations as we are still looking for accommodations, and the cost of food is to be determined.

Vaccinations: $600

Living: $400-500/month ($800-$1000)

Food: $400-$600/month ($800-$1200)

Plane Ticket: $3200 (Most of this was covered by Carleton University)

Equipment: $1000 (This includes new luggage - you need a hard-shell suit case to go and I only have soft-shell, safety equipment, first-aid, appropriate clothing for office and field work, etcetera)

Insurance: $200-300

Visas and International Driver's License: $100-$250

With these costs in mind, I need to look at the extreme in case the budget doesn't go according to plan, its safer to travel with a buffer.  Furthermore, since $100 of every 200$ donation goes back to FRI, this reduces the amount allotted to my budget, and at the end any left-over money goes back to FRI.  All of these factors contributed to my fundraising decision goal of $5000.  I will be completing my 4th year of school after paying my way for all this time, so my bank account is running a little dry to help support this initiative.  This initiative is dear to my heart, and I am passionate about the mission of going to Malawi with Farm Radio.  Together, we can make this a reality and we can touch lives.


Thanks for your help!

story:
My Humble Beginnings

I started writing sometime in high school. My English teacher gave a writing assignment to write a short story that was only a single page long. I used to only think, out of all the arts, that drawing was the one for me. Boy, was I wrong. Ever since I wrote that one page story, I've been furiously writing since. My mind often infuriates me when it pours forth inspiring words during those few golden hours yet decides to not remember them. I sleep with notebooks next to my bed for such occasions, and I have many notebooks full of words and ideas.

I don't know if I'm good enough to become a famous, published author, but that is my hope. I hope that a polished manuscript will bring me closer to that goal.


The Project

This is a trilogy. The first two books are nearly halfway finished and the third is vaguely fleshed out.

The first book, The Life Warden, is about a girl who grows up being told she's going to inherit a great power from the universe. She becomes lost in this thought, and eventually loses herself as well.

The second, The Death Bringer, is about another girl who has always wanted to be normal. To have a loving family and a normal life. She has neither. She finds strength in those around herself, but once these people are lost to her, she becomes lost in the darkness herself.

The third book, The Reaper, tells the story of one of these women, the world they find on the other side, and how they find themselves again.


What it's all for...

The funds from this project will be used toward professional editing services and the cost of book covers. Professional editing services charge per word. If the goal is surpassed, then I hope to purchase a better editing package than the standard quick edit one.
