story:
Short Summary

Global Press Institute (GPI) is an award-winning, high-impact social venture that uses journalism as a development tool to educate, employ and empower women in developing media markets to produce high-quality local news coverage that elevates global awareness and ignites social change.

GPI was founded on a simple yet radical idea: rather than sending foreign correspondents to report on countries they know little about, we should train local people to become professional journalists so they can report on their own communities. GPI does just that: we train women around the globe and employ them at a living wage to report on their local communities. We publish their original news on our online publication, Global Press Journal, and syndicate their content to over 80 media and NGO partners around the world.

Help us amplify the voices of our locally-based journalists!

Currently, GPI operates training programs and news desks in 25 countries. With your help we can open our newest program in Guatemala! Your contribution will enable us to train four indigenous women throughout Guatemala to become professional journalists, covering underreported issues such as femicide, climate change and education. Skees Family Foundation is matching the first $10,000 donated!

The results are dramatic: by earning a living wage in a dignified profession, our reporters take greater control of their finances, care for their families, and earn the respect of their communities.

Dando Mweetwa, GPI News Desk Zambia                        Photo by Casey Beck 

"I would like to thank you all for helping me throughout this journey, I managed to pay rent for a boarding house and things for school through GPI salary." 

                                                                                                   --Dando Mweetwa 

By covering underreported topics such as gender justice, entrepreneurship, arts and culture, and education in ways that no one else can, GPI reporters help create informed communities and greater global awareness, leading in turn to social change at the individual, community, and national levels.


What We Need & What You Get

We are trying to raise $16,500 to cover:

·  Training stipends, food, materials, and transportation for a two week-long intensive training;

·  12-month living-wage salaries for the four women as Global Press Journal reporters;

·  Cameras, laptops, voice recorders, and internet sticks used in the reporting and editorial process;

·  Editorial oversight by Global Press Journal team.

We will use every dollar we raise towards GPI operations in Guatemala. Skees Family Foundation is matching the first $10,000 donated! 


The Impact

Why Guatemala?

Guatemala receives very little attention in the international press. It has been nearly 20 years since the conclusion of the country’s bloody civil war, in which the Guatemalan government was accused of committing genocide against the country’s Mayan population. The country’s struggles with indigenous rights, women’s equality, and the drug trade combine with limited telecommunications infrastructure and a weak rural media sector to make Guatemala a prime location for a GPI news desk.

Additionally, according to the Global Media Monitoring Project, women are grossly under-represented in the Guatemalan media. In 2010, there were just 37 female reporters nationwide and women were the subjects of news coverage just 17% of the time. The overall media landscape in Guatemala is limited, with only four national TV channels – all of which have the same owner. Indigenous groups are supposed to have the right to their own media, but licensing restrictions block this promise from becoming reality.

By donating to this project, you have the chance to help transform Guatemalan media, providing an independent voice for both women and indigenous communities.


    Our Track Record of Success

    GPI has news desks in 25 countries around the world. We have found that our programs in these countries have social impact on multiple levels, including:

    ·  Empowering women: our reporters are trained in a dignified profession and are paid a living-wage for their work. They take greater control of their finances, care for their families, and earn the respect of their communities.

    ·  Improving journalism: by changing the storyteller, we produce rich, ethical news stories on subjects and places ignored by traditional media. We then syndicate our original news content to other media outlets, ensuring that these stories go far and wide and increase global awareness about developing media markets like Guatemala.

    ·  Igniting social change: our stories catalyze direct action, sparking social protest, provoking international attention to issues first covered by GPI, and even changing laws in two countries. For instance, last October the Rwandan parliament passed a law criminalizing sex corruption in the workplace as a result of reporter Ritha Bumwe's groundbreaking article about the growing trend of sex corruption as a barrier to employment for women in Rwanda.


    Other Ways You Can Help

    Want to do more? You can also help us by:

    · Reading Global Press Journal each week for incredible and insightful news stories from around the world.

    ·  Letting your friends know about this campaign! Call them, email them, and promote the campaign to them through social media. Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools! 

    ·  Becoming a Global Press Mentor: http://globalpressinstitute.org/get-involved/become-a-mentor/.

story:
Book Title:  The Grieving Tree

Written by:  Seven Smith & Willow Woodman

The story of a tree given a job even too big for most humans to fill.  

Based on the true life story of a real family and a real tree.  Two young boys become fatherless.  The young widow seeks solace and comfort and decides to bring permanent life to the gravesite in the form of a Juniper tree.  The boys fought to keep the tree alive that first summer by bringing water almost daily.  The bond between the tree, and the boys and their Momma continued to grow.

The family shared their sorrows, they felt they were listened to, and they felt comforted.  Juniper, as the boys call him, narrates his story in first person.  He quickly understands his life is meant for more than beauty and shade.  His job is to listen and comfort the grieving.  

Being the only tree in the cemetery, he stood out, about eighteen feet tall.  That distinction caused him more than one problem; but the magic of Juniper continues on to this day.

The book is a message of hope when you have faith, even in the most difficult times!  This is a tale of encouragement that will bring some relief to those in grief.

The story editing is complete, the illustrations are almost done.  The real life facts and photos are in a section at the end.  Now we are targeting formatting, publishing and marketing.  With your help in completing this project, Juniper’s mission will succeed in reaching hurting hearts.

And one third of all the books profits are contracted to go to charity!  Many others who grieve will benefit from your belief in this cause.

We fully believe you will be proud to be a part of this venture!

 

Seven Smith & Willow Woodman

story:
An educative storybook app designed to introduce children to wonders of nature and plant life

Daisy and Roger are two kids like so many others: they enjoy playing with their cat Gregor, sometimes they quarrel among each other, and want to become, respectively, a ballet dancer and a jet pilot.

In addition they are passionate about nature thanks to their dad Sebastian, a world-renowned botanist and ecologist.

Oh, I almost forgot... The year is 2080 and the two kids are traveling on a large interstellar spaceship to carry out a delicate mission: find planets suitable to preserve the terrestrial flora, threatened by pollution and by destruction of our ecosystem.

Spring Mission is an educative resource for kids (and their parents) to learn about plant life by means of amazing Sci-Fi adventures mixed with enjoyable educational components.

Each interactive storybook will be illustrated with charming artwork to spread a message everyone needs to remember: we have to protect our nature and bio-diversity!

Our project is to develop a first Application for iOS and Android mixing:

  • an enjoyable story;
  • amazing illustrations;
  • funny animations;
  • puzzle games;
  • educational contents and tips on how to grow the plant in your own garden.

The storybook will contain 15 wonderful illustrated and animated pages, all with written and audio texts in English, French, Italian and Spanish.

We’re ready to go. All we need is your support  in order to get this project off the ground.  

Please, if you’re thinking of a kid who might love our space family, don’t wait: help us fill the reservoir of the spaceship, and be ready to follow Daisy & Co. in this adventure!

Be our bees, please

Help us in pollination! Please share the page with your friends and family and...

Join us on Facebook

Follow us on Twitter 

Why IndieGoGo

The hard part is already done - Angelo wrote the first story and Laura designed the main characters - but the journey is still long. 

Our spaceship is almost built, but we need your help for the fuel!

We did a detailed budget for all aspects of the remaining production, including the inevitable snags and sneaky costs in development, and we need founds basically to cover illustration and development, and even also:

  • Translations and editing in English, French, Italian and Spanish
  • Actors to speak the text in English, French, Italian and Spanish
  • Music and sound effects
  • Proof reading and final testing
  • Developing a supporting web site
  • Marketing activities

To these costs must then add Indiegogo's and transaction fees, taxes, and cost of the perks...

Yes! Perks!

All our supporters will freely download the storybook in both versions iOS and Android (if you don't have a tablet, we'll provide a PDF eBook version for you... and you can always download your app for free in the future). 

And for a contribution to the space gas we have designed some amazing perks:

  • an illustrated newsletter to be updated step by step on the development;
  • the Spring Mission's colouring book, a special printable PDF version of the storybook with all the illustrations in black and white;
  • the exclusive eBook "Oreste's Space Kitchen", with twelve illustrated vegetarian recipes from the Mediterranean tradition (all based on seasonal vegetables);
  • a digital version of the Spring Mission's Workbook, full of draft and information on writing, illustrating and developing a children storybook, plus additional artworks not included in the final version;
  • the limited edition Spring Mission hardcover book (in English, French or Italian) for the paper lovers;
  • a funny t-shirt (for men, women and kids);
  • a day tour with the authors visiting the "Minerva’s Garden", the oldest botanical garden in Europe, a delicious dinner, and an exclusive super limited edition (only 3 copies in the world!) printed book with an original illustrated story realized only for you.

Shipping costs for US, Canada and EU are already built into the rewards.

Story & Characters

Daisy and Roger cross the galaxy with their dad Sebastian to find new worlds adapt to grow terrestrial plants and flowers, and saving them from extinction. In each episode, this amazing family land on a new planet, meet bizarre aliens, and help them to solve their problems using terrestrial plants and flowers.

Daisy is a 10 years old girl and, despite her age, she is very smart and always finds solutions to problems... Solutions sometimes mad, often amazing, but always entertaining. Roger is her 12 years old brother and he is a real pest: great music fan and martial arts enthusiast, but he likes nothing better than get into trouble due to his stubbornness. 

Sebastian is a loving father and a brilliant scientist. ￼He is known as the greatest botanist in the world and for this reason he was entrusted to lead the Spring Mission. Hann is their mom: she remained on the Earth to follow her work as biologist and can communicate with them only via space-videoconference.

Gregor is a cat-mentor that can speak like a human using an electronic collar... But he is pedantic as only an old professor can be! In fact, in addition to assist Sebastian in his scientific researches, he is also the Daisy and Fabian's teacher. Oreste is the robot factotum that works as gardener and chef on the spaceship: hyperactive and pragmatic, often him and Gregor disagree about solutions and ideas, so the interaction between the ￼philosophical cat and the peppy robot is the driving force of many comical gags.

Who We Are

Angelo Pastore - Born in the sparkling 70s, he wrote and supervised about 600 hours of kids entertainment for main Italian TV networks. He collaborated on the kids sitcom “As the Bell Rings”, aired on Disney Channel Italy, and since 2006 he's the main scriptwriter and assistant director for the animated series “Jurassic Cubs”. More about him on LinkedIn. 

 

Laura Re - Born in the fabulous 80s, she worked as character designer, illustrator and concept artist for several animation studios. She illustrated the Jerome K. Jerome's children's book “Told After Supper”, published by “La Spiga Edizioni”, and since 2009 she collaborates for the TV series "Jurassic Cubs." Surf on her blog Mondelalle! 

  

Lilia Dassine Belaid - Born in the innovating 80s, she discovered computing and gaming in 90's and she knew that it was her destiny. She was part of successful and innovative mobile development in Canada. Passionate about education, she is developer volunteer at One Laptop Per Child and enjoying starting a new adventure in California's new technological heartland, San Francisco, to learn more about tech and to develop some great educative apps. Here the LinkedIn profile!

All of us worked on many similar projects in the past, and we are all professionals who will work hard to complete the first Spring Mission Storybook and get you your reward.

And this is only the beginning!

We have a vision, a mission, and the talent in place to make it fly! It's happening!

THANK YOU!

story:
Summary

Hi,

I'm Jess.

Im a 22 year old uni student with a long list of physical and mental health problems.

Lately I've been trying to be more and more productive about getting better and in the last year, something has happened to make me revisit the notion of a service dog.

About 8 months ago, my former house mates and I fostered Bindi, a Staffy x with an uncertain past and an uncertain future. We didn't intend to adopt her but as time passed it became undeniably clear that Bindi and I could not be separated. 

I also noticed that with Bindi around I was generally happier, my anxiety was more manageable, and I was in general more stable, I could leave the house more and go out in public with her by my side, and was able to make friends locally for the first time, all because of her. Previously agonizing tasks like going to the shops or  walking past someone in the street became manageable.

Bindi and I have helped each other so much. She is practically unrecognizable from the scared and untrained dog we fostered. I find myself believing for the first time that I could actually make myself a properly functioning member of society with her by my side.

I have suffered from severe anxiety for most of my life, among many other things, and Bindi assists me to overcome these things in my daily life and supports me in recovering when I am not okay.

Imagine having a bad leg, and going around your whole life with no walking stick or wheel chair, accepting the pain and struggling as normal, and just trying to get on with your life but you cant, because you cant really walk at all. 

Thats what Bindi is to me. A walking stick. She doesnt fix the problem. She doesn't cover up the problem. But she supports me so that I live a more rewarding and less painful life, and enables me to overcome these disabilities.

But without training and certification I cant take Bindi with me everywhere, and I remain restricted and unable to live the fulfilling life I could be capable of with her by my side.

I have the support of my family for her future vet fees but we just cannot afford all this on top of 2 other dogs and many other pets with their own medical needs, and I am unable to work due to my current condition. With Bindi's help I would like to gain independence and employment.

Thats where crowd funding comes in:


What I Need

Training a service dog is expensive. I am not a qualified trainer, and while I have some skills and an internet full of research, sometimes you just need the real deal.

Buying a pre-trained service dog is hugely expensive and I am not guaranteed to have the same relationship and understanding that I have with Bindi.


What I need funding for:

  • Sessions with a professional trainer (about $40 upfront per session (usually weekly) over about 12 months)
  • Training equipment (such as vests, rewards, other training tools)
  • Vet fees for her complete check up (including blood work and possibly biopsy of a benign lump) to clear her for service
  • The final adoption fee ($100 - she is technically still in the process of being adopted as I haven't been able to pay this yet)
  • Application as a service dog fee ($100 through mindDog)
  • The certification assessment fee ($250)
  • Update on her vaccinations and injections
  • Re-certification after 12 months ($25)
  • Registration and microchipping (Costs tba)
  • All other funds will go to gear (such as boots to protect from hot pavements/cold, enabling her to work in all weather) and other tools relevant to her. 
  • Any and all excess funds will be donated to the rescue organisation Bindi came from: Golden Oldies Animal Rescue
I do not have final numbers on all of these things but I wanted to get this started as soon as I got the okay from my doctor.

Risks & Challenges

As with every service dog in training, there is a chance that Bindi could fail her public access test. If this happens she will be given guidance and have 1 opportunity to re-attempt the test.

Bindi has already overcome so many challenges in our time together that I believe she has the intelligence and will to do this.

There is also a chance that my condition somehow prevents me from working with Bindi. In this case, I will need her even more, and my sister, who is very animal-smart can help with training Bindi.

$2000 may seem like a lot, but the cost of a pre-trained dog is 10 x that, and without this, my life will continue to be stuck unable to move forward.

Other Ways You Can Help

As a relatively poor person myself, I understand that some of us just dont have the money to give, even when we really want to. So here is what else you can do:

  • Spread the word; even if you cant donate, maybe you know someone who can.
  • Donate training tools, books about dog/service dog training.
  • If you or a friend/relative is a trainer, maybe donate a few training sessions/sessions at a reduced rate
  • If you have trained or worked with a service dog before, email me your experience and advice

story:
Writing and healing. These two go hand in hand. It is my vision to facilitate and help people interested in bettering their lives through writing. With your help, I will be able to start big. How awesome is that?


The money you donate will go specifically to the following:

- Assistance with the downpayment on the property in which I live. I am in a rent to own contract, but with my salary as a teacher, raising two children and spending much of my own money on the associated costs of a start up, I am left with less than the desired amount for the downpayment. There are two homes on the property, one of which (the cottage) I intend to use as my main home office and coaching space once the current tenant leaves. $12,600.00 of the money raised will go directly to the downpayment.

- The remaining money (minus the fees collected by Indiegogo) will go to associated costs of maintenance and expansion for Write for Healing: monthly fees to maintain my website, hiring an intern and / or virtual assistant, advertising costs, training and books necessary to improve the quality of my work and any other costs related to the first year of keeping the momentum of a business going.

Every dollar will go to seeing my vision grow to its fullest potential and will be much appreciated.

Know that the business has already started and I have already begun generating and building interest and putting my heart into seeing it grow. I am really beyond excited and grateful to see this soar and touch the lives of many. Thank you.

www.writeforhealing.com

www.facebook.com/writeforhealing1

www.twitter.com/writeforhealing

WRITE FOR HEALING

This is a place for those seeking guidance, a nurturing environment, and assistance in leading a healthier, more authentic life by using the written word as a guide. Be more in tune with who you are, who you want to be and what is most important to you in life.

If you consider yourself a writer, and / or have used a journal as a form of self reflection, you are already aware of how therapeutic and liberating it is to let out emotion by writing. There are times that writing is simply cathartic.

We all have the need to make sense of our world via expression. For some, creating music does this, for others, painting fulfills this need. Some are fully satisfied by talking to someone, but there are those of us who feel compelled to use writing as a tool for understanding and digging deeper to our true selves.

At Write for Healing, I will facilitate a better and more amazing you through guided writing exercises designed to genuinely improve your life. You will write. I will read and respond. We will collaborate in person, on the phone, via Skype / FaceTime or through writing via a messaging service -- whatever best suits your needs.


COACHING

You write. I read. We collaborate and focus on the areas of your life that you want to improve. There is not a one size fits all approach to coaching. What works for one person may not work for the next. It is important that you receive exactly what you need and do the work necessary to achieve a better and more authentic you.

Let me help you be your truest, most awesome self. It is the best goal you can have. Not only is it beneficial for your well being, but it dramatically changes the people and environment around you. Wouldn't it be amazing if everyone were their happiest, most authentic selves? I'm pretty sure it would change the world one person at a time.


ANGELIQUE GIRON

Professional Profile:

I graduated with a BA in English with a concentration in creative writing. I have been accepted and will begin the Online Clinical MSW Program at Fordham University (ranked #1 Online MSW Program by BestSchools.org and the entire Graduate School of Social Service is ranked #11 by U.S. News and World Report) in Fall 2014. I have been an educator in an urban school district for over ten years and have also taught creative writing to kids on the autism spectrum. Prior to formally becoming an educator, I worked in management in both the fashion and travel industries.

During teaching, I focus on facilitating the process of writing via personal narratives. Through this method, not only do most students become more engaged in their writing, but they also find the process cathartic. Many students feel relief after writing about difficult and deeply personal subjects in their lives and are always proud to tell their stories. In my own life, I use writing as a reflective tool to maintain optimum health.

I am an engaged and empathetic listener and am able to provide guided, level and encouraging counsel.

Personal Story:

On paper, if you read my story, I'd sound like I've had a difficult life and I have, but I have also had an amazing and deeply satisfying life (I still do!). But I can assure you, I am just a person who tries her best to be whole and happy. My life, just like yours, is not Hollywood.

Here's a short list of the "negatives" that could have left me literally and metaphorically crippled:

Severe rheumatoid arthritis since the age of 17 | emotionally abused by my functioning alcoholic mother | not knowing my alcoholic / drug addicted father very well | nearly failing high school and continuously dropping out of college and restarting | two kids with autism.

I can tell you this list has taught me how to live and live well. I have been forced to examine who I am many times, and I am still learning (or being reminded of) who I am and what makes me love life.

I am really beyond excited and grateful to see this soar and touch the lives of many. Thank you.www.writeforhealing.comwww.facebook.com/writeforhealing1www.twitter.com/writeforhealingWRITE FOR HEALINGThis is a place for those seeking guidance, a nurturing environment, and assistance in leading a healthier, more authentic life by using the written word as a guide. Be more in tune with who you are, who you want to be and what is most important to you in life.If you consider yourself a writer, and / or have used a journal as a form of self reflection, you are already aware of how therapeutic and liberating it is to let out emotion by writing. There are times that writing is simply cathartic.We all have the need to make sense of our world via expression. For some, creating music does this, for others, painting fulfills this need. Some are fully satisfied by talking to someone, but there are those of us who feel compelled to use writing as a tool for understanding and digging deeper to our true selves.At Write for Healing, I will facilitate a better and more amazing you through guided writing exercises designed to genuinely improve your life. You will write. I will read and respond. We will collaborate in person, on the phone, via Skype / FaceTime or through writing via a messaging service -- whatever best suits your needs.COACHINGYou write. I read. We collaborate and focus on the areas of your life that you want to improve. There is not a one size fits all approach to coaching. What works for one person may not work for the next. It is important that you receive exactly what you need and do the work necessary to achieve a better and more authentic you.Let me help you be your truest, most awesome self. It is the best goal you can have. Not only is it beneficial for your well being, but it dramatically changes the people and environment around you. Wouldn't it be amazing if everyone were their happiest, most authentic selves? I'm pretty sure it would change the world one person at a time.ANGELIQUE GIRONProfessional Profile:I graduated with a BA in English with a concentration in creative writing. I have been accepted and will begin the Online Clinical MSW Program at Fordham University (ranked #1 Online MSW Program by BestSchools.org and the entire Graduate School of Social Service is ranked #11 by U.S. News and World Report) in Fall 2014. I have been an educator in an urban school district for over ten years and have also taught creative writing to kids on the autism spectrum. Prior to formally becoming an educator, I worked in management in both the fashion and travel industries.During teaching, I focus on facilitating the process of writing via personal narratives. Through this method, not only do most students become more engaged in their writing, but they also find the process cathartic. Many students feel relief after writing about difficult and deeply personal subjects in their lives and are always proud to tell their stories. In my own life, I use writing as a reflective tool to maintain optimum health.I am an engaged and empathetic listener and am able to provide guided, level and encouraging counsel.Personal Story:On paper, if you read my story, I'd sound like I've had a difficult life and I have, but I have also had an amazing and deeply satisfying life (I still do!). But I can assure you, I am just a person who tries her best to be whole and happy. My life, just like yours, is not Hollywood.Here's a short list of the "negatives" that could have left me literally and metaphorically crippled:Severe rheumatoid arthritis since the age of 17 | emotionally abused by my functioning alcoholic mother | not knowing my alcoholic / drug addicted father very well | nearly failing high school and continuously dropping out of college and restarting | two kids with autism.I can tell you this list has taught me how to live and live well. I have been forced to examine who I am many times, and I am still learning (or being reminded of) who I am and what makes me love life.

story:
Short Summary

PLEASE NOTE: AS OF JULY 31, 2015, PRE-ORDERS FOR ABBA - THE COMPLETE RECORDING SESSIONS ARE NO LONGER ACCEPTED ON THIS PAGE. TO PRE-ORDER THE BOOK, PLEASE GO TO: 
abbathecompleterecordingsessions.com.

__________________________________________________________________________


  • Auf Deutsch
  • En Français
  • En Español

    • My book on ABBA's recording history, ABBA: The Complete Recording Sessions, will be published in a completely revised, updated and expanded edition. Originally published in 1994, this new edition will feature more details on exactly how ABBA wrote and recorded their music, including classic hits such as ‘Waterloo’, ‘Mamma Mia’, ‘Dancing Queen’, ‘Knowing Me, Knowing You’ and ‘The Winner Takes It All’. 

    I've been authorised by ABBA’s record company, Polar Music International/ Universal Music, and ABBA members Björn Ulvaeus and Benny Andersson to listen to unreleased mixes: plenty of alternate mixes of familiar songs and mixes of a handful of songs that were never released. The scope of the book has also been expanded to feature a lot more information about ABBA and their music: how it was packaged, received by the critics, and much more. 

    Please note: The book will only be published if it is successfully funded through this Indiegogo campaign.

    You can pre-order the revised, updated and expanded edition of ABBA: The Complete Recording Sessions in two different formats:

    1. Printed hardcover format shipped to your address anywhere in the world
    2. ebook (electronic book) format supported by Sony Reader, Kindle, iBooks, Nook, and most other readers and devices. (Read more about ebooks here.)
    Please see the Perks section on the right side of this page for the various bundles available. Then simply click on the appropriate perk to pre-order.

    When you pre-order, your contribution will be immediately withdrawn from your credit card or PayPal account. If the campaign does not reach its goal, you will automatically receive a full refund.

    You can contribute as many times as you like and choose as many perks as you like. If you’d like to contribute on behalf of a friend, or several friends, this option is also now available. Read more about it here.


    Project Background

    The first edition of ABBA: The Complete Recording Sessions was published in 1994, at a time when ABBA were still a long way from being the Rock And Roll Hall Of Fame inductees they are today. The book, which detailed the background stories on how ABBA wrote and recorded their music, was based on interviews with all four ABBA members, their invaluable sound engineer Michael B. Tretow, as well as the most frequently employed session musicians who played on ABBA’s records. At the time, the book made quite a splash in the fan community—it was the first time anyone had published a serious book about the group’s music—and many have referred to it as their favourite ABBA book since then, which of course has been immensely gratifying for me.

    Original edition of ABBA: The Complete Recording Sessions.

    This was my very first ABBA book, written at a time when I knew a lot less about the group than I know now. The publication of the book opened up an entirely new chapter of my life, and for the past 15 or so years it has been my profession to research and write books about ABBA, and to plan, conceive and contribute to official releases on CD and DVD, along with many other ABBA-related activities.

    Why this new edition?

    I’ve long been itching to publish an updated edition of ABBA - The Complete Recording Sessions, and ABBA fans have let me know on a regular basis that this is something they would like to see as well. “But what could there possibly be to add?” I hear you ask. “Didn’t you cover everything in the first edition?” The answer to that is, quite simply: no!

    Certainly, at the time I had access to all sorts of written documentation, tape boxes and such, from which I was able to piece together most of the hard facts of what was recorded and when and where. But—and this is crucial—I only had one single day of listening to tapes together with Björn, Benny and Michael B. Tretow in Michael’s studio. We spent six hours together listening to multitrack tapes, and what with putting those tapes on the machines, locating the songs I wanted to hear, playing them once or twice, then taking the tapes off again, general chit-chat, a lunch break etc., the total amount of music I got to hear—measured in minutes—was not that much. At the time nothing had really been transferred to a digital format, so the only way to listen to tapes, would be to hire a studio at my own personal expense. There was no way I could afford that at the time.

    Some of my notes from the tape-listening session with Björn, Benny and Michael Tretow in 1993.
    Today the situation is quite different. Everything has been transferred to a digital format, which means that listening to tapes requires very little effort, and thanks to the encouragement and support of Polar Music International/Universal Music I will be able to listen to every alternate mix in the archives; however, the remaining multitrack tapes will probably be off-limits. Of course, ABBA’s Björn Ulvaeus and Benny Andersson have also approved my revisiting the mix tapes. So, now I will finally be able to hear what those alternate mixes are like. 

    Potential cover design concept for the revised and expanded edition, subject to change. Photos: Ola Lager © Premium Rockshot


    Why are you self-publishing?

    There are several reasons for self-publishing. One is that I want to have full control over the book. What will the book look like? My decision. When is the deadline for submitting the manuscript? My decision. When will it be published? My decision. Quite simply, I want the book to be the best I could possibly make it — that would be my priority rather than having it out “in time for the Christmas market” or whatever other priorities a regular publisher would have. I want to make a book for readers who are really interested in learning the secrets behind ABBA's music and their history as a recording act.

    Self-publishing will also enable me to make the book as nicely produced as I think it deserves to be. A regular publisher would inevitably regard ABBA: The Complete Recording Sessions as a special interest title, and that means cutting corners everywhere possible in terms of printing quality, paper quality and everything else connected to the book – including financial compensation to the author. I don’t blame them for that – they are running a business – but it would make it very difficult to make the book happen at all. Researching and writing a book like this is incredibly time-consuming, so while I don't expect to live in luxury while the book is being written, I will nevertheless need to eat and pay the rent.

    A third reason is that self-publishing for certain kinds of titles is becoming more and more common in the book world. It’s the perfect solution for a title like this, which has a relatively small but highly motivated readership. In fact, I think there is a certain beauty in self-publishing: we’re all in this together, essentially, and with the aid of crowdfunding we can make it happen because we all want it to happen.


    How will the new edition be different?

    The new edition of ABBA: The Complete Recording Sessions will be re-written from the ground up. It will offer a lot more than the original book:

    • More facts and stories about ABBA’s recorded work: released as well as unreleased songs and alternate mixes
    • More observations and insights into the writing of the songs
    • More insights from Björn and Benny
    • More comments from other people who were involved in ABBA’s recordings
    • More reflections on the completed albums and singles
    This revised edition of the book will also have several new features, not included in the previous edition:

    • New: Vintage review quotes from the press, showing how ABBA’s albums and singles were received at the time of their original release
    • New: Sidebars (separate articles) focusing on various aspects related to ABBA’s music; for instance: “Agnetha and Frida as vocalists”, “Björn the lyricist”, and so on

    This revised, updated and expanded version of ABBA: The Complete Recording Sessions will be completely redesigned and will be a lot thicker than the first edition. Whereas the original book encompassed 128 pages, I’m now looking at between 400 and 500 pages. 

    There will be plenty of illustrations in the book, in the shape of recording documents, single and album sleeves, vintage ads, newspaper and magazine clippings etc. Photographs will be kept to a minimum, so as not to affect the budget adversely, making the book too expensive for pledgers. However, in my budget I have set money aside for a fair number of photographs, with priority given to images that are relevant for the subject of the book: ABBA’s work in the studio. 

    In order to ensure this will be a quality product, the book will be printed at a highly reputable and experienced book printer in the UK. The first edition will be hardcover, 200 x 240mm, clothbound with dust jacket; both cover and insides will be printed in full colour, and the inside pages will be on high-quality matte paper stock. The book will be designed by a professional art director with over two decades of experience. All in all, I can promise you that this will be a very good-looking volume.

    Can I get a taste of what the updated version will be like?

    Yes! A couple of excerpts from the book are available as PDF files. The text and the layout are both subject to change as work on the book continues, but the excerpts will give you a flavour of the general direction we’re heading in. Download and read the excerpts here: 

    • ABBA CRS Excerpt 01 – 1973
    • ABBA CRS Excerpt 02 – 1974

    Why isn’t the ABBA logo on the proposed cover of the book?

    Only authorised books are allowed to feature the ABBA logo with backwards B, and despite Björn and Benny’s approval, the updated version of ABBA: The Complete Recording Sessions is not currently authorised.  But even if it were, it would still cost a lot of money to license the logo for use on the book, and I’d rather have funds go into the research and production of the book itself. 


    When will the book be published?

    My goal is to have the book published within two years from the end of this crowdfunding campaign. If all goes to plan, the book will be published at the end of March 2017 [updated September 2016]. 

    That said, the publication may be postponed beyond either of those dates. But rest assured that it will only be postponed because I need more time to get the book absolutely right. I take my work very seriously and part of the reason why I want to publish the book myself is so as not to have to take a publisher’s demands and deadlines into account. Whatever happens regarding the publication date, everyone who pledges will be kept updated on how I’m doing with the project. My goal is to make you, the pledger, feel a part of the creation of this book.

    In my life as an author, which spans more than two decades now, I have never accepted money for a project and then failed to complete it. In other words: you can trust me when I say that I always see my assignments through. In the case of the updated edition of ABBA: The Complete Recording Sessions, I can’t think of anything that I’d rather do in life than to research and write this book. It’s a dream come true to be able to go back to the book, correct the errors, add new information, improve on the prose and, generally, get it right. Nothing will stop me from achieving that goal.


    Can you give me 3 reasons why I should pre-order the book and back this campaign?

    1. The Beatles have had a comprehensive Complete Recording Sessions book since 1988 – that’s 27 years at the time of writing. While the original edition of ABBA: The Complete Recording Sessions accomplished a lot, don't you think it’s time ABBA – a band whose popularity is just as great as The Beatles’ in many parts of the world – had a volume that is at least a little closer to the standards set by the Beatles book?

    2. Compared to their global popularity, ABBA have, generally speaking, not been served well in terms of quality literature. There are several reasons for that, but one is the paradox that while many people enjoy ABBA's music, only a comparatively small proportion of them are interested in reading a book about the group. As I see it, the only chance of having quality books published about them, focusing on a certain aspect – their music, their live concerts, whatever – is if dedicated ABBA fans join forces to make those quality books happen. So in the case of ABBA: The Complete Recording Sessions the crowdfunding campaign is essential – it’s now or never.

    3. If you’ve read this far, I am going to assume that you have an above-average interest in ABBA. If so, I ask you, how many books and magazines have you bought over the past decade or so that tell you very little new about ABBA? Wouldn’t you rather invest your hard-earned cash in a nicely produced book that actually tells you something you didn't already know about the group? Because that is what the updated, revised and expanded edition of ABBA: The Complete Recording Sessions will accomplish.

    Thank you so much in advance for backing this crowdfunding campaign! Your support matters!

story:
Je suis Natacha Odonnat, j'exerce mon métier d'économiste de la santé en tant qu'écrivaine, bloggeuse et consultante.

Je mets l'emphase sur l'individu, sur son bien-être physique, mental et social. Pour moi, il est primordial que ses besoins fondamentaux soient satisfaits, qu'ils soient affectifs, sanitaires, nutritionnels, sociaux, économiques ou culturels .
Selon moi, le livre peut être le point de départ de bien des aventures: voyage, exposition, spectacle, film, création d'entreprise, etc.  Les écrits doivent se prolonger dans la vie, par le biais de divers types d'activités rassembleuses, pour inspirer, éclairer et instruire. 

Grâce à vous, j'ai pu animer un premier atelier  "Parler, Écrire, Lire", le 4 août 2015 destinés au programme Juste pour Elles Saint-Michel de la Maison d'Haïti à Montréal. Les jeunes filles ont exprimé  leur interrogation, leur point de vue, leur vécu, sur la "Beauté". Elles ont notamment mis l'emphase sur la beauté d'une personnalité.

Grâce à vous ce premier atelier d'une valeur de  500$ (tarifs minimum suggéré par l'Uneq) a été un succès.

Pour l'heure,  et ce grâce à vous, deux packs de 10 livres de mon ouvrage, Rouge Joyce, d'une valeur de 120$ chacun ont été financés pour les filles de Juste pour Elles. Il s'agit d'un roman théâtre d'apprentissage, mettant en lumière les chemins empruntés par une jeune étudiante noire vers une meilleure estime d'elle-même.

Le projet étant en phase Indemand, vous pouvez continuer à faire des dons pour financer d'autres ateliers autour du roman-théâtre Rouge Joyce. 

Vous pouvez également commander directement des packs de livres à offrir à des adolescents et jeunes adultes partout dans le monde ici. Vous n'aurez qu'à indiquer le nombre de livres souhaités et l'adresse d'expédition.

Si vous êtes un(e) entrepreneur(e), votre nom et celui de votre entreprise seront cités comme appui au projet dans la rubrique Mise à Jour sur Indiegogo et sur les réseaux sociaux (Facebook, twitter, google+, LinkedIn). Vous recevrez également les contreparties annoncées.

Les montants proposés pour les dons sont des suggestions, vous pouvez donner ce qu'il vous plaira. Ils serviront à financer d'autres ateliers.

Je suis Natacha Odonnat, j'exerce mon métier d'économiste de la santé en tant qu'écrivaine, bloggeuse et consultante.
Je mets l'emphase sur l'individu, sur son bien-être physique, mental et social. Pour moi, il est primordial que ses besoins fondamentaux soient satisfaits, qu'ils soient affectifs, sanitaires, nutritionnels, sociaux, économiques ou culturels .Selon moi, le livre peut être le point de départ de bien des aventures: voyage, exposition, spectacle, film, création d'entreprise, etc.  Les écrits doivent se prolonger dans la vie, par le biais de divers types d'activités rassembleuses, pour inspirer, éclairer et instruire. 
Grâce à vous, j'ai pu animer un premier atelier  "Parler, Écrire, Lire", le 4 août 2015 destinés au programme Juste pour Elles Saint-Michel de la Maison d'Haïti à Montréal. Les jeunes filles ont exprimé  leur interrogation, leur point de vue, leur vécu, sur la "Beauté". Elles ont notamment mis l'emphase sur la beauté d'une personnalité.
Grâce à vous ce premier atelier d'une valeur de  500$ (tarifs minimum suggéré par l'Uneq) a été un succès. 
Pour l'heure,  et ce grâce à vous, deux packs de 10 livres de mon ouvrage, Rouge Joyce, d'une valeur de 120$ chacun ont été financés pour les filles de Juste pour Elles. Il s'agit d'un roman théâtre d'apprentissage, mettant en lumière les chemins empruntés par une jeune étudiante noire vers une meilleure estime d'elle-même.
Le projet étant en phase Indemand, vous pouvez continuer à faire des dons pour financer d'autres ateliers autour du roman-théâtre Rouge Joyce. Vous pouvez également commander directement des packs de livres à offrir à des adolescents et jeunes adultes partout dans le monde ici. Vous n'aurez qu'à indiquer le nombre de livres souhaités et l'adresse d'expédition.
Si vous êtes un(e) entrepreneur(e), votre nom et celui de votre entreprise seront cités comme appui au projet dans la rubrique Mise à Jour sur Indiegogo et sur les réseaux sociaux (Facebook, twitter, google+, LinkedIn). Vous recevrez également les contreparties annoncées.
Les montants proposés pour les dons sont des suggestions, vous pouvez donner ce qu'il vous plaira. Ils serviront à financer d'autres ateliers.

story:
I've written a couple of books in the last few years aimed at library and information professionals and students. They've been published by traditional publishers and sold reasonably well (for specialist / academic books). However, they are expensive! This is understandable, as the publishers have a lot of overheads to cover before they even have a chance of making a profit. It means, however, that the people I aimed the books at when writing - largely staff who want to continue their professional development, will be lucky if they can afford them.

This campaign is my answer to that!

I self-published my last book recently and learnt a lot from that experience.

If you don't need to cover office and staff costs, or make a profit that keeps shareholders happy, it doesn't need to cost too much to publish a book. It also means you can allow people to keep the copyright for their own work (and just sign a licence to publish). So it is possible to publish in a way that makes the material accessible to a much wider audience of library and information staff and students, which must be good for the audience and writers!

This campaign aims to raise a small amount of money to get a low cost publisher off the ground to service the library and information community. Books will cost a fraction of the price of "normal" library publisher and writers will retain their copyright. Final cost for each book will be set depending on length and format, but typical cost (not including postage) is expected to be in the region of £20 (or about $30) for print, £5 (or about $8) for an e-version. There's also the potential to do different formats of books - such as quick / short guides by experts that could be significantly cheaper.

What we'll do with the money!

I already have a small number of ISBNs that will meet the needs of the first few books before we'd need to buy more. That leaves costs such as graphic design (primarily for book covers), legal deposit copies, copyediting, indexing, marketing (including a small number of review copies), and a few more bits and pieces! Plus of course, the cost of meeting the campaign perks.

If we can raise the campaign target, it will meet the costs of the campaign perks, plus the initial costs for the first book we publish under this model.

So what will we actually do with the money and what will you get?

£1,000 - we'll publish at least one book (but probably two) in the 12 months after the campaign ends. Campaign funders will be given a chance to vote on what that book should be!

£2,000 - we'll publish at least two books (but probably three) in the 12 months after the campaign ends. Campaign funders will be given a chance to vote on which books they should be!

There will be proper stretch goals announced later ... as we get closer to the goal.

The Perks *Updated*!


£5 - Recognition both online and in the acknowledgements section of the first book we publish after the campaign ends. You also get a chance to vote which books we publish first! We'll also keep you informed on progress of the campaign and the first books.

£10 - All the above perks, plus an e-version of the first book published.

£25 - All the above perks, plus a print (as well as e-version) of the first book published. Includes shipping worldwide.

£25 - Can't wait for the first book? Then get all the normal acknowledgements, voting, etc. plus a print and e-version of 'Only Connect ... discovery pathways, library explorations, and the information adventure.", my previous book! Includes shipping worldwide.

£50 - Not just one book, but two! Get the first two books published sent to you for free. Plus the normal acknowledgements, voting, etc. Includes shipping worldwide. (All for the price of one "typical" LIS book!)

£65 - You'll get an ebook version of every book we publish for the next 3 years - however many that is! Plus, of course, all the normal acknowledgements, voting, etc.

New perk! £75 - Get a print copy of 'Only Connect ...' in full colour (not available printed in colour anywhere else!) to show off the illustrations at their best! Also get print & e versions of the first book published sent to you for free. Plus the normal acknowledgements, voting, etc.

£150 - You'll get a print version of every book we publish for the next 3 years - however many that is! Plus a copy of 'Only Connect ...' to keep you going and, of course, all the normal acknowledgements, voting, etc.

Potential books

Everyone who backs the campaign will have a chance to vote on this list of potenital books (as well as add ideas into the mix), but these are the initial few. Which projects get delivered first will be heavily influenced by votes, but will also depend on me being able to agree and obtain contributions from writers and editors.

  • Designing and using library games
  • Innovating in libraries: Practical case studies and reflections
  • Practical Pedagogy for librarians: Combining learning theory, practical application and teaching tips.
  • Using RDA in your library.
  • How to present for librarians. Practical tips, ideas and examples for presenting at conferences, job interviews and more.
  • Current trends in ... (series of books. What should the trends be? Suggest via comments before the vote!)

  • How to complete the (CILIP) PSKB

  • Open Access (primarily the basics of, moving onto more complex issues)

  • Reflective practice / writing

  • Getting started with Social Media (with focus on overcoming institutional barriers)

  • Project Management

  • Writing bids for income

  • Setting up / supporting volunteer libraries

  • Practical book on selecting, developing, maintaining, etc., Open Source Library Management Systems

  • Top Tips for copyright trainers

  • Best practices in collaborating between librarians, academic skills, learning technologist and other support services
  • Maker spaces: Best practice and case studies for maker spaces in libraries.
Please add your own ideas into the comments (preferably with suggested authors or editors!) and I'll include any I feel are sensible suggestions into the vote.

Other Ways You Can Help

Lots of ways to help, not least by letting people know! Please let anyone you know who may be interested about the campaign, worldwide.

Or if you write (or want to write) on library matters, even if you don't want to back the campaign, please consider making your material available to as many people as possible. Don't sign your copyright away if at all possible. Use Creative Commons licences. Put your material on open access repositories.

You could propose a book  to me that you want to write even if you can't financially contribute. Or volunteer as an editor, copyeditor or indexer.

Last but not least, you can offer to review the books we produce!

A bit more about me

Want to know more about me? Take a look on my website or even better, look at the blog about the book I recently self-published!
