story:
Wrinkles Under The Mistletoe

Last Christmas was the very first time I had ever looked at my grandmother and thought "one day she might not be here" and that really weighed on my heart.   I realized once my grandmother leaves this earth, she will take all the history, memories and connections to our heritage with her.  

I decided to document her life through interviews, audio, and written letters. However, my grandmother had a different view on how the information should be organized. She wanted me to write the love story of her life.  In January we began having interviews wherein Maw-Maw started to recap her life. 

It was the first time I listened to her memories from an adult's perspective instead of a doe eyed grandchild.

  • I gave it my best effort and quickly realized that a) I am not an author and b) I am too emotionally invested.
  • I hired a ghost writer to organize and breathe life into the priceless history.

It Takes A Village

Hiring a professional ghost writer has been the best experience and biggest burden wrapped into one.

Our writer takes the information, builds the story timeline, and writes the chapters.

The ghost writer has worked on the project for four months and anticipates another two to three months before finishing.  

Although I know this gift will be priceless to my grandmother, family and future generations, it is taking a financial toll on me and my family.  With Christmas fast approaching, I am reaching out to family and any one interested in helping fund the end of the project.

  • The ghost writer charges $350 per week.
  • I have funded 16 weeks.
  • I am looking for help for the last 8-12 weeks.
  • Anyone that contributes will receive a digital copy of the book.

Gratitude..... now and 50 years from now

When most people think of their ancestors, they only think back to their grandparents or great grandparents.  My grandmother has the pictures, stories and even recipes for the last five generations.  Helping achieve this goal means more than you realize and will make an impact on our family for generations to come.

THANK YOU!!!

Sneak Peak-- Excerpt From Chapter 1

Walks home were more like scheming races to safety from Dudley, and the mornings were nothing short of humdrum, predictable scenes. It wasn’t until an early August morning in 1951 that everything I knew so well would shift. After strolling pass the same building and passing the same cars and people for months, I never expected anything too exciting. Yet, this particular morning, something with destiny intensions was set to intervene.  Right on schedule, coming down the road the delivery truck was headed to where I was headed, transporting drinks to Kress. It was always the same delivery guy. I prepped for my usual neighborly wave and hello. But this time, he slowed down and leaned out the window.  “Meet me at the next corner,” he said quickly.  There was no time to respond and really no decision to make. You see, I had to turn that corner in order to get to work. He knew that. I didn’t know much about the guy except that he knew some of the girls I worked with and had asked them about me. Oh, and that he was strikingly handsome. The kind of handsome that couldn’t go unmentioned when he walked into a room. He was Italian – dark complexion, dark brown eyes, and a head full of black curly hair.  “I’d like to take you out Friday night,” he said, as I walked closer to where he stood on the corner. His looks matched his confidence.  “I don’t know you well enough” I said, not falling too easily for this good-looking stranger.

Being quite the charmer, his Plan B came so naturally. “Let’s group date,” he suggested. “My cousins are coming down this weekend. Get a few of your girlfriends together.”  I didn’t want to impulsively say yes, but there was something about him that I just couldn’t refuse. I found out later that he knew the girls I worked with so well because he had dated all of them at some point. So here I was, no different than the other girls, willfully being lured into his trance of charisma. That Friday night my girlfriends and I met him and his friends across the river at a good place to kick back and dance. We spent hours either on the dance floor or talking at the bar.   I figured this was just another date to him. But surprisingly, before the weekend could end, he was calling me to go out again. This time, he picked me up from home, and we went back across the river. The places there were known for their chaos-free vibes, great music for dancing, drinks, and no charge at the doors. As the sun went down that Sunday evening, our conversation seemed to have only gained momentum.  “I want to take you to meet my mother,” he insisted.  “Um, right now?” I asked, still trying to believe his spontaneity   “Yes, right now!”  Excited about extending our night together, I agreed, and minutes later, we were pulling up to the Mancuso’s residence. The smell of savory spices met us at the door. Ms. Giovanni, who the family called Jenny, happened to be announcing dinnertime as we walked further inside. With the same breath she introduced herself, she kindly asked me to stick around to eat. She was a heavy set lady who loved to cook, and thankfully, she was phenomenal at it. Her sweet, welcoming personality was purely pleasant to be around. Meeting his father, Mr. Joseph, on the other hand, it was easy to see where my date got his charming characteristics from. Joe, a tall, slim man with the same black, curly hair and dark complexion as his son, was a bit flirtatious, almost that of a womanizer.   As we sat down for dinner, his parents weren’t the only two to join us. Charles and John, his twelve-year-old twin brothers, came racing to the table. At the first sight of them, I thought they were identical. Later, I noticed that Charles was a little heavier than John. They were two kids of pure entertainment and skilled at giving me those good gut laughs. There was nothing uncomfortable about being in their home. I enjoyed myself from the moment I came through the door.  That night, I had my very first Italian dinner – the rich, mouth-watering flavors whipped into her meal were incomparable. Living with French and German parents meant dishes like artichoke, for instance, didn’t make the menu. Besides the difference in our culture of food, I easily noted that their family values were very similar to those of my mother and I, including their Catholic beliefs.  “We’re taking the twins to a drive-in movie,” she said aloud, directing her words towards me. “Junell, you come on with us.”  Sitting amongst the remarkably hospitable Mancuso’s, I was elated she invited me along.  It was our third date of the night, and I couldn’t have been happier or wished for a better first experience with someone’s family. Yet, I refused to carry any expectations for this guy. I remembered how love failed me before, so as far as I was concerned, he could have changed at any minute. “If my whole family wasn’t watching, I’d kiss you good night right now,” he whispered. 
The twins hadn’t looked away long enough to give us any privacy. But I felt the urge in his eyes, and if the moment had presented itself, I knew he would have gone for it. Despite my need to take things slow, I actually wanted to kiss him just as bad.  From that day on, my weekends were taken.  Little did I know, seventeen-year-old Francis Mancuso would become my hero.

Wrinkles Under The Mistletoe Last Christmas was the very first time I had ever looked at my grandmother and thought "one day she might not be here" and that really weighed on my heart.   I realized once my grandmother leaves this earth, she will take all the history, memories and connections to our heritage with her.  
I decided to document her life through interviews, audio, and written letters. However, my grandmother had a different view on how the information should be organized. She wanted me to write the love story of her life.  In January we began having interviews wherein Maw-Maw started to recap her life. 
It was the first time I listened to her memories from an adult's perspective instead of a doe eyed grandchild.

They were two kids of pure entertainment and skilled at giving me those good gut laughs. There was nothing uncomfortable about being in their home. Living with French and German parents meant dishes like artichoke, for instance, didn’t make the menu. Besides the difference in our culture of food, I easily noted that their family values were very similar to those of my mother and I, including their Catholic beliefs.  “We’re taking the twins to a drive-in movie,” she said aloud, directing her words towards me. “Junell, you come on with us.”  Sitting amongst the remarkably hospitable Mancuso’s, I was elated she invited me along.  It was our third date of the night, and I couldn’t have been happier or wished for a better first experience with someone’s family. story:
¿Quién soy?
 Soy Rocío Villaescusa, me licencié en Psicología en la Universidad de Granada y estudié también en la de Santiago de Compostela. Investigué en psicología social, concretamente en prejuicio entre grupos religiosos.
http://spspmeeting.org/PDFS/c2/c278fe1d-8371-4366-a333-cb97aad8680f.pdf   (el artículo aparece en el apartado B211)


¿Cuál es mi experiencia?
Me especialicé en el tratamiento de drogodependencias y terapia ACT (que combina conductismo y elementos humanistas). Este trabajo lo realicé en un centro de atención ambulatoria que cerró por falta de presupuesto, y desde entonces busco la forma de volver a trabajar en ello, pues me apasiona, y la recuperación y mejoría de mis pacientes allí me impulsó a querer seguir ayudando a la gente. 


¿Por qué hago esta campaña?
El motivo de realizar la campaña es que a partir de octubre entrará en vigor una ley que obligará a los psicólogos clínicos que cumplan menos de 400 horas teórico prácticas en un centro sanitario (por tanto, en mi caso no me contabilizarían mis horas trabajadas en clínica por un tecnicismo); y nos veremos obligados a realizar un máster bastante costoso, que poca gente hoy en día puede pagar. 
Además, la mejor formación, una vez que uno ya está formado y especializado, es la experiencia. 
Otra cuestión es el elevado coste que suelen tener las sesiones de los tratamientos psicológicos. Yo realizaré las sesiones a 20 euros la hora, para que el precio no resulte prohibitivo a mucha gente que necesite dicho tratamiento. 


 ¿Qué aportaré como profesional?
Además, como todo se debe adaptar a las nuevas tecnologías hoy en día, podré dar sesiones online, consultas informativas, orientación sociolaboral y servicio a domicilio en el área de Granada y Jaén; todo ello cuando consiga mi objetivo. 
Cada terapia se adapta a un tipo de problema y una persona en concreto. En este sentido, ser rígido y tener un "recetario" no es de gran ayuda. Lo ideal es dominar terapias y saber aplicarlas. Ser ecléctico, y con criterio. 
He aplicado la ACT (terapia de aceptación y compromiso, bastante efectiva en drogadicción y depresión), terapia cognitivo conductual (ansiedad y estrés), psicodrama, terapia narrativa, terapia existencial y terapia centrada en la persona de Rogers. 


 ¿Por qué 2.000 euros?
Los 2.000 euros incluyen el alta colegial, el pago de autónomos, y el coste de apertura y mantenimiento de mi página web, de la que todos estaréis informados en cuanto se abra. 
¿Estaría usted dispuesto a colaborar?
¿Y a compartir la idea para que llegue a más gente?

Linkedin:

https://www.linkedin.com/pub/roc%C3%ADo-villaes...

El Psicomecum, una de las recompensas:

story:
Short Summary

This isn’t a book about magic cures. It won’t tell you about secret foods to feed a child to make their autism go away. It won’t tell you how to get back a child that was stolen by autism. It won’t talk about how children are being poisoned into being autistic either. Plenty of people get trapped on the dark side of an information black hole after a child has been diagnosed with autism. There the conversations are laced with anger about what has been done to make a child autistic, to rob someone of a “normal” child. Receiving a diagnosis of autism for a child can be a devastating event. But it doesn’t have to be. Whether you are a parent of an autistic child, a parent of an autistic adult (yes autistic children grow up to be autistic adults), or an autistic person yourself there is beauty in autism. I hope to give you the clarity to see the treasure there is in relationships with autistic people.

I’ve spent more than a decade now parenting with a life time yet to go. It’s been a wild ride so far and things are sure to get even more interesting as my children (autistic and neurotypical) grow older. While I haven’t seen everything under the sun I have seen quite a bit, and encountered some interesting characters, while learning about autism and caring for my children. This is my effort to give back some of the wisdom that was given to me. In creating this project I drew on the experiences of other parents and some wise folk who have helped me decide what kind of autism parent I want to be.

What We Need & What You Get

Estimated Costs for the Parenting Autism Book Project
toner  $  30.00 I like to print out the research articles I read so I can have them in hand to scribble notes all over them. Same thing for reviewing drafts of the book. These prices are from past purchases on Amazon.com
printer paper  $  20.00
research papers  $  200.00  There are some research papers that I have to pay to access. Some of them can cost as much as a cheap textbook, which isn't all that cheap.
Other research material  $  300.00 For books that I can't find in my local library system.
cover art  $  250.00 The fee charged by a photographer reccommended by a fellow writer.
contributor reimbursement  $  500.00 Two submissions so far and wokring on getting 3 more.
Other publishing costs  $  300.00 For the other stuff that goes with self publishing a book.
funding campaign fees  $  122.00 This should cover fees for payment processing and such.
Total  $  1,722.00  
  • Perks include, but are not limited to, free digital copies of the book, signed hard copies of the book, and Q&A with the author.

The Impact

I struggled as a parent to understand just how I was going to be the kind of parent that my autistic children needed. I also struggled to be the kind of parent that my neurotypical children needed. I know that I am not alone in this struggle. With my work I will provide parents a research based approach to better understanding themselves and the children. Such understanding will lead to parents being able to make choices for themselves and their children with confidence. With the number of children diagnosed with autism on the rise there is a lot of stigma that still surrounds autism. I think it is important for people to understand that there can be joy in a life with autism. There can be healthy fulfilling relationships within families living with autism. Having a healthy and supportive home-life provides a sound base for anyone to launch themselves into the world and participate in society. This is what I want for all autistic individuals, to live free of damaging stigma and to have the opportunity to fully participate in society.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you are a little strapped for cash, these days who isn't, you can still help out with this project.

Tell your friends and family about it.

Start a discussion about people's attitudes about autism and parenting. 

Submit ideas for things to discuss in the book.

Use the various Indiegogo share tools to let the world know about Parenting Autism.

Thanks!

story:
¡Ayudanos a levantar nuestra bandera!

El volteo es un deporte amateur practicado por niños y jóvenes que consiste en hacer gimnasia artística sobre el lomo de un caballo en movimiento. Se lo practica tanto recreativamente como en alto rendimiento, en lo que resulta ser una combinación perfecta entre la danza, la gimnasia y el galope de un caballo.

En Argentina, el volteo se practica desde hace 20 años. El Equipo Nacional Argentino está integrado por 7 atletas –niños y jóvenes de edades diferentes pero de igual talento, seleccionados y becados por su destreza deportiva–, un caballo y su entrenador nacional. Después de mucho tiempo de duro entrenamiento en conjunto, el equipo aspira este año a participar en el Mundial Ecuestre: el evento hípico deportivo más importante a nivel global, que se realiza cada 4 años.

Los atletas que integran el Equipo Nacional de Volteo vienen entrenando juntos desde el año 2010. A lo largo de estos cuatro años se han ido preparando y midiendo una y otra vez en un ambicioso cronograma de competencias nacionales e internacionales, donde han obtenido y siguen obteniendo resultados cada vez mejores.

La participación del Equipo en el Mundial Ecuestre Normandía 2014 sería un importantísimo paso adelante en el crecimiento y la difusión que una disciplina como el volteo, donde niños y jóvenes realizan deporte en contacto con la vida en la naturaleza, en Argentina y en toda la región latinoamericana. El volteo ayuda a elevar la autoestima, a descargar tensiones y a mejorar la fuerza física y mental. También promueve el trabajo en equipo y la convivencia con la naturaleza y los caballos en particular. Queremos que el volteo crezca cada vez más en nuestro país.

Además, sería la oportunidad de los atletas del Equipo Nacional de representar a nuestro país en la competencia más importante de deportes ecuestres en el mundo.

Para lograrlo, contamos con tu ayuda. Gran parte del Equipo Nacional de Volteo recibe becas por parte de la Federación Ecuestre Argentina y el Club Alemán de Equitación que les permiten dedicar el tiempo suficiente a la práctica de la disciplina pero que lamentablemente no cubren los costos implicados en su participación en el Mundial. Gracias a su contribución, los atletas podrán viajar y deslumbrar con su talento al resto del mundo.

Argentina puede ser representada en el próximo Mundial Ecuestre y para eso necesitamos tu apoyo. ¡Acompañanos!

¡Help us raise our flag!

Vaulting is a youthful, theatrical discipline in which athletes perform on the back of a cantering horse. As such, it demands an outstanding physical condition from the vaulter, a harmonious relationship with the horse, and first-class teamwork. It is practiced both recreationally as in high performance level.

In Argentina, vaulting is practiced since 20 years ago. The National Vaulting Team is made up of 7 athletes –children and young adults of different ages but equal talent, selected and awarded scholarships for their performance–, a horse and its national coach. After many years of hard training, this year the team wishes to participate of the World Equestrian Games: the most important sport equestrian event at a global scale, held every four years.

The National Vaulting Team Members have been training together since 2010. During the past 4 years, they have been participating once and again in national and international competitions, where they have been obtaining excellent results.

Their participation in the 2014 World Equestrian Games in Normandy would be an important step forward in the dissemination of a discipline where children and young adults practice sports in close contact with nature both in Argentina and the whole Latin American region. Vaulting is a great way to raise self-esteem, develop team skills and create a close link with horses and nature. We want vaulting to expand and develop in Argentina.

Besides, it would be the opportunity for the National Vaulting Team Members to represent Argentina in the most important equestrian competition in the world.

In order to achieve it, we count on your help. Most of the Team’s athletes receive scholarships from the Argentine Equestrian Federation and the German Equestrian Club which allow them to practice the discipline but which unfortunately do not cover the costs implied in their participation in the WEG. Thanks to your contribution, the athletes would be able to travel and delight the rest of the world with their talent.

Argentina can be represented in the next World Equestrian Games and we lie on your support for that.  Join us!


¿Para qué es el dinero?

  • Costos de ingreso a la competencia
  • Gastos del caballo: nuestros amigos en Alemania nos están prestando un muy buen caballo para competir y solamente hay que cooperar con los gastos de viaje. 
  • Alojamiento y comidas durante el Mundial


What is the money for? 

  • Cost of admission to the competition 
  • Rates horse: our friends in Germany are providing us a very good horse to compete and just have to cooperate with travel costs. 
  • Accommodation, transportation and meals during the competition.
story_txt:
¡Ayudanos a levantar nuestra bandera!El volteo es un deporte amateur practicado por niños y jóvenes que consiste en hacer gimnasia artística sobre el lomo de un caballo en movimiento. Se lo practica tanto recreativamente como en alto rendimiento, en lo que resulta ser una combinación perfecta entre la danza, la gimnasia y el galope de un caballo.En Argentina, el volteo se practica desde hace 20 años. El Equipo Nacional Argentino está integrado por 7 atletas –niños y jóvenes de edades diferentes pero de igual talento, seleccionados y becados por su destreza deportiva–, un caballo y su entrenador nacional. Después de mucho tiempo de duro entrenamiento en conjunto, el equipo aspira este año a participar en el Mundial Ecuestre: el evento hípico deportivo más importante a nivel global, que se realiza cada 4 años.Los atletas que integran el Equipo Nacional de Volteo vienen entrenando juntos desde el año 2010. A lo largo de estos cuatro años se han ido preparando y midiendo una y otra vez en un ambicioso cronograma de competencias nacionales e internacionales, donde han obtenido y siguen obteniendo resultados cada vez mejores. La participación del Equipo en el Mundial Ecuestre Normandía 2014 sería un importantísimo paso adelante en el crecimiento y la difusión que una disciplina como el volteo, donde niños y jóvenes realizan deporte en contacto con la vida en la naturaleza, en Argentina y en toda la región latinoamericana. El volteo ayuda a elevar la autoestima, a descargar tensiones y a mejorar la fuerza física y mental. También promueve el trabajo en equipo y la convivencia con la naturaleza y los caballos en particular. Queremos que el volteo crezca cada vez más en nuestro país.Además, sería la oportunidad de los atletas del Equipo Nacional de representar a nuestro país en la competencia más importante de deportes ecuestres en el mundo.Para lograrlo, contamos con tu ayuda. Gran parte del Equipo Nacional de Volteo recibe becas por parte de la Federación Ecuestre Argentina y el Club Alemán de Equitación que les permiten dedicar el tiempo suficiente a la práctica de la disciplina pero que lamentablemente no cubren los costos implicados en su participación en el Mundial. Gracias a su contribución, los atletas podrán viajar y deslumbrar con su talento al resto del mundo.Argentina puede ser representada en el próximo Mundial Ecuestre y para eso necesitamos tu apoyo. ¡Acompañanos! ¡Help us raise our flag!Vaulting is a youthful, theatrical discipline in which athletes perform on the back of a cantering horse. story:
Deadly Troubadours

My name is Brent Thomas. I've been living in Japan for over a decade. I teach elementary school and work in summer camps. I've been married for five years and have a six-month-old baby. I love comic books, role playing games, playing music and performing. And I write.

This past March I published my first novel, Deadly Troubadours as an ebook and I want to make it available as a paperback. If I were in America, my home country, I would just upload it to a print on demand publisher. But, here in Japan, that is not an option. To make Deadly Troubadours available in the country in which I live I am going to need to print a batch.

What I Need & What You Get

My wife, who also serves as the artist for the book, and I have been contacting printers in the Tokyo area. We have found one we like and they have quoted us an initial price of 100 copies for $1100, well actually 130,000yen but you get the idea. That make the unit copy $11. I want to sell it for $15 so I can make enough off each book to have a nice cup of coffee for each book sold.

To be honest, that same print company has quoted a starting price of 200 copies for $1500 (180,000yen). So, yeah the more we print the more I make, the better the coffee. 

Okay, so I'm not going to spend the money all on advertising. I'm sure some of the cash will go into groceries and diapers for the munchkin, but I also want to be able to advertise on Facebook and drive some traffic to my website and to this campaign. That costs money. Facebook tells me if I want five clicks on my page I should be prepared to spend about $5 a day. If I do that for the entire campaign, that's $150 dollars. 

So, basically this is going for printing and advertising.

The Impact

I want to put this book in peoples hands. I know a lot of us are slowly converting to ebooks. But I have been surprised at the amount of friends and acquaintances who have told me they would like to give it a shot, but they don't like reading for pleasure on monitors. If I can provide a physical copy, that is another outlet for people to read my book.

Risks & Challenges

This book will be made. The book is already out there as an ebook and since March there have been readers who have let me know areas that need typos removed, which is something that will be implemented with this version. I've already got money squirreled away to print off at least 100 copies. This campaign is to help spread the word and to help me find readers. And, honestly, to print off as many copies as I can without having boxes of books fill my living room. The wife has already told me that isn't an option.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! Share on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Tumblr, other social network services I don't understand. Tell your roleplaying group. Tell the guys and gals at your local comic shop. Tell your bandmates and troupe mates.

Go to Goodreads and mark Deadly Troubadours as "want to read." If you have read it review it anywhere and everywhere. Get on iTunes and download the audio podcast "Reading Deadly Troubadours" and review and share that.

story:
Short Summary

Hi! I'm Elizabeth Godley. I have been working with children for over 10 years as a caretaker, mentor, fairy, clown and friend. I am a kid magnet. Seriously, I cannot go into a park without at least 3 kids around me wanting to join in on the fun. Writing a children's book is a long held dream of mine and it's so close to coming true! You are helping it become a reality.

My book has a wonderful message about how change happens to everyone and the solution to the struggle is love, love for yourself and others. 

Ribbon, a bright 7 year old, traveling with her father, encounters a group of bizarre individuals in need of simple guidance. Her new friends become part of her family. The group of characters featured are both ethnically and culturally diverse in order to illustrate that families come in all varieties, with the connecting key ingredient- love.

It is a heartwarming, silly, funny story with a dash of magic! 

The Traveling Castle is magical with a wonderful play room that contains hundreds of bubbles in the air, an art section where you can draw on anything, a slide, swings, a garden, a river, a noise section where everything makes funny noises, a trampoline, a cozy book reading corner with a rocking chair and thousands of books and more!

There are funny made up words that make grownups sound silly when they read them out loud. A favorite among the kids I've read the book to. Silly grownups are hilarious, right?!  

I am publishing with Amazon.

The Illustrator is Paige Murray-Ley of Hue Creative. She is fantastic, as you can see.

What I Need & What You Get

The money I raise here will go directly to publishing costs with Amazon, as well as paying Paige Murray-Ley of Hue Creative for her wonderful work and time.

Possible prizes are: 

A Ribbon's Traveling Castle digital wallpaper, notebook, tote bag, the e-book, hardback signed copies, and donated copies to Sheltering Books Inc.

Sheltering Books, Inc is a 501 (c)(3) charity that provides quality children's books to homeless shelters across the US. Founded by Mackenzie Bearup.

The book will be published on Amazon as a hardback cover and e-book by the end of March 2017.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute at this time, no worries.

Please take the time to share my campaign using the Indiegogo share tools!

Not only will you help the fundraiser, but you will also be spreading the word about the book itself.

story:
Koningsspelen Vrijwillig

Tijdens de jaarlijkse Koningsspelen volgen Nederlandse basisscholen een programma bestaand uit een gezamenlijk ontbijt en een spelletjesdag. Deelname voor leerlingen is verplicht, en ook scholen voelen zich onder druk gezet om mee te doen. Onder het mom van ‘samen bewegen’ wordt zo het Koningshuis in het zonnetje gezet.

Zulke propaganda hoort niet op scholen thuis.

We hebben in Nederland een club speciaal voor dit soort gelegenheden: de Oranjeverenigingen. Als zij de Koningsspelen voortaan organiseren, worden scholen niet overbelast en zijn kinderen niet leerplichtig.

Help ons om de Koningsspelen weer vrijwillig te maken. Laat iedereen #zelfkiezen of ze mee willen doen!

Leerplichtig

Leerlingen van een school die meedoet aan de Koningsspelen zijn leerplichtig en mogen dus niet thuisblijven.

VVD-wethouder Ronald Louwman uit Hoorn besloot in 2014 dat in zijn gemeente de leerplichtambtenaar niet zal worden ingeschakeld: "Niemand wordt verplicht om naar het staatshoofd te zwaaien. Het is hier Noord-Korea niet.” Echter, Nederland heeft meer weg van Noord-Korea dan Louwman dacht. In de gemeenten Amsterdam, Rotterdam, Den Haag, Groningen, Utrecht, Nijmegen, Almere, Breda, Tilburg en Eindhoven moeten kinderen verplicht meedoen aan de Koningsspelen.

Ook scholen worden onder druk gezet om mee te doen. De vele brieven die organisator Richard Krajicek en staatssecretaris Sander Dekker van Onderwijs, Cultuur en Wetenschappen vorig jaar stuurden, gaven veel directeuren en directrices de indruk dat de Koningsspelen ook voor scholen verplicht is.

En dat terwijl propaganda voor de monarchie helemaal niet op scholen thuishoort. Als schoolboeken politieke standpunten uitdragen, worden daar altijd kamervragen over gesteld – behalve als het om het Koningshuis gaat! Dat willen we veranderen.

Wij vragen jouw hulp om de leerplicht voor 22 april op te schorten, en basisscholen van de “morele verplichting” van de Koningsspelen te bevrijden. Zodat iedereen weer zelf kan kiezen of hij of zij mee wil doen aan de schone schijn van de monarchie.

€5,000 om dit onderwerp op de kaart te zetten

We willen dat meer gemeentes (net zoals in Hoorn) besluiten om de leerplicht voor de Koningsspelen op te heffen. Op die manier kunnen ouders hun kinderen thuishouden als zij niet mee willen doen aan de koninklijke propaganda.

Daarnaast willen we dat plaatselijke Oranjeverenigingen de organisatie van de Koningsspelen overnemen van scholen, zodat die hun tijd en aandacht kunnen besteden aan goed onderwijs – en aan sportdagen en andere activiteiten.

Om dit te bereiken moet de druk op gemeentes en de organisatie van de Koningsspelen worden opgevoerd. Daarom willen we dit onderwerp op de agenda zetten via media, sociale media, en lokale acties.

Wat wij willen doen

De Koningsspelen kunnen helaas niet van de ene op de andere dag worden veranderd. Het onderwerp moet eerst op de agenda komen, en dat kunnen wij doen, met jouw hulp! We hebben budget nodig zodat we:

·  Raadsleden in lokale gemeenten kunnen benaderen.

·  Journalisten kunnen inlichten over de zwarte kant van de Koningsspelen.

·  Een grootscheepse brievenactie op touw kunnen zetten.

·  Kunnen investeren in onderzoek naar alternatieve oplossingen voor scholen.

·  Digitale content kunnen creëren om dit issue via social media onder honderdduizenden Nederlanders te verspreiden.

Ook als we onverhoopt niet de 5.000€ halen, zullen we het geld besteden aan onderdelen van het project, en ondertussen proberen elders budget vandaan te halen. Maar we hopen misschien wel over de 5.000 heen te gaan! In dat geval kunnen we het extra geld besteden aan gerelateerde campagnes, allemaal gericht op het democratisch gekozen staatshoofd dat Nederland verdient.

Samen maken we het verschil

We doen dit voor jullie. Iedereen in Nederland hoort het recht te hebben om zelf te kiezen welke staatsvorm hij steunt. Niemand mag worden verplicht om mee te doen aan een spelletjesdag ter ere van de koning.

De monarchie is een achterhaald, ondemocratisch en geldverslindend instituut dat via de Koningsspelen (en via vele andere promotiestunts) een schone schijn probeert op te houden.

Deze campagne wil dit probleem op de agenda zetten. Samen kunnen we zorgen dat onze stem gehoord wordt, en het probleem opgelost.

Het Nieuw Republikeins Genootschap strijdt al jaren voor een democratisch gekozen staatshoofd. We willen dat onderwerp bespreekbaar maken, niet alleen voor onze leden maar voor alle Nederlanders.

Laten we samen het verschil maken!

Een grote uitdaging

Kranten hebben het dwingende karakter van de Koningsspelen lange tijd genegeerd in hun berichtgeving. Een goede mediahype kan ertoe leiden dat meer gemeenten de leerplicht opschorten voor de Koningsspelen. Daarom is ons eerste doel om het onderwerp nu wel in het nieuws te krijgen. Dit is een uitdaging, maar het kan ons lukken – met jouw hulp!

Het gaat niet alleen om geld

Natuurlijk hebben we het geld nodig. Maar als je meer wilt doen, of als je niet in staat bent financieel bij te dragen, dan zijn er andere dingen die je kunt doen om ons te helpen:

·  Verspreid deze oproep via social media en gebruik de hashtag #zelfkiezen

·  Stuur de link naar deze campagne door naar je vrienden en vertel ze over de actie

·  Schrijf brieven naar jouw gemeente, school of lokale krant! Het NRG komt binnenkort met handvaten over hoe je dat het beste aan kunt pakken

·  Word lid van het Nieuw Republikeins Genootschap!

·  Voor meer informatie: bezoek onze website www.republikeinen.nl – maar vergeet ook niet te doneren!

voor onze leden maar voor alle Nederlanders. 
Laten we samen het verschil maken!
Een grote uitdaging
Kranten hebben het dwingende karakter van de Koningsspelen lange tijd
genegeerd in hun berichtgeving. Een goede mediahype kan ertoe leiden dat meer
gemeenten de leerplicht opschorten voor de Koningsspelen. Daarom is ons eerste
doel om het onderwerp nu wel in het nieuws te krijgen. Dit is een uitdaging,
maar het kan ons lukken – met jouw hulp!

Het gaat niet alleen om geld
Natuurlijk hebben we het geld nodig. Maar als je meer wilt doen, of als je
niet in staat bent financieel bij te dragen, dan zijn er andere dingen die je
kunt doen om ons te helpen:
· 
Verspreid deze oproep via social media en gebruik de hashtag #zelfkiezen
· 
Stuur de link naar deze campagne door naar je vrienden en vertel ze over de
actie
· 
Schrijf brieven naar jouw gemeente, school of lokale krant! Het NRG komt
binnenkort met handvaten over hoe je dat het beste aan kunt pakken
· 
Word lid van het Nieuw Republikeins Genootschap!
· 
Voor meer informatie: bezoek onze website www.republikeinen.nl – maar vergeet
ook niet te doneren!

story:
A Book by Lucia Rios

Writer, speaker, and advocate Lucia Rios uses her personal and professional experience with disability to increase awareness of the disability experience. Lucia is currently writing a book that will tell her story through the lens of several critical themes, including identity, disability, and maximizing your opportunities no matter what abilities you have. The book will run approximately 140 pages and be available on Amazon in print and Kindle formats.

Lucia's Speaking

Lucia has already built a website, luciarios.com, to help promote her book and create opportunities for her to speak to groups. In her speaking, Lucia shares her experiences with people with disabilities and their friends and family. She shares her perspective on how to shift attitudes and maximize the contributions people with disabilities make in the world. Lucia's goal is to raise $5,000 to cover the costs of creating her book, as well as initial efforts to build speaking opportunities.


More About Lucia's Book

The book will tell Lucia's personal story through the lens of several critical themes:

  • Disability Is Not Identity. Lucia and other people with disabilities don’t want to be primarily defined by or known for their disabilities. It is not the most interesting aspect of their lives. She and they want to be recognized for their abilities first—what they can do, not what they cannot.
  • Success Is Not About Where You Start, but How You Finish. Everyone is born with a portfolio of assets and liabilities. Some, like extraordinary physical abilities or disabilities, are obvious. Some, like family systems or circumstances, are less obvious to others. But success is not looking backwards and cataloging your limitations; it’s about doing well with your life, performing the tasks given you, and maximizing your opportunities.
  • I Am Not a Representative of a Category. Lucia and others don’t want to be known as a racial minority or disabled person. That is dehumanizing. They want to be known as a complete and regular person, a mix of strengths and weaknesses, accomplishments and disappointments.
  • I Am Not Your Inspiration. Not everything I do is amazing, and I don’t need applause or admiration for living my life. Don’t reduce me to to a symbol or theme.
  • I Am Not Angry, and I Don’t Feel Sorry for Myself. Don’t assume that I’m bitter and want to change your organization or values. I’m happy to live the life I’ve been given, and I can and do choose to be a happy person. And don’t pity me or overcompensate your behavior to make me overly special.

story:
Story of My Book

#sponsored
How amateur athletes and brands can benefit from the sponsorship relationship.

My name is Jasmine Chou. I am the author of #sponsored. I wrote this book because I was fascinated by the relationship between sponsors and sponsees.

My hope is that, in reading this book, your takeaways from the stories will help you with whatever you want to get out of your sport career. Through this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement I have for amateur sports sponsorship. And then ultimately I want you to see this book as a tool to help you to get the support you need to continue elite competition.

In this book, you'll learn about frameworks to apply to yourself and also get a peek into what brands are looking for.

Some highlights include:
  • Story of Global Triathlon Network Presenter Heather Fell
  • Redbull revolutionizing content marketing and how Content is King
  • Final breakthrough of the National Women’s Soccer League

You will love this book if you love sports, want to leverage brand support, or are interested in finding sponsors in sport, love, and life (well, maybe not the love part).

#sponsored is a non-fiction book that speaks to elite amateur athlete and people interested in sponsorship who are looking at amateur sponsorship and shifts in content marketing for the first time.

 

The Book - #sponsored

The book is written in 3 Parts (forgive me, as a triathlete I think in 3s)....

Part 1: In Chapters 1-4, we’ll be go swimmingly from the athlete’s perspective. This part will show how amateur athletes can use certain mindsets to help them help themselves.

Part 2: In Chapters 5-8, we’ll ride through the brand’s perspective and discusses how brands increase their success rate with sponsorships. Understanding the rationale behind why brands sponsor helps prospective athletes.

Part 3: In Chapter 9, we’ll briefly run through the future of sport sponsorship and the increasing shift towards female sponsorship and equality in sports.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The Editor and I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2020

  • The Cover Design of my book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for my book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish next Spring
When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish the first soft copy rendition of the book (also serves to elevate your front wheel on the trainer). When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook (hint: content for your trainer rides). When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition (superb coffee table addition).

I am also offering some exclusive perks for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book/a shoutout on instagram stories!
  • Your name will appear in a Special Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Kudos to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback. You know what they say about feedback: early and often.
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover. We all know y’all have opinions about kits, bikes, books.
  • And more...

 

Book-ie, rookie, cookie

Growing up as a student-athlete, Jasmine was always perceived as more of the student than an athlete. At the most average of average height of 5'5”, Jasmine may have done better in any sport other than basketball. But the athleticism, discipline, and mental grit from her team sports days provided the foundation for Jasmine's new love of swimming, cycling, and running. Her claim to fame is getting 1st in her age-group at her first Olympic-distance duathlon race and absconding all the Tate's Cookie's provided afterwards. In two rookie triathlon seasons, Jasmine finished 4 Olympics, 2 half Ironmans, and 4 Ironman distance races, including Ironman World Championships in Kona. She currently races for Wattie Ink's Elite Team. When Jasmine is not training or eating, she is talking to anyone that will listen to her about multi-sport, sprinkled in with other worldly topics.

For all you social media butterflies, you can connect with Jasmine at @jas.chou on instagram or read more race reports at jaschou.com.

 

QOM Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #GetSponsored and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!
A little not by the book...buy the book!

Jasmine Chou

story:
Story of My Book

Banish the Darkness is a young adult fantasy novel that centers on three humans that must save two worlds, including their own, from the control of a cruel King. Along the way, they learn of their own strengths and weaknesses, and must come to terms with the fact that nothing will be the same again.

My name is Ollie Monteleone and I am the author of Banish the Darkness. I wrote this book because I’ve always wanted to be an author, and since I dreamt up this idea in 2017, I knew I wanted to share it with the world.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will be able to step outside reality and explore the worlds I’ve created, and the characters that inhabit them. I want you to see this book as a chance to witness the choices each character makes, and observe how it impacts the plot, as well as their own arcs, as they are unable to escape from the consequences of their actions. 

You will love this book if you enjoy young adult fantasy novels with well-developed characters, complicated plot lines, and deep, often morally grey, villains. 

Banish the Darkness speaks to fantasy lovers and allies and members of the LGTBQ+ community, who want to grapple with issues involving family in a new way and overcoming moral dilemmas from a different perspective.

Ultimately, I hope that Banish the Darkness inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

How can I help others while remaining true to myself?

How important are blood family and chosen family in people’s lives?

How can we better ourselves by normalizing those different from us? 

I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. I believe discussing chosen family vs blood family, being true to yourself, embracing your differences, and always fighting for the betterment of ourselves and others will change us all for the better. 
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2021.

The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)

The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).

The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.

The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this winter.


When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.

Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.

You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.

You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.

You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

 

About the Author


Ollie Monteleone is a recent graduate from Marist College with a degree in English and a concentration in Writing. Ollie also completed minors in Philosophy, Professional Writing, English Literature, and Creative Writing. They have been on the dean’s list for seven semesters and graduated with Latin honors. They also graduated as the captain and president of the Marist College Fencing Team. 

Ollie wrote this book after having a fantastical dream and knowing that the idea would be far too interesting to not share with other book lovers. They want to highlight how important representation is in creative literature, especially young adult literature, and hope that this book is able to resonate with a broad audience. 

Ollie likes to read and write, and has a ton of half-finished ideas right behind Banish the Darkness. When they aren’t writing, they’re getting active and swimming whenever possible. Ollie also loves all types of music, except country, and jams out all day in order to gain inspiration. 

For more information, you can connect with Ollie at olmonteleone@gmail.com and at @olliemonteleone and @authorolliemonteleone.
 

International Preorders

For international pre-orders, please send me a private message.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #BanishtheDarkness and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

You can also follow me on social media: @authorolliemonteleone on Instagram, Olivia Monteleone (https://www.facebook.com/olivia.monteleone.1) on Facebook, and https://www.linkedin.com/in/olivia-monteleone-0... LinkedIn!

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again and all the best,
Ollie

story:
We need to match our grant

This year, Women Who Submit is proud to announce that we secured a $4,500 Local Impact Grant from the California Arts Council!

These funds will cover almost half of our programming costs for Fiscal Year 2020, but in our grant application, we had to demonstrate that we could raise the rest ourselves. 

That’s where you come in. 

We need your help keeping Women Who Submit up and running for the next year. Since 2011, Women Who Submit has supported women and non-binary writers in 14 states and three countries through the submission process. Our bimonthly submission parties in Los Angeles and our chapter meetings across the country continually bring in new writers who are ready to get published. Your contribution helps us create spaces where women and non-binary writers can share submission strategies, encourage each other’s work, and break barriers to publication. We have expanded our mission over the years and empowered writers to apply to residencies, fellowships, and conferences as well.

With your contribution, we can bring in leaders from the writing community to deliver panels and workshops on topics like finding an agent, creating an author website, submitting to contests, and applying to residencies. We can secure public, accessible spaces in which to host our bi-monthly submission parties. We can continue awarding submission fee stipends, which is another way of breaking financial barriers that writers often struggle with. We can also utilize live-streaming and transcription services to make our workshops more accessible to those who can’t be with us physically because of transportation barriers and/or disabilities. We can present on these issues at national conferences, such as AWP, furthering our mission to make space for marginalized voices in literature.

Your contribution will go to our 501(c)3 fiscal sponsor, Avenue 50 Studios.

Women Who Submit is about community. We empower and encourage the writers in our community to break their own barriers to submission, and we advocate for a publishing landscape that is welcoming and accessible to ALL communities.

 

Will you join our community and help make our 2020 goals possible?

 

About Women Who Submit

Women Who Submit seeks to empower women and non-binary writers by creating physical and virtual spaces for sharing information, supporting and encouraging submissions to literary journals, and clarifying the submission and publication process.

 

WWS History

Women Who Submit began with the idea of a submission party—the brainchild of founding member Alyss Dixson—as a response to the VIDA count, which illustrated just how vastly underrepresented women are in Tier 1 literary journals. Other founding members, Ashaki Jackson and Xochitl-Julisa Bermejo, were brought in to help plan the first ever submission party held in Xochitl-Julisa’s mom’s kitchen (thanks, mom!) in July 2011. On that day six women ate quiche, created a sharing library of lit journals, set goals, asked for feedback on cover letters, and sent off submissions.

 

WWS in virtual space

Our Facebook page, Twitter feed, YouTube channel, and blog are tools WWS uses to continue its mission to empower women and non-binary writers to submit their work to literary magazines for publication. It is completely open to any and all writers who are seeking online support and information. We also use these outlets to promote future projects and public events.

WWS in physical space

The submission party is how this group began, and we continue to join together in each other’s homes and public venues to share, support, and submit.

 

What is this money for?

 

Speaker Fees $600

Submission Fee Grant $600

story_txt: We need to match our grantThis year, Women Who Submit is proud to announce that we secured a $4,500 Local Impact Grant from the California Arts Council!These funds will cover almost half of our programming costs for Fiscal Year 2020, but in our grant application, we had to demonstrate that we could raise the rest ourselves. That’s where you come in. We need your help keeping Women Who Submit up and running for the next year. Since 2011, Women Who Submit has supported women and non-binary writers in 14 states and three countries through the submission process. Our bimonthly submission parties in Los Angeles and our chapter meetings across the country continually bring in new writers who are ready to get published. Your contribution helps us create spaces where women and non-binary writers can share submission strategies, encourage each other’s work, and break barriers to publication. We have expanded our mission over the years and empowered writers to apply to residencies, fellowships, and conferences as well.With your contribution, we can bring in leaders from the writing community to deliver panels and workshops on topics like finding an agent, creating an author website, submitting to contests, and applying to residencies. We can secure public, accessible spaces in which to host our bi-monthly submission parties. We can continue awarding submission fee stipends, which is another way of breaking financial barriers that writers often struggle with. We can also utilize live-streaming and transcription services to make our workshops more accessible to those who can’t be with us physically because of transportation barriers and/or disabilities. We can present on these issues at national conferences, such as AWP, furthering our mission to make space for marginalized voices in literature.Your contribution will go to our 501(c)3 fiscal sponsor, Avenue 50 Studios.Women Who Submit is about community. We empower and encourage the writers in our community to break their own barriers to submission, and we advocate for a publishing landscape that is welcoming and accessible to ALL communities. Will you join our community and help make our 2020 goals possible? About Women Who SubmitWomen Who Submit seeks to empower women and non-binary writers by creating physical and virtual spaces for sharing information, supporting and encouraging submissions to literary journals, and clarifying the submission and publication process. WWS HistoryWomen Who Submit began with the idea of a submission party—the brainchild of founding member Alyss Dixson—as a response to the VIDA count, which illustrated just how vastly underrepresented women are in Tier 1 literary journals. Other founding members, Ashaki Jackson and Xochitl-Julisa Bermejo, were brought in to help plan the first ever submission party held in Xochitl-Julisa’s mom’s kitchen (thanks, mom!) in July 2011. On that day six women ate quiche, created a sharing library of lit journals, set goals, asked for feedback on cover letters, and sent off submissions. WWS in virtual spaceOur Facebook page, Twitter feed, YouTube channel, and blog are tools WWS uses to continue its mission to empower women and non-binary writers to submit their work to literary magazines for publication. It is completely open to any and all writers who are seeking online support and information. We also use these outlets to promote future projects and public events.WWS in physical spaceThe submission party is how this group began, and we continue to join together in each other’s homes and public venues to share, support, and submit. What is this money for? Speaker Fees $600Submission Fee Grant $600Event Space $1,200Planning Meeting: $350Refreshments $200Supplies $100Website Maintenance $200Transcription $600Marketing $550Event Host: $300Orientation Leader: $800Administrative costs (Indiegogo's fees, shipping, etc): $500 More perks will continue to be rotated in during the campaign so check back for updates! Claps and cheers of gratitude for our fiscal sponsor, grant funders, community members and perk donors:California Arts CouncilCenter for Cultural InnovationAvenue 50 StudiosEugene Owens and the Dr. Mary McLeod Bethune Regional Branch of the LA Public LibraryJessica Ceballos y CampbellKate MaruyamaJack Jones Literary ArtsBook ShowKaya PressJaded Ibis PressUnnamed PressSundress PublicationsHyacinth Girl PressLibroMobileMinal HajratwalaOtherwildUrban 728 YogaGracie's PizzaThe FacultyTasty's Juice BarJessica BixelWendy C. story:
THANK YOU!

It is a tremendous blessing to have the project fully funded! Work on the Epistle Book is underway, and will kick into high gear after Pascha.

We will continue to accept contributions, which will be put towards the third volume in our series, the Prophetologion, the liturgical Old Testament of the Orthodox Church. We will continue to update the Acknowledgements page in the printed Epistle Book with additional names until we go to press. 

Project Overview

Saint Ignatius Orthodox Press grew out of our Gospel Book project, the incredible reception to which we have been incredibly blessed by.

With the Gospel Book (now approaching sellout on the first edition!), our goal was to publish a book we desired for our own prayer corners: a dignified, beautiful book of the Gospels with a sacred look and feel, which contains a detailed, pan-Orthodox lectionary, well-suited for both church and home use. We accomplished this with the incredible support of over 50 individuals.

Of course, the story of our faith does not end with the Ascension of our Lord. The Epistle Book is the companion to our Gospel Book, and that is what this campaign is about.

We will be using the same excellent English/Greek Orthodox Bible (EOB) translation as the Gospel Book, which is based on the official Patriarchal Text of the Orthodox Church, and is both dignified and accessible in its translation style. It will have the same form factor and beautiful styling. All of this contributes to a book which truly looks and feels important, dignified, and holy.

Features

  • 5x7.5 inch cloth-bound hardcover with sewn binding — Portable, easily fits in the hand
  • Gorgeous foil stamped iconography on the cover — Gives the impression of a sacred text
  • Robust, acid-free paper stock — Not super-thin "Bible paper" or cheap photocopy paper
  • Replete with tasteful iconography and ornamentation — Enhanced beauty inside and out
  • Two-tone red and black printing — Crisp, readable text at an ideal font size and weight
  • Four ribbon bookmarks — Enough bookmarks for virtually all liturgical possibilities
  • EOB translation — Dignified Modern English translated from the official Orthodox texts
  • Pan-Orthodox Lectionary — Readings for many feasts of local significance
  • Abundant supporting material — Prokeimena, Alleluiaria, and more

Breakdown

We are seeking to raise $15,000 to fund the printing of 1000 copies of the Epistle Book.

More than two-thirds of this goal covers the hard printing costs—which are significant for the high-quality materials and printing quality that we require for this holy book, in the estimated 500 page length.

The other one-third covers a royalty due to the EOB translation and costs associated with layout and design. (Being about 20% longer than the Gospel Book, there is also 20% more text and graphics to prepare.) We also have a minimal amount of overhead and we need to offset Indiegogo's payment processing fees.

Donors will receive some wonderful perks—best of all, copies of the printed book, and more. See the full breakdown.

If we don't raise the full $15,000 in this campaign, we will set aside the funds and continue our fundraising efforts outside of Indiegogo until we are able to proceed with the project. It took about four months to raise the funds for our Gospel Book, but with your help, we hope to make it within Indiegogo's 60 day window.

Stretch Goals!

If we happen to raise more than $15,000, those funds will be put toward the next additions to the library of books we are building, including our upcoming companion Prophetologion: the liturgical Old Testament of the Orthodox Church. We are excited to expand this library, and we hope that you will continue to support Saint Ignatius Orthodox Press in these efforts to produce high-quality texts. 

The Impact

The Gospel Book has only been available for a few months, but we are approaching sellout! We have heard from donors and buyers who are incredibly touched by the book they received. Here are just a few samples of the five-star reviews we have received:

Beautiful, powerful, full of grace, the best English translation available... Everything I could want in a Gospel. Glory to God!

It’s a fitting volume for the life and teachings of our Lord and Savior. The quality binding and four ribbon markers sets it apart from so many others. 

It is a treasure to have, to read, to use for meditation and to share with others. Thank you very much.

Lives are being impacted and spirits are being lifted through the words of Our Lord. This is the impact that you, the contributor, will have with the Epistle Book project, as it joins the Gospel Book as a beautiful matching set in homes and churches around the world.

A sacred book is not something that will be easily tossed aside and forgotten. With a liturgical calendar through the year 2100, and a timeless value that comes with the Holy Scriptures, your contributions will touch lives for a lifetime and many decades to come.

Challenges

The biggest challenge with the Gospel Book project was our unfamiliarity with the publishing process on this scale. Having been through it, we are confident that things will run smoothly as we move through the process and keep you updated along the way. With God's help, every challenge can be overcome when we working for Him.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute right now, we invite you to share this page with your friends and family. And we ask for your prayers, as such a significant undertaking comes with spiritual challenges as well. Thank you for your kind support!

story:
My Story

Hi, my name is Esther Leung, wife and mother of 3 children. My family immigrated to Canada in the 90s from Hong Kong. In this book I will share my story and struggles as a child immigrating to a new country, it will describe some of the cultural clash and identity crisis I encounter. As I grew up I have the honour of meeting Indigenous people who became my friends, I learned about their culture and stories including their personal experience in residential school. This is one of the major turning points in my life that opened my eyes to see the suffering and resilience of Indigenous people here in Canada. The story will also describe how it transforms my identity as I  learn to embrace my own cultural roots. 

While this can be a heavier subject for a children's book, but there are valuable lessons that I think children can understand even at a young age. It is never too young to educate especially through stories. The target age group will be for children 5 - 10. Parents and teachers can read this story together with the younger ones. 

My dream is even if one child can relate to the struggles, one child can see themselves as part of this story, one child can see their classmates going through this journey, one child has gained more empathy and understanding, then my goals for this book have been achieved! 

 

What inspired me

Earlier in 2019, I saw an infographic online about the lack of diversity there are in children's book characters. Did you know that only 7% of America’s children’s books use Asian characters and only 1% have Indigenous characters? Less than 25% of the books are written to reflect children of colour and visible minorities. 

After posting this “infographic” on social media a friend challenged me to be part of the solution. While I cannot represent all children of colour but at least I can represent my own heritage and my own story. After talking to my family and they are supportive of this, the wild idea of me writing this book was birth nearing my 40th birthday! 

What is needed

For this project, I need to raise $5000 for printing, shipping, art/illustrations, editing, marketing and related cost. 

  • The uniqueness of our perks packages is that it includes donating books to inner-city children and underpriviledged children in rural areas globally. 
  • If you contribute $500 or more you will receive a name acknowledgement in the book itself.  

The Impact - Your contributions would mean

  • Sowing into diversity for children's books.  
  • Cultivate understanding, empathy and expanding the worldview of all who reads it 
  • Learning about different cultures.  
  • Bringing awareness to the history of Indian Residential School.
  • Bringing awareness to the struggles of immigrants.
  • Donating this book to inner-city students and even children from rural areas with underprivileged backgrounds globally. This depends on the perks package you select. 

 

Risk and Challenges 

This is my first crowdfunding campaign, and first-time self-publishing, so there are inherent risks to the timeline of navigating unknowns. The expected date of book arrival is estimated by September 30th, 2020, approximately the time of having a pregnancy from right now! The book will be manufactured in China, so if there's a Chinese holiday or other events, that could potentially delay the bookbinding and shipping. While these are for the most part out of my control, I don't anticipate this will set us back by more than a few weeks at most.

 

    Other Ways You Can Help

    • Please help spread the word by posting on your social media and if you can go a step further by forwarding the email campaign that would be wonderful!
    • Please pray for this project will be honouring and a blessing to others. 

     

    Thank you in advance for your support!

story:
The Lives Behind A Crisis

Hi, we are two master communication students at the University of Amsterdam with an ambitious and exciting project, so please read on!

Why we're doing what we're doing

In recent years, media have been very busy covering the big stories in Europe as it has been flooded with crises. First, the financial crash in Greece; then the civil war in Ukraine; followed by the influx of millions of migrants to Germany; lastly the terror attacks in Paris. These last few years in Europe have been unquestionably difficult. The media did not get one break between reporting. However, they mostly focused on governmental intervention, military action, even specific terrorists. 

We feel like in all these reports about these crises, in all the discussions and debates about politics, money and borders, something really important has been forgotten: There are people that deal with these crises – everyday. 

Who are these people whose lives have been changed in the blink of an eye?

We'd like to find out.

This is our plan

In the coming year we are planning to travel to four places in Europe that have been hit by a crisis recently.  

We will spend one week in Paris (France), one week in Passau (Germany), one week in Kiev (Ukraine) and one week in Athens (Greece).

We want to get to know these places and most importantly the people, their stories and their lives. Our goal is to paint the portraits of these individuals that have been impacted by crisis. We are hoping to find that beside all the differences in European culture, finances and politics, we all share the same dreams, fears and hopes for ourselves and our families.

Our dream is to share this experience with the rest of the world in the form of a narrative book that tells the unique story of specific individuals' lives that neither many Europeans nor foreigners really know about.

We need your help!

Travel budget:

  • Train to Paris 100,- Euro p.p.
  • Flight to Athens 250,- Euro p.p.
  • Flight to Kiev 250,- Euro p.p.
  • Flight to Munich and train to Passau 120,- Euro p.p.
  • Transportation at location ca. 260 Euro

Why support us?

It took a lot of courage for us to put the idea into motion, as we are aware that this project requires a lot of time, resources and dedication. However, now we are sure that we can bring this project to life because... 

  • Good karma :)
  • We have amazing friends and supporters in each country
  • We have academic backgrounds in sociology, political communication and media studies
  • We have publishing and writing contacts
  • We are hard workers, highly motivated and enthusiastic

Other Ways You Can Help

Do you have further ideas? Please let us know. Also if you have friends, family or other contacts in or near Paris, Athens, Kiev or Passau. You can contact us on our Facebook page.

Thanks for your help, 

Alexa Brooke Sanford &

Anna-Maria Leo

story:
Basics:

Frontispiece from Amharic version

 

From Nairobi to the Jubilee Palace

Mr. Harka Haroye Odda

(Ibrahim Mohammed – undercover name)

A Political Autobiography

Addis Ababa 1997 E.C.

(2004 Gregorian calendar)

 

Story:

Reviews of the Amharic version:

It is not often that we Ethiopians write and tell our compatriots history of our times as we have lived it.  This is a book that should be read and cherished by many.  Indeed, it deserves, in my opinion, to be translated into other tongues and thus made accessible to a wider readership.  

Reading it is truly a rewarding experience.

                Teshome Gabre-Marian Bokan

 

I read Ato Harka’s book, From Nairobi to the Jubilee Palace, with a curious mixture of relish, excitement, anger and profound sorrow.  The adventure, the drama, the suspense, and above all, the carnage and bloodletting, could rival those in any novel – but this is not a work of fiction.

                Dr. Girma W. Selassie

Harka (back row right) with friends in Yergalem, late 1971

Story Excerpt:

What is called a ‘day’ in the life of a prisoner starts at 6AM. The day begins at 6 because that is when the body that cooked in the furnace of the hot night separates itself from the mattress. Picture the fact that it is only possible to sleep on one’s side (deboka) since there isn’t enough space due to the 80-100 inmates in a room four by four meters.  The first duty after waking up is folding up one’s blanket length-wise and rolling up of the mattress carefully. The blankets are lined up beside the wall, and bed sheets and gabis (cotton blankets worn as shawls) are put into sacks.

The floor of the room is dusted first followed by sprinkling liquid detergent, then finally polished using rags, after cleaning the floor shines like the face of a well to do person.

One can’t visit the restroom after waking up or when nature calls. First the cell mates must line up and wait their turn. Unless the chief of the compound loudly announces the room’s turn to go, no one is allowed to visit the toilet. Visiting the toilet at the same time as inmates of another room is forbidden. By this method prison officials prevent the mixing of inmates from different rooms.

When the room number is called followed by a shout `To the lavatory`, inmates walk out with the sick first. Rolled up tissue paper is handed to each inmate by the prisoner economic committee. Flip flops are taken out of sacks and handed to inmates. These are among the items inmates do not have the right to own. Flip flops are taken out of sacks only when needed, otherwise they stay in the sacks outside the cell. They do not have owners, they belong to the room. As they are the property of the prison camp, they also can be taken to other rooms as well.

Unlike the Derge Central Investigations Office, the amount of time an inmate is allowed to stay at the lavatory is not limited; however, haste is always necessary. Inmates must be prepared for the day before the investigators begin work, they must return from the lavatory, eat, organize their belongings, and be patiently waiting for the feared call of one’s name. As a result, the norm every morning is to rush before facing the day whether it brings endless boredom, a move to another prison, a call to the investigation room, or the end of one’s life.

Back from the lavatory, an inmate washes his face, leaves his sandals at the gate and enters the cell. Then each has to sit in a line on the shining floor. Everyone has to sit with legs apart so that another inmate can have space to sit in between his legs. In this position, bread with tea or bread with just water is served for breakfast. The prayer of every prisoner is ‘let me see tomorrow, let me partake of another meal.’

 

From Nairobi to the Jubilee Palace

Dedication –      This book is dedicated to those who have struggled and paid a price for the rights, freedom, and equality of Ethiopians.

Acknowledgment – Support from the author’s friends, supporters, and family.

Preface – The author is a member of the Ethiopian golden generation from the 1960’s

Chapter 1 – Sidama people

Chapter 2 – Personal background: birth, upbringing, and education

Chapter 3 – New life in a new city

Chapter 4 – Journey to Burdji

Chapter 5 – Beginning of emigration to: my stay in Kenya

Chapter 6 – Back in Ethiopia under cover of amnesty and infiltration of Derge for the Ethiopian People’s Revolutionary Party (EPRP) mission

Chapter 7 – Omo Valley guerilla fighting

Chapter 8 – Sidama situation under the fascist Derge regime

Chapter 9 – End of the “drama”

Chapter 10 – Central Investigation Office

Chapter 11 – Kerchele prison

Chapter 12 – After Kerchele

Conclusion – Suggestions for a sustainable system

Appendix – List of the martyrs

Team: Staff of Hawassa University and friends of Mr Harka

Funding: It is estimated that this work will cost between $3,000 and $5,000.
story_txt:
Basics:

Frontispiece from Amharic version

 
From Nairobi to the Jubilee Palace
Mr. Harka Haroye Odda
(Ibrahim Mohammed – undercover name)
A Political Autobiography 
Addis Ababa 1997 E.C.
(2004 Gregorian calendar)

 
Story:
Reviews of the Amharic version:
It is not often that we Ethiopians write and tell our compatriots history of our times as we have lived it.  This is a book that should be read and cherished by many.  Indeed, it deserves, in my opinion, to be translated into other tongues and thus made accessible to a wider readership.  
Reading it is truly a rewarding experience.
                Teshome Gabre-Marian Bokan
 
I read Ato Harka’s book, From Nairobi to the Jubilee Palace, with a curious mixture of relish, excitement, anger and profound sorrow.  The adventure, the drama, the suspense, and above all, the carnage and bloodletting, could rival those in any novel – but this is not a work of fiction.
                Dr. Girma W. Selassie

Harka (back row right) with friends in Yergalem, late 1971
Story Excerpt:
What is called a ‘day’ in the life of a prisoner starts at 6AM. The day begins at 6 because that is when the body that cooked in the furnace of the hot night separates itself from the mattress. Picture the fact that it is only possible to sleep on one’s side (deboka) since there isn’t enough space due to the 80-100 inmates in a room four by four meters.  The first duty after waking up is folding up one’s blanket length-wise and rolling up of the mattress carefully. The blankets are lined up beside the wall, and bed sheets and gabis (cotton blankets worn as shawls) are put into sacks.
The floor of the room is dusted first followed by sprinkling liquid detergent, then finally polished using rags, after cleaning the floor shines like the face of a well to do person.
One can’t visit the restroom after waking up or when nature calls. First the cell mates must line up and wait their turn. Unless the chief of the compound loudly announces the room’s turn to go, no one is allowed to visit the toilet. Visiting the toilet at the same time as inmates of another room is forbidden. By this method prison officials prevent the mixing of inmates from different rooms.
When the room number is called followed by a shout `To the lavatory`, inmates walk out with the sick first. Rolled up tissue paper is handed to each inmate by the prisoner economic committee. Flip flops are taken out of sacks and handed to inmates. These are among the items inmates do not have the right to own. Flip flops are taken out of sacks only when needed, otherwise they stay in the sacks outside the cell. They do not have owners, they belong to the room. As they are the property of the prison camp, they also can be taken to other rooms as well.
Unlike the Derge Central Investigations Office, the amount of time an inmate is allowed to stay at the lavatory is not limited; however, haste is always necessary. Inmates must be prepared for the day before the investigators begin work, they must return from the lavatory, eat, organize their belongings, and be patiently waiting for the feared call of one’s name. As a result, the norm every morning is to rush before facing the day whether it brings endless boredom, a move to another prison, a call to the investigation room, or the end of one’s life.
Back from the lavatory, an inmate washes his face, leaves his sandals at the gate and enters the cell. Then each has to sit in a line on the shining floor. Everyone has to sit with legs apart so that another inmate can have space to sit in between his legs. In this position, bread with tea or bread with just water is served for breakfast. The prayer of every prisoner is ‘let me see tomorrow, let me partake of another meal.’
 
From Nairobi to the Jubilee Palace
