story:
¿Qué?

La meta es el fracaso es una de esas historias que te obligan a pensar acerca del paso del tiempo, de los sueños que alguna vez tuviste, y de lo lejos que estás de la imagen que te habías creado de ti mismo en el futuro.

Desalojo de una ocupa en Madrid. Cuatro personajes confluyen en medio de un ambiente agitado y violento para mostrarnos fragmentos de sus vidas: Rafa, insumiso con el poder del Estado, se ve de pronto envuelto en una conspiración que puede llevarlo a dilapidar su juventud en la cárcel; Azucena, una joven maltratada que encara la hipocresía de quienes decían quererla, busca recuperar el amor de Soraya, su mejor amiga, con quien deberá derribar un sólido muro de incomunicación construido a base de silencios, distancia y terquedad; Reynaldo y Julisa, actor y actriz otrora adversarios a la sombra de dos maestros y enemigos entre sí, comparten, sin embargo, ilusión y compromiso para con su arte, y ya lejos de la lógica alienante de sus antiguas compañías descubren de repente que sus carreras se han venido abajo, pues sus vidas, en general, hace tiempo cojean.

Cada cual imbuido en su propio mundo de relaciones, busca de forma paralela emerger del fracaso, y ven de improviso cómo sin querer sus historias se entrelazan, se tocan y crean codependencia. Deciden pues unir picardía y valor para hacer frente común al peso de la vida. No saben que tendrán que ser más fuertes que nunca; pues si bien al juntarse suman brazos, inteligencia y grandeza, también el azar se confabula para convirtise en el uracán que amenaza con despedazar su ilusión.

Amores fallidos, sueños truncados, luchas perdidas, La meta es el fracaso es una historia llena de ternura, violencia, miedo, alegría y esperanza. Es la constante y sempiterna búsqueda de la felicidad.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una joven editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el crowdfunding.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy te presentamos a Óscar Morales.

1979, solo meses antes del inicio de la guerra civil salvadoreña, nace Óscar en la ciudad de San Marcos, urbe con más barrancos y monte que edificios y carreteras; de manera que, a pesar de los continuos atentados, secuestros y muerte que ensombrecen al país durante doce años, Óscar disfruta de una infancia asalvajada y feliz. A los trece, ingresa en el Colegio Externado de San José, institución jesuita obsesionada con las matemáticas y las tareas en general, donde le ordenaron siempre y sin peros que se fuera a cortar el pelo. Allí sufre su adolescencia. Sin embargo, gracias al incentivo de algunos profesores y profesoras, también crece su inerés por la literatura y el teatro.

En 1998, entra en la Universidad Centroamericana José Simeón Cañas, en la facultad de Comunicaciones y Periodismo, al tiempo que, de manera informal, realiza estudios de interpretación. Gana el Primer Premio de Cuento Estudiarte de la Universidad con el cuento Atardecer en el templo y obtiene la primera mención honorífica en los Juegos Florales de San Salvador, quizá allá por el 2002, con la novela corta Obsesión criminal.

En 2005, viaja a Quito para continuar sus estudios de interpretación con la escuela de la compañía Mala Yerba. A finales de ese mismo año, se traslada a Madrid, donde es cofundador de la compañía Los Perdidos Teatro, para la que escribe piezas como Debajo del pellejo y La instrucción de las sombras, entre otras. En 2012, deja su trabajo para dedicarse por entero a la escritura de La meta es el fracaso, que culmina en 2015.

En la actualidad, además de realizar una variedad de trabajos que le ayudan a pagar el alquiler, Óscar se dedica a escribir y a cambiar el mundo.

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 840€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cuarenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán para sacar adelante esta primera edición de La meta es el fracaso que saldría después a la venta.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Óscar Morales vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

story:
WOW – I am honored to have been asked to join the Indiegogo InDemand program after our success on KickStarter (as a "project we love")!

As an InDemand program, your support is both a pre-order for the book itself and a continuation of financial assistance (thank you!)

 NEW to Indiegogo – A printable ebook for pre-order and a fantastic stretch goal – see below for more details.

 

The Historical Heroines Coloring Book: Pioneering Women in Science from the 18th and 19th Centuries will celebrate 30+ women scientists from a time when women couldn't readily go to college, let alone enter a field in science. 

These women are powerful role models – women who broke with tradition and pursued their own passions. I'm selecting an assortment of women, some of whom are better known and many who aren't as well known. Some of the women I'll be including are Marie and Irene Curie, Alice Ball, Ellen Swallow Richards, Inge Lehmann, Roger Arliner Young, Wang Zhenyi, Ada Lovelace, and Mary Treat. 

As shown in the video, I imagine the coloring book to even spark imaginative play, enticing kids to pretend to be the very scientists they color and learn about! 

Each woman scientist will be featured on a double page spread. On the lefthand side, there will be a short biography that highlights some of what she is known for and on the righthand side, the coloring image itself that will showcase aspects of her accomplishments. I also plan to include a glossary of terms and a resources guide for further inspiration and education.

The book itself will be printed on beautiful 80 lb. paper with perforation for easy viewing outside of the book. The cover will be a sturdy 110 lb cover-stock and the binding is saddle-stitched. We are now busily working to create the book! Once ready, the books will be printed in Massachusetts and shipped in August.

Through my own publishing journey with my girl-empowering, eco-conscious, science-minded children's picture book series: The Adventures of Piratess Tilly, I've met some wonderfully talented people. Kendra Shedenhelm is the artist behind these whimsical and edgy coloring pages. I will be writing the short bios myself and will be employing research and editing help from science historian, Michael Barton. He contributed to the educational biography on Charles Darwin in both of The Adventures of Piratess Tilly books. 

As a mother, I often think about books and tools that I would have loved as a child – activities that would have inspired my curiosity, creativity and love of nature and science – in hopes of then sharing them with my own daughter – and beyond! 

I am honored that the response has been so enthusiastic thus far – thank you! With the success and encouragement on KickStarter, I am thrilled to announce a new version of the book for pre-ordering – an ebook at a special Indiegogo price! As the mission is to inspire, empower, and educate children, teens, and adults around the world, I felt it necessary to add an ebook edition of the coloring book that you can print yourself. This way teachers will have easier access as will anyone around the world!

Thank you for your support with this new project and I hope you enjoy an "I Supported Historical Heroines" kiss-cut sticker – complimentary with every printed book order!

Announcement: Stretch Goal

With your help,  I am hopeful we will hit our stretch goal to translate the bios into Spanish for a Spanish Edition! My colleague, author Mariana Llanos is so excited to do the translation. I encourage you to check out her beautiful books, some of which are in English and Spanish.

Help us get to this goal so that Historical Heroines can reach even more children, teens, and adults!  

Thank you again! –Elizabeth Lorayne & The Historical Heroines Team

story:
What is Genre Wars?

Resistance Rising began back in 2012 with the filmmaking competition, Genre Wars, and it has been an ongoing adventure ever since.  The initial premise of one genre type fighting another grew into a stand-alone story, peopled with complex characters living in their own expanded universe.  The landscape of this world incorporates the aesthetics from multiple genres, including Fantasy, Film Noir, Sci-Fi, Steampunk, Vampires, Ninjas, and so much more.

 
After developing, writing, and filming the Genre Wars web series, Robin began adapting the story into prose.  Intended to be a simple writing exercise, it quickly turned into a full-scale manuscript, which is now a complete novel and ready to be published!
 

 

Novel Synopsis

Five years into Kabathan’s worst war, the Oniyum is still missing. The planet is in disarray, tribe fighting tribe. Mechs, Nenjin, Wranglers, Steampunks, Mobsters, Vampians, Necromancers, Vikings, and Pirates all trying to annihilate each other. The Fantasarians officially stand accused of the theft, but they refuse to confess or back down, which only deepens the conflict.

After a particularly deadly explosion erupts on the outskirts of Fantasarian land, Reman — a young, fast-advancing pilot for the Mech Republic — is assigned to investigate.  Alone, deep in wild Fantasarian country, trouble finds Reman immediately. Ambushed, taken captive, and surrounded by his culture’s oldest enemies; Elves, Wizards and the acrid stench of Magic. He prepares to sacrifice himself in the name of war, but, instead, finds himself confronted with a question that will challenge everything he’s ever known."

 

 

What Do I Get?

After years of work, the novel is finally ready for publication!  Self-publishing, though, we need a little bit of help to see it through to completion.  

All funds raised here will go towards the costs and fees associated with the publishing process; text formatting, cover design, distribution, and, of course, printing the books themselves.  This is only a start-up goal for a first print run, but you can help get more books printed by contributing to the campaign in any amount you want.

So what do you get?  Perks!  There’s the book, of course, plus a few more surprises available to you. 

Digital Novel: This includes a downloadable digital PDF edition of Resistance Rising, plus a high-resolution, digital map of Kabathan and a digital thank you from Robin.

Paperback Edition: A copy of Resistance Rising in paperback (as soon as it is available from the printer) plus a custom bookmark.

Book Bundle: A downloadable pdf of the novel, a paperback version as soon as it is available from the printer, and a high-resolution, downloadable map of Kabathan.

Poster and Postcard: An 11x17 Poster and postcard of the book cover, featuring the artwork of Annamarie C. Mickey.

Mug Raffle: Your name will be entered into a raffle drawing to win a custom-designed Resistance Rising coffee mug.

Signed Paperback: A paperback copy of the novel signed by Robin and Justin.

Signed Poster: Get a paperback copy of the novel along with an 11x17 Poster, both signed by Robin and Justin.

The book is estimated to be sent to the printer at the end of March.  This campaign is flexible funding; if the goal isn't reached, every dollar will still go towards the perks and publication of this novel.

On the other hand, stretch goals include a second print run, more hardcover copies, and taking the book to local conventions and book festivals.

Subscribe to the mailing list at RobinCFarrell.com to receive updates.
 

 

 

The Team

 

Robin C. Farrell
Writer of prose and script, filmmaker, and all-around geek.   Washington D.C. area local, Robin grew up aspiring to become a novelist, meanwhile developing a love and fascination of cinema.  At the age of three, she was quoting The Wizard of Oz.  As an adult, she has worked on film productions as script supervisor, production coordinator, assistant director.  She produced her first short film in 2012, The Stranger and currently, she is a full-time video editor for DUO Media Productions.

Seeing Resistance Rising through to finished, published novel would, quite literally, be a dream come true.

 

Justin Moe
Filmmaker, actor of stage and screen, and sci-fi/fantasy nerd, Justin grew up with a passion for film and telling stories through film.  He has spent several years as a working actor, as well as freelance film crew in the Washington D.C. area, occupying multiple roles in both spheres.  He continues that work today and, in recent years, he has found himself teaching drama and directing high school theatre.  He produces and directs his own, independent projects, including Genre Wars: Resistance Rising and The MooMoe web series.

 

 

Other Ways To Help

If you're as enthusiastic as we are about making this book a reality, then spread the word!  Use the IndieGogo share tools to get the word out, and you can also find Genre Wars on social media:

  • @GenreWars or @UnusualSidekick (Robin) on Twitter
  • Genre Wars: Resistance Rising on Facebook
  • GenreWarsSeries on Instagram

​Join the mailing list at RobinCFarrell.com and visit the Genre Wars website to see behind-the-scenes videos from our web series journey and learn more about the evolution of the Genre Wars project.

And a huge thanks to everyone that has been a part of this journey so far.
story_txt:
What is Genre Wars?Resistance Rising began back in 2012 with the filmmaking competition, Genre Wars, and it has been an ongoing adventure ever since.  The initial premise of one genre type fighting another grew into a stand-alone story, peopled with complex characters living in their own expanded universe.  The landscape of this world incorporates the aesthetics from multiple genres, including Fantasy, Film Noir, Sci-Fi, Steampunk, Vampires, Ninjas, and so much more. After developing, writing, and filming the Genre Wars web series, Robin began adapting the story into prose.  Intended to be a simple writing exercise, it quickly turned into a full-scale manuscript, which is now a complete novel and ready to be published!  Novel SynopsisFive years into Kabathan’s worst war, the Oniyum is still missing. The planet is in disarray, tribe fighting tribe. Mechs, Nenjin, Wranglers, Steampunks, Mobsters, Vampians, Necromancers, Vikings, and Pirates all trying to annihilate each other. The Fantasarians officially stand accused of the theft, but they refuse to confess or back down, which only deepens the conflict.After a particularly deadly explosion erupts on the outskirts of Fantasarian land, Reman — a young, fast-advancing pilot for the Mech Republic — is assigned to investigate.  Alone, deep in wild Fantasarian country, trouble finds Reman immediately. Ambushed, taken captive, and surrounded by his culture’s oldest enemies; Elves, Wizards and the acrid stench of Magic. He prepares to sacrifice himself in the name of war, but, instead, finds himself confronted with a question that will challenge everything he’s ever known."  What Do I Get?After years of work, the novel is finally ready for publication!  Self-publishing, though, we need a little bit of help to see it through to completion.  All funds raised here will go towards the costs and fees associated with the publishing process; text formatting, cover design, distribution, and, of course, printing the books themselves.  This is only a start-up goal for a first print run, but you can help get more books printed by contributing to the campaign in any amount you want.So what do you get?  Perks!  There’s the book, of course, plus a few more surprises available to you. Digital Novel: This includes a downloadable digital PDF edition of Resistance Rising, plus a high-resolution, digital map of Kabathan and a digital thank you from Robin.Paperback Edition: A copy of Resistance Rising in paperback (as soon as it is available from the printer) plus a custom bookmark.Book Bundle: A downloadable pdf of the novel, a paperback version as soon as it is available from the printer, and a high-resolution, downloadable map of Kabathan.Poster and Postcard: An 11x17 Poster and postcard of the book cover, featuring the artwork of Annamarie C. Mickey.Mug Raffle: Your name will be entered into a raffle drawing to win a custom-designed Resistance Rising coffee mug.Signed Paperback: A paperback copy of the novel signed by Robin and Justin.Signed Poster: Get a paperback copy of the novel along with an 11x17 Poster, both signed by Robin and Justin.The book is estimated to be sent to the printer at the end of March.  This campaign is flexible funding; if the goal isn't reached, every dollar will still go towards the perks and publication of this novel.On the other hand, stretch goals include a second print run, more hardcover copies, and taking the book to local conventions and book festivals.Subscribe to the mailing list at RobinCFarrell.com to receive updates.   The Team Robin C. FarrellWriter of prose and script, filmmaker, and all-around geek.   Washington D.C. area local, Robin grew up aspiring to become a novelist, meanwhile developing a love and fascination of cinema.  At the age of three, she was quoting The Wizard of Oz.  As an adult, she has worked on film productions as script supervisor, production coordinator, assistant director.  She produced her first short film in 2012, The Stranger and currently, she is a full-time video editor for DUO Media Productions.Seeing Resistance Rising through to finished, published novel would, quite literally, be a dream come true. Justin MoeFilmmaker, actor of stage and screen, and sci-fi/fantasy nerd, Justin grew up with a passion for film and telling stories through film.  He has spent several years as a working actor, as well as freelance film crew in the Washington D.C. area, occupying multiple roles in both spheres.  He continues that work today and, in recent years, he has found himself teaching drama and directing high school theatre.  He produces and directs his own, independent projects, including Genre Wars: Resistance Rising and The MooMoe web series.  Other Ways To HelpIf you're as enthusiastic as we are about making this book a reality, then spread the word!  Use the IndieGogo share tools to get the word out, and you can also find Genre Wars on social media:

@GenreWars or @UnusualSidekick (Robin) on Twitter

Genre Wars: Resistance Rising on Facebook

GenreWarsSeries on Instagram
​Join the mailing list at RobinCFarrell.com and visit the Genre Wars website to see behind-the-scenes videos from our web series journey and learn more about the evolution of the Genre Wars project.And a huge thanks to everyone that has been a part of this journey so far.

story:
Short Summary

        Andre Ashby has been in full time ministry and saying, "Yes" to the Spirit of God for 20 years. His life is an amazing story of God's grace and desire for us. At a young age of 4 in the midst of family rejection and alcoholism God reached into the ghetto and began to give him dreams. Ultimately God lifted him out and led him from nation to nation around the earth.  He believes that your past doesn't have to dictate your future and that through Jesus nothing is impossible!

       This book, "Come, Holy Spirit", is an obedient and loving response. Andre was commissioned to do two book projects by God. This is the first. When God's manifest presence shows up everything changes. A church, a city, a region or even a nation can be unquestionably shaken by the Sovereign Presence of God. In this book Andre tells stories of His Presence and gives practical application.

        By contributing financially, through prayer and by sharing this campaign you can partner with us in sharing the message that God wants to explode into our world with the power of His presence!


What We Need & What You Get

         The funding we raise will go towards the cost, marketing and production of the book. Any additional funds will be used for the promotion  and travel costs associated with the book.

     As a small token of our thankfulness we have put together an exciting list of perks that include signed copies of the book, an online face to face with Andre and more! 

Endorsements

         Endorsements for the book have been written by friends like:

         James Goll (Foreward)

         Dr. Che Ahn

         Joann McFatter

          Ryan C. Lee

          Glenn Dunlop

          Dr. Eva Gonzolas

          William Ford lll

          Shawn Boltz

      

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • PRAYER! Pushing through to build and distribute a project like this takes extreme amounts of favor, fortitude and faith.
  • Please help to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign. Check out the indigogo share tools!

story:
Torah is what keeps our spiritual world. And that is why it is important for us to learn, and teach. Torah 

All our lives around the leadership of the Torah. 

Of course it is impossible to hold without the spiritual world and the material world so we need the help of anyone who wants to gain both spiritual and to share with Torah students. 

Holy Bible says that whoever supports the learner. Paid in the next world. And a blessing in this world indefinitely,

story:
Summary

I want to drive trucks to support my overwhelming authoring habit. (I'll be using a speech-to-text program while driving, to write while I drive.)

I previously raised $730 and I have been accepted to Celadon Trucking's Driving School (on their dime, so long as I drive 120,000 paid miles for them after school), but I have to take care of a few prerequisites now, to get there, including relocation to the U.S, new eye glasses (and prescription) a "road kit" and a few other things.

Trucking school is FINALLY IN MY GRASP. PLEASE HELP ME GET THE REST OF THE WAY!  

Risks & Challenges

I'm 42 Years Old, been divorced three times, and have been self-employed (sometimes successfully and sometimes not so much) for most of the past 25 years. It will be a new thing to "work for the man," but also, I think a tremendous opportunity to achieve some personal dreams and financial stability that's been lacking in my life since my last divorce.  I really want to start my financial life over AND further my writing career at the same time, and this is a great way for that to happen. I hate admitting that I need a leg-up, but I do. Even as little as $5 can help. I promise to take full advantage of the opportunity, to be worth the money that it takes to give me the leg-up I need --and I promise to, when possible, pay it all forward -- every single dime. Thank you in advance!

YAY! We're into STRETCH GOALS!

We made the initial goal to get me there! Thank you. Now, not to be greedy, but I did set this campaign up for the bare minimums of getting there. I will now be creating a travel blog which every contributor will be invited to view. If we reach $2,500, I will open up the blog for the whole internet to view!  Thanks for being part of my dream!

story:
My name is Vanna Smythe and I am a published fantasy author. I recently released the second book in my epic fantasy series, Anniversary of the Veil.  Now I am about to start writing Book 3, which will be the final book in the trilogy.

I started writing the Anniversary of the Veil series in November 2009. About 2 and a half years later, in March 2012, I self-published Protector, the first book in the series.  This was a childhood dream come true for me, as I had always wanted to be a writer and one day write and publish a book of my own.  Protector was very well received, and allowed me to finish the sequel, Decision Maker, in only 9 months.  

For Book 3 in the series, I want to go even faster. My final deadline is June 10, 2013.

To meet this deadline, I need some help from you. I will have to devote most of my time to writing and revising Book Three, if I am to complete it by early summer.

What I Need & What You Get

The money you donate will be used for the creation of the final book.  I will spend it on:

- A professional cover design and artwork ($300)
- Professional Editing and proofreading ($400)
- Expert eBook and print book formatting ($250)
- Marketing and book launch advertising ($250)

Special Backer Perks
 
I've devised a number of backer perks, which I'm sure will be to your liking ;) Since this is Book 3 in the series, and the story might not make complete sense unless the books are read in order, the perks also include Book 1 and Book 2.  See the side bar for more details.

The Impact of Your Donation

Most importantly, your donation will allow me to let go of the worry of how I will finance the production of the book. In this way I will be able to focus solely on the writing, and on making Anniversary of the Veil, Book 3 the best I can.

In simpler words, what you are giving me is peace of mind and the knowledge that I can and will write my best book yet.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't donate money?

Please share this campaign with your friends via email, Facebook, Twitter, and elsewhere.


Thank you!
 
****

A bit more about my Anniversary of the Veil series:

Protector (Anniversary of the Veil, Book 1)

Book description:

Duty versus love is the one battle warrior Kae doesn't know how to fight. Kae has trained his entire life to become an elite Protector of the Realm. But when he earns that honor he finds himself protecting something far greater: the Veil separating two worlds. On one side of the Veil lie untold stores of magic. On the Realm's side, magic is all but obliterated, and Kae is one of the few who can use it. The priests who secretly rule the Realm will do everything they can to control his growing magical abilities. He's willing to pay the price, even though it comes between him and Issa, the princess he loves. But the Veil has weakened over a thousand years and powers on both sides will stop at nothing to keep it intact. Strangers from the other side have kidnapped Issa to take her across the Veil and sacrifice her to strengthen it. Kae is the only one who can find her. If he goes after Issa, he loses everything he's worked so hard for. But if he chooses duty over love, Issa will die.

Decision Maker (Anniversary of the Veil, Book 2)

Book description:

Kae, a warrior Protector, has followed Princess Issa across the Veil separating two worlds. They were told Issa will be a key player at the Anniversary of the Veil, but have been mislead! Kae will have to make a terrible choice when the Anniversary finally comes. He is the Decision Maker and will have to play a part in a ceremony that will join Issa's Life Force with her Other Half - but in so doing, it could leave her senseless or worse, dead. As the King fights to find his daughter, as the Priesthood is falling apart; Kae has to decide if he will kidnap the Princess to stop her Joining and force her into a life of unhappiness, or if he will allow her to Join and thereby leave her a mere shell of herself. Meanwhile friends and foes alike are showing only half-truths to both Kae and Issa. They must make the most important decision of a lifetime without enough knowledge. How can they know it will be the right one?

 

I have also made the first 21 chapters of Protector (Anniversary of the Veil, Book 1) FREE to give readers a better sample of the books and my writing. You can download it from any of these links:

Amazon

Barnes and Noble

iBookstore

Kobo

Smashwords

story:
"WOW, WOW, WOW": What can I say folks, but a very BIG thanks, for helping us hit that original target so quickly, 3:30pm (Aus Local Time) Tues: 22/01/13 - in less then 2 days !

* But it's not over yet folks, "YOU CAN STILL HELP" - as the campaign clock still has to tick down - before things are finalised !

So for anyone else considering a donation, please do, as all extra monies will go towards the purchase of the second piece of software needed (Read Below) - Or some much needed stable hardware to complete all the work on..!

As a way saying of thanks, I have kicked off a "VIP Group", where you'll gain access to the magazine, one week before anyone else !

THANK YOU AGAIN !!! - YOUR ALL VERY 'COOL A MUNDO' !!!

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

About the Video: Just to make it clear, the grunting you hear in the background of the vid, is not the wife growning and moaning about me being out in the shed again, 'not' working on the Triumph... no folks.. it's my two border collies.. doing what they do..!? Read in to that.. what you will..!? :)

About the Magazine: It's an independant, raw, greasy, gritty & grimy publication hopefully showcasing all the Vintage Choppers, Bobbers, Cafe' & Classic Motorcycles, owners, builders and independent business supporting them, in and around Australia.

It's being put together by a bunch of folks with bugger all publishing experience, but tonnes of love for the content ! All donating and sharing their time, experiences and travels to hopefully encourage and inspire others to do the same !

We do it all, because we simply love what we are involved in, and what's happening around us and would love to see more of it kicking off around Aus !

Due to current financial constraints, at the moment, the magazine will only be available online, but hopefully we'll build up a great bunch of advertisers who's financial contributions will go towards funding the future paper publication of this magazine (Future and past issues) !

Draft Contents of Issue #1:

  • Buzz's '42 U Model HD
  • Random Ramblings - Captain Small Sword
  • 2012 City to Coast Chopper Run
  • Artist Profile: Lizard Designs
  • Mr Zee's '57 Triumph Chop
  • Way of Ruin: Tales from the Kulture in Melbourne.
  • Ran's '77 Shovel, Ran Style
  • Busted Knuckles, words by the Angry One
  • Jimmy's XS650 Chop
  • Handy build ideas from the garage.
  • Lucky's Speed Shop Xmas Party
  • Voodoo Daddy's '81 Shovel Chop
  • Chucky's, Electrickery for the Retarded
  • Luke's 50's Triumph Bobber
  • Doomsday Run
  • Pato's XS650 Chop
  • Allan's Ironhead Sporty
  • Tattoo Shop/Artist Profile
  • Annual Events Calendar
  • Kick Arse Magazine Listings
  • DVD Features
  • Goods/Gear Features
  • and a heap more..!

The Software Needed: I've found some software that will work well that has the following feature's,

  • A Lifetime license,
  • Locally installed on my PC,
  • Outputs in to a web page and Flash format,
  • Converts to digital mags from a PDF,
  • Has Page-flip & zoom animation,
  • Keyword searching,
  • Printing,
  • Can produce online & offline editions,
  • The ability to add links, videos, audio,
  • The ability to add links to web & email,
  • Create contents menus,
  • Archive previous issues,
  • Create .epub and .mobi eReader output,
  • iPad, iPhone, mobile compatible,
  • Bookmarks and Notes features,
  • YouTube embedded videos,
  • Add ‘more info’ free text areas,
  • iPad /iPhone App,
  • Android App,
  • Facebook Magazine App,
  • Desktop offline reader App

If we go over the target: All monies that go over the target or are left over from the initial purchase of the publishing software, will go towards the future purchase of a product that will hopefully assist me with putting together future issue's of this rag (as I'm using some very basic and frustrating software at the moment).

Something like Adobe In Design, which appears to have to be purchased in a package (Creative Suite) with a current asking price of about $3500.00

Thankyou ! Crew, your contribution would be very much appreciated..! And if your keen, I'd like to publish your generoisty via the DL Magazine website and also in the first issue of the magazine, as a way of thanks and recognition, as without all you great peoples, publishing the mag online in February, just wouldn't happen..!

And if I could do more for you, I would.. and will.. if an oppurtunity arrises..!

Regards, Jamie (Chops) Day

Regards, Jamie (Chops) Day

story:
In Tanzania il nuovo anno scolastico inizia a gennaio. Da gennaio 2012 il villaggio di Bumbuli ha una nuova scuola: la “Kin’gen’gezi pre-primary school”, che ospita 40 bambini, di cui la maggior parte orfani a causa dell’HIV, o bambini che vivono in condizioni economiche e sociali di grave disagio: gli sforzi da compiere sono ancora moltissimi. A Bumbuli, così come nella maggior parte dei villaggi rurali della Tanzania c’è ancora un elevatissimo numero di bambini orfani e che vivono in condizioni particolarmente disagiate. Crediamo che la scolarizzazione gratuita sia l’unico strumento davvero in grado di liberare queste generazioni dalla povertà e di donare loro speranza e futuro. Nonostante gli innegabili tentativi fatti dal Governo tanzaniano negli ultimi anni per incrementare il tasso di frequenza scolastica, sono ancora moltissime le famiglie che non possono permettersi di mandare i propri figli a scuola. “Kin’gen’gezi” è una parola Sambaa, lingua tribale di Bumbuli, che significa lucciola: proprio perchè dare la possibilità di andare a scuola a questi bambini, significa dare loro una piccola luce di speranza! In questa occasione, vorremmo anche ringraziare tutte le persone che ci sono vicine e che ci aiutano concretamente con il loro lavoro, il loro prestare servizio gratuito e il loro supporto.

Obiettivo del progetto è creare un aula informatica, preparare dei formatori che la rendano utilizzabili dai circa 600 ragazzi beneficiari (considerando tutti i villaggi limitrofi che già prendono come punto di riferimento Bumbuli, perché è l'unico tra questi, con una struttura ospedaliera) e predisporre un Internet Point che renda sostenibile la gestione della struttura.

story:
THE PITCH

For over 17 years, CineStory, a U.S. 501(c)(3) nonprofit, has been dedicated to nurturing original voices in screenwriting. Alumni have penned films such as IRON MAN, CHILDREN OF MEN, BALLAST, KING OF CALIFORNIA, DARK MATTER and PHOEBE IN WONDERLAND.

In 2013, CineStory seeks to launch a new website to provide tools for aspiring and emerging screenwriters wherever they may be.

Acting as a trusted source of information, the new CineStory website will bring this artistic community free podcasts, webinars, forums and articles about the craft and business of screenwriting.

Curated from existing resources as well as drawing on CineStory’s stable of incredible mentors, all of whom are working Hollywood professionals, the site will offer in-depth advice and analysis on all things screenwriting that blends real world expertise with a love of the craft in its purest form.

CineStory's mentors include:

  • Academy Award nominated writing team Mark Fergus & Hawk Ostby (IRON MAN, CHILDREN OF MEN, AKIRA, COWBOYS & ALIENS)
  • Keith Gordon (writer/director, DEXTER, WAKING THE DEAD)
  • Joe Forte (writer/director, FIREWALL)
  • Philip Eisner (writer/director, EVENT HORIZON, MUTANT CHRONICALS)
  • Glenn Gers (writer/director, FRACTURE, MAD MONEY, ZORRO REBORN)
  • Bruce McKenna (writer/producer, BAND OF BROTHERS, THE PACIFIC)
  • Lisa Callamaro (agent, THE CALLAMARO AGENCY)
  • Michelle Sy (producer, STOLEN SUMMER, FINDING NEVERLAND)
  • Amy Salko Robertson (producer, THE OH IN OHIO, WHEN DO WE EAT?)
  • Meg LeFauve (writer/producer, FLORA PLUM, THE DANGEROUS LIVES OF ALTAR BOYS, THE BABY DANCE)
  • Shelia Hannahan Taylor (producer, FINAL DESTINATION 2, THE FINAL DESTINATION, REPLI-KATE)
  • Julie Lynn (producer, ALBERT NOBBS, MOTHER AND CHILD, WIT, 10 ITEMS OR LESS, THE JANE AUSTEN BOOK CLUB)

WHY CINESTORY MATTERS

Storytelling is one of our most basic forms of communication. It entertains, challenges and ultimately teaches us something about the human experience. Film is at the forefront of our contemporary storytelling culture.

CineStory seeks to nurture those screenwriters whose voices might never otherwise be heard. As a nonprofit, it occupies a special place in a landscape that is too often driven by profit and commercialization.

With your help, we can build not only a new website, but a new online community.

WHERE YOUR MONEY GOES

When you give to the CineStory campaign for a new website, every cent will go towards:

  • Graphic design and website interface
  • Website hosting costs
  • Technical support

No donation is too small.

And if you aren't able to make a donation, you can still support this campaign by posting about it on Facebook, Twitter and other social media. It will make a huge difference!

If you love great films, please support great screenwriters.

story:
The goal: Show me how well this works for a blog of 20K followers.  I have plans for films and books and other projects and I need to know if I have enough of a following to pull off a decent haul on a crowdsourcing site.  So regardless of whether this makes its goal, the project will be accomplished.  If it does well, I move on to the more costly projects.  If it fails and I don't get a single penny, I wait until I hit 50K followers and then try again.

So why should you send me money in the first place when, like everything else on the blog, it's all farce?  For the perks.  Some are actually pretty darn cool, and most are fairly cheap as compared to the gross national product of Italy.  The top perk may also be of interest to you venture capitalists and fledgling megalomaniacs out there, it's a bit pricier but well worth it I assure you, as any blog with the audacity to try a stunt like this is well worth owning.


All funds will be spent on fulfilling perks and expanding or promoting the blog, or its sibling projects such as Snail Factory or Valhalla.  In the highly unlikely event the top perk is claimed or the project reached its full goal, or even half of that, the funds will allow me to do the blog full time for the year.

story:
Find One Reason To Smile is the first title in a series of motivating and inspiring coffee table books.

Author and entrepreneur, Anita Hawkins will share with you her very own, as well as  other moving stories from everyday individuals from all walks of life. Men, women and children, are welcome and encouraged to post stories where they managed to FIND ONE REASON TO SMILE through their unique storm or adversity.

Anita has launched this Indiegogo campaign to raise funds for an organization close to her heart.  100% of the donations will benefit Womencalledmoses.org.  Women Called Moses was created to be an underground railroad for victims of domestic violence. The organization seeks to prevent and end the cycle of violence against women.  They accomplish this through education and advocacy services provided to individuals, families, and community agencies throughout the United States of America.

Be one of the first twenty-five individuals to donate $500, and YOUR story and photo of your choice will be included in the book FIND ONE REASON TO SMILE due out June 2015. This series of coffee table books are being created to uplift, empower, inspire and raise funds and awareness for this very important cause.

Thank you for your support!

story:
HEY! I'M MIKE ROSEN.

I'm a poet and educator in NYC. I use poetry and storytelling to bring people together and advocate for social progress. I've performed around the world at venues like Yale University, The Whitney Museum, University of Michigan, The Tang Teaching Museum and more. See some of my work here!

I'M HERE TO NORMALIZE THE LESS THAN PERFECT. JOIN ME ON TEAM F*CK FEAR. 

I'm tired of living in a world that demands perfect selfies and "humble brags" while convincing us that zits, stains and heartbreaks are shameful.  I'm on a mission to normalize the less-than-perfect, raise awareness around mental illness and help people get through their grief. Together, we can give fear the finger. 

My personal story deals with overcoming grief, healing from heartbreak, and living with mental illness. I'll be recording a 7-track album of poetry about these topics (and a healthy number of poems about solo bedroom dance parties) to show how I move through all of it, to prove that healing is a real, attainable, and daily thing. Then, I'll bring these stories to  living rooms and venues from New York to California.

Your contributions will cover the costs of recording (production, artwork, printing and promotion) and touring (travel, merch production, and lodging). This will allow me to share these stories with even more people who need them.

HIT THAT PINK "Back It" BUTTON AND LET'S GET LOUD. Remember, your social shares count for just as much as your dollars. 

 

WHAT I NEED AND WHAT YOU GET

Every dollar helps me "take this show on the road."  Here's the full breakdown...

  • Album Costs:  recording and production, cover art, compensation for collaborators, video production of a "single", licensing, printing, distribution and promotion... $4059.00

  • Touring Costs: travel to shows in Philadelphia, San Francisco, Los Angeles, Austin, Houston, Laredo, San Antonio and New York, daily costs, print up of merch and promotional material... $2,434.75
  • Total Needed: $6,493.75

If you contribute to this campaign then you make a statement about the standards of perfection we hold. You also get the following:

  • Personalized Short Poem
  • Early Copy of the Album
  • Limited Edition Merchandise (posters and more)
  • Personalized Video Performance of Your Favorite Poem!
  • Tickets to the Show of Their Choice!!
  • A Private Dinner + Performance in Your Home!!! 

I WANT TO JOIN TEAM F*CK FEAR. WHAT DO I DO NEXT?

Your time and your network is just as valuable as your wallet. Let's pretend this is a poetry slam and try to make as much noise as possible!  Share this on social, email friends, put posters in your friends' houses -- everything counts and EVERYTHING is very much appreciated. 

 

Thank you for reading this. Thank you to everyone who is standing in my corner. Thank you to everyone who is ready to reach their hands down in order to pull someone else up.

I love y'all.

story:
UPDATE 08/26/2021

Heir of Blood and Secrets is now officially published and available on Amazon! 

 

----

 

 

This campaign will run until May 2nd. During that time, I hope to continue to grow my Author Community and reach as many people as possible. Whatever funds we raise beyond $5000 will go towards:

  • subsidizing international shipping costs for all my amazing backers outside of US/Canada
  • adding a world map and character sketches to the paperback/ebook
  • publishing a hardcover version if we hit $6000!

 

----

 

Story of My Book

Heir of Blood and Secrets is a dystopian young adult novel about a girl who chooses to be a hero.

Scylla has waited her entire life for an opportunity to prove herself. When her father is accused of a murder he did not commit, she eagerly embarks on a quest to clear his name. As she races to find the real killer before it’s too late, she begins to unearth the secrets hidden under the gilded exterior of her city, forcing her to question all that she’s ever known.

My name is Linda Xia and I am the author of Heir of Blood and Secrets. I first started writing this book when I was 14, because I wanted to tell a story about an ordinary girl who chooses to do extraordinary things. I found - and still find - the trope of the Chosen One frustrating, because there aren’t a lot of ancient prophecies in real life and I believe we can all choose to be heroes. We don’t need to wait to be chosen.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will begin to see that the world is so much more complex than we often realize and that it isn’t always clear what the right thing to do is. At its core, this is a book about coming of age in a world that is beautiful, brutal, and often inexplicable.

 

The Book - Heir of Blood and Secrets

In this book, the protagonist, Scylla, fights to exonerate her father, a politician who’s been accused of a murder she’s convinced he did not commit. Scylla’s been born into privilege. But the world she grows up in is divided, not only be class, but by gender and race, and we see how these factors shape her journey and those of the people she interacts with as she struggles to come to terms with who her father really is.

It’s set in the fictional city of Devovea, a place where the wealthy elite are held accountable to none and rampant corruption rages beneath the glossy exterior of the Castle. As Scylla is confronted with the truth about her birthright, she finds herself torn between returning to the life she’s always known and becoming the real hero she’s always wanted to be.

You will love this book if you enjoy dystopian mysteries, driven, complex characters, and often wonder what our society could be. Heir of Blood and Secrets challenges you to consider how far you are willing to go, what you are willing to sacrifice, to do what needs to be done to forge a better world.

Ultimately, I hope that Heir of Blood and Secrets inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, and leads readers to grapple with such questions as:

  • Why do I see the world the way that I do?
  • How does my perception of the world shape what I believe in and what I’m willing to fight for?
  • How can I choose to be a hero and give voice to those who should be heard but aren’t?

I look forward to exploring these questions and more with you. Looking at the parts of ourselves we may not be proud of is difficult and exhausting, but I believe doing so will change us all for the better.

 

What I Need & What You Get

These pre-order tiers are set up to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August 2021
  • The cover design of my book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The layout design for the interior of my book, for both physical and e-book editions
  • The copy editing for my book, to polish grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this summer

 

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and e-book. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. 

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish (and it will be personal)
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book
  • You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process
  • And much more!

The first 30 backers will also receive a limited edition Heir of Blood and Secrets laptop sticker [now sold out!].

 

About the Author

Linda Xia is proud to be a member of the class of 2022 at Minerva Schools at KGI. She’s lived in San Francisco, Seoul, Hyderabad, and Berlin thus far and hopes to be on rotation in London come September.

She’s wanted to tell Scylla’s story for most of her life and is excited to finally see it published. She hopes that it will inspire young girls to do cool, heroic things whenever they want to, because she believes that life is too short to spend waiting for someone else to choose you.

She’s the proud owner of over 200 books, all of which have been rescued from various book sales. Her work has been published in various anthologies and she loves (read: is obsessed with) writing, a condition that often interferes with her obligations as a university student. She currently resides in Canada with her cacti, Christi and Spike, and her family. But she spends more time talking with her cacti.

If you want to learn more about her cacti or just chat about life, you can connect with Linda by emailing lxia@minerva.kgi.edu or reaching out to @lindaxia_author on Instagram.

 

International Preorders

The economics of international shipping are a little complicated so please send me a private message for international preorders!

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

I will be working closely with my publisher to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. I will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #bloodandsecrets and tag me so I can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!


Thanks again,
Linda Xia
story_txt:
UPDATE 08/26/2021
Heir of Blood and Secrets is now officially published and available on Amazon! 
 
----
 

 
This campaign will run until May 2nd. During that time, I hope to continue to grow my Author Community and reach as many people as possible. Whatever funds we raise beyond $5000 will go towards:

subsidizing international shipping costs for all my amazing backers outside of US/Canada
adding a world map and character sketches to the paperback/ebook
publishing a hardcover version if we hit $6000!

 
----
 
Story of My Book
Heir of Blood and Secrets is a dystopian young adult novel about a girl who chooses to be a hero.Scylla has waited her entire life for an opportunity to prove herself. When her father is accused of a murder he did not commit, she eagerly embarks on a quest to clear his name. As she races to find the real killer before it’s too late, she begins to unearth the secrets hidden under the gilded exterior of her city, forcing her to question all that she’s ever known.My name is Linda Xia and I am the author of Heir of Blood and Secrets. I first started writing this book when I was 14, because I wanted to tell a story about an ordinary girl who chooses to do extraordinary things. I found - and still find - the trope of the Chosen One frustrating, because there aren’t a lot of ancient prophecies in real life and I believe we can all choose to be heroes. We don’t need to wait to be chosen.My hope is that, in reading this book, you will begin to see that the world is so much more complex than we often realize and that it isn’t always clear what the right thing to do is. At its core, this is a book about coming of age in a world that is beautiful, brutal, and often inexplicable.
 

The Book - Heir of Blood and Secrets
In this book, the protagonist, Scylla, fights to exonerate her father, a politician who’s been accused of a murder she’s convinced he did not commit. Scylla’s been born into privilege. But the world she grows up in is divided, not only be class, but by gender and race, and we see how these factors shape her journey and those of the people she interacts with as she struggles to come to terms with who her father really is.It’s set in the fictional city of Devovea, a place where the wealthy elite are held accountable to none and rampant corruption rages beneath the glossy exterior of the Castle. As Scylla is confronted with the truth about her birthright, she finds herself torn between returning to the life she’s always known and becoming the real hero she’s always wanted to be.You will love this book if you enjoy dystopian mysteries, driven, complex characters, and often wonder what our society could be. Heir of Blood and Secrets challenges you to consider how far you are willing to go, what you are willing to sacrifice, to do what needs to be done to forge a better world.Ultimately, I hope that Heir of Blood and Secrets inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, and leads readers to grapple with such questions as:

Why do I see the world the way that I do?
How does my perception of the world shape what I believe in and what I’m willing to fight for?
How can I choose to be a hero and give voice to those who should be heard but aren’t?

I look forward to exploring these questions and more with you. Looking at the parts of ourselves we may not be proud of is difficult and exhausting, but I believe doing so will change us all for the better.
 
What I Need & What You Get
These pre-order tiers are set up to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August 2021
The cover design of my book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
The layout design for the interior of my book, for both physical and e-book editions
The copy editing for my book, to polish grammar and spelling prior to publication
The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this summer

 
When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and e-book. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. 
I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish (and it will be personal)
Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book
You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title
You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process
And much more!

The first 30 backers will also receive a limited edition Heir of Blood and Secrets laptop sticker [now sold out!].
 

About the Author
Linda Xia is proud to be a member of the class of 2022 at Minerva Schools at KGI. She’s lived in San Francisco, Seoul, Hyderabad, and Berlin thus far and hopes to be on rotation in London come September.She’s wanted to tell Scylla’s story for most of her life and is excited to finally see it published. She hopes that it will inspire young girls to do cool, heroic things whenever they want to, because she believes that life is too short to spend waiting for someone else to choose you.She’s the proud owner of over 200 books, all of which have been rescued from various book sales. Her work has been published in various anthologies and she loves (read: is obsessed with) writing, a condition that often interferes with her obligations as a university student. She currently resides in Canada with her cacti, Christi and Spike, and her family. But she spends more time talking with her cacti.If you want to learn more about her cacti or just chat about life, you can connect with Linda by emailing lxia@minerva.kgi.edu or reaching out to @lindaxia_author on Instagram.
 
International Preorders
The economics of international shipping are a little complicated so please send me a private message for international preorders!
 

Risks & Challenges
The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.I will be working closely with my publisher to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. I will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #bloodandsecrets and tag me so I can help amplify your efforts.
You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!
Thanks again,Linda Xia

story:
Strive is a nonfiction book/memoir about the reflections and life lessons that I learned while being a remote student during the COVID-19 pandemic. 

I'm Colleen, full time college student and the author of Strive. I was inspired to write Strive while taking my classes remotely. The pandemic cost students around the world countless opportunities and experiences: study abroads were cut short, proms were cancelled and graduations were reduced to pictures on a screen. 

However, I felt that the silver lining of these circumstances was that students had the chance to be still. The pandemic gave us an unexpected break from reality that allowed for deep reflection and clarity of thought. My hope is that future generations of students, who will not have lived through a global pandemic, will be able to gain the insights regardlessly.

In this book, you'll hear stories such as...

  • A capable consultant's journey of finding balance and fulfillment at work
  • A recent grad's adventures that led him to discover his love for Machine Learning
  • A college student's decision to take a gap semester after reevaluating his past motivations

From current students to those already ahead in life, this book will speak to anyone who is at a decisive point in their lives. 

The Book in Sections

Part 1 How we got here: This section discusses the narrow definition of success and how it has shaped our decision making to pursue a 

Part 2 External Exploration: This section addresses the importance of new exposure and prioritizing.

Part 3 Internal Discovery: This section shares how the exploration can be turned into meaningful takeaways. 

    What We Need & What You Get

    This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

    • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2021.
    • The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
    • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
    • The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
    • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this winter.
    I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
    • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish and a handwritten thank-you note.
    • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).
    • You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
    • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
    • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
    • And much more!

    Campaign Goals

    Tier 1: Hit $5,500 and the ebook/softcover editions get published (this is the minimum needed)
    Tier 2: Hit $6,500 and the book will get a hardcover edition.
    Tier 3: Hit $8,500 and we’ll get an audiobook edition.

    About the Author

    Colleen is an author and undergraduate student at McGill University, where she studies computer science and social entrepreneurship. 

    She chose to write Strive to make the best out of the COVID-19 situation and use her reflections to encourage and inspire those who would soon find themselves making their decisions at their own starting lines. 

    When she's not worrying about her book, she can be found making a smoothie, listening to an audiobook or worrying about something else. 

    For more information, you can connect through email at colleenchangauthor@gmail.com or on LinkedIn (https://www.linkedin.com/in/colleen-chang/).

    International Preorders

    For international preorders, please do the following:

    Identify the perk that interests you, e.g. 1 or 2 paperbacks

    Select the pink "Back it" button to "Make a contribution" for the same amount (this choice bypasses the shipping address page)

    Use this form (https://forms.gle/Lcf2khw3q9tPQXMj8) to share your mailing address, so I can calculate the international shipping costs and invoice you for that amount via PayPal/Venmo

    Risks & Challenges

    The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

    The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies are expected to ship.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Not everyone can support, but that doesn't mean you can't get something out of it!
    I will reward the top 3 people who refer the most backers at the end of the campaign (30 days). Here's how:

    At the top of the campaign page, you will see the "share" buttons. Click on the "chain" icon to get a custom link just for you. (Note: don't use the URL in the browser window as it won't work to track referrals and you won't get credit)

    Copy that link and paste it on your social media, email it to a friend, or text a fellow book lover.

    When someone clicks on that link and backs the book, you get 1 entry!

    Please use #strivebycolleen and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts!
    Tag:
    Instragram - @colleenchang_author / @newdegreepress

    Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

    - Colleen

story:
Thank you for visiting the Voices from War fundraising campaign site! By reaching our goal of $16,000, we will be able to compensate our instructors from the Fall 2014 writing workshop for veterans and Winter-Spring 2015 seasons and to print and distribute our first literary journal, Voices from War, VOLUME 1, with student work from our first two seasons (2013-2014). Additionally, we want not only to maintain and sustain our current programming; in 2015 we hope to build capacity for more. Voices from War (VFW) believes strongly in its mission to offer a respectful, craft-focused community for veterans to write—and working to bring these voices to a wider audience.

Powerful stories offer us opportunities for insight and broader understanding. They demand it. They offer us ways to step out of our own experience—our own skin—to better comprehend ourselves and imagine ourselves into someone else's life and experiences. It is sometimes hard, and it is necessary.

We care deeply about these stories—veteran stories—that they be told, however each individual chooses, and created with the resources and support from an informed and engaged community of instructors, industry professionals and peers. So, we have continued to grow our workshops and related outreach events, even without secure funding. Why? Because we knew we could build on the success of VFW's first year, working with an engaged and varied group of veterans. We hope you feel the same way!

PROGRAMMING & FUNDING

With a budget of $7000 in 2013-2014, VFW was able to:

·  Design two 10-week seasons of NYC workshops and a 4-session Summer mini-season in our first year (2013-2014).

·  Create and moderate an evening of “Reading, Writing, & Talking War” for VAP’s 2013 Arts & Service Celebration with Veteran Artist Program (VAP), welcoming an audience of 80-100 people. We reprised this event on November 9, 2014, again collaborating with VAP, for “Journeys in Stories: From the Front to the Home Front in Words”—with more than 200 attendees!

·  Broaden our network and our commitment to EMPOWER veterans to craft their stories and to PROPEL their stories into public sight. Through this process, we engage with literary arts and we bring voices from war—veteran voices—to a wider audience, fostering dialogue between veterans and civilians.

With your help, Voices from War hopes to:

·  Publish our first collection of veteran writing, Voices from War, VOLUME 1. Plus, we are partnering with the Headstrong Project’s “Words of War” e-book to co-publish work from four Voices from War participants.

·  Perform readings of select veteran writing for a public audience.

·  Continue our popular Voices from War writing workshops in NYC at the 14th Street Y. And work with a NY-area Veterans Affairs in an effort to establish an auxiliary Voices from War program.

·  Continue to help Voices from War participants to publish their work in other forums—through support, educational programming, personalized advice and mentoring. (In recent months, two participants published their first pieces of fiction and a third was accepted for an esteemed writers' residency at Yaddo!)

·  Continue to bring professional writers and other publishing professionals as mentors to the Voices from War workshops.*

*GUESTS have included: Roxana Robinson (Sparta), Maurice Decaul (poet, playwright, librettist, Holding It Down: The Veterans’ Dreams Project), Cathy Linh Che (poet, literary arts professional, author of Split),  Phil Klay (winner of the 2014 National Book Award for Fiction, author of short story collection, Redeployment), Jofie Ferrari-Adler (editor of Karl Marlantes’ Vietnam war novel, Matterhorn, Grove/Atlantic; currently Senior Editor at Simon & Schuster), Rob Spillman (co-founder and Editor of Tin House and Tin House Books).

HOW YOU CAN HELP

Support comes in many forms. Certainly, broadening financial support is critical to Voices from War’s growth and survival. Equally important is the support and awareness of an ever-broadening community of engaged veterans and civilians.

Your support is significant. Whether you are able to give at the level of a Sponsor or Benefactor, or can choose to support with a contribution of $1, $5, $10, or somewhere in between, you are making a difference. Even through the simple act of visiting us here, reading about our program and sharing our stories with others, you are showing the Voices from War community that our stories matter, to us as individuals and to our culture.

We are extremely grateful for the institutional support offered by the 14th Street Y in Manhattan, home to our workshops each week, and for the grant support from Poets & Writers, Inc. (with public funds from the New York State Council on the Arts). These supporters have helped us in forging alliances and they have offered illustrations of tangible support from diverse organizations believing in our mission, to empower veterans to craft their stories, and bring those stories to a wider audience.

From everyone at the Voices From War community, THANK YOU!
