YOU!

story:
Short Summary

Hello everyone! As you may or may not know, my name is Sylvia Parker (I also write under the pseudonym Diamond Foxx) and I make a living self-publishing erotic short stories to Amazon. You can see everything I've written by clicking this link.

I love to write, and often times can sit down and crank out five thousand words a day like it was nothing! 

Like most people who spent the better part of their youth getting a degree from a 4 year university, I realized that I didn't want to confine myself to the trappings of a 9-5. After a bit of research into self publishing with Amazon, I put up my first stories, made a few sales, and was instantly hooked.

So here's the deal: with this campaign, I'd like create something with a bit more meat than just a short story or anthology. I want to get my feet wet publishing a novella, ~40,000 words or so. And what better way to do it than with crowdfunding?

I love writing short stories (especially the sexy parts), but sometimes I also feel the desire to develop the story and characters a bit more. With short erotica, that can be quite difficult to do in 5000-10000 words without feeling rushed. 

My novel is much more ambitious, and that's why I need your help. I'm offering you guys the chance to help me create my story - anything from the characters, plot lines, even just a scene or two that you'd like to see inserted.

Want to name a character? Want to see a crazy sex scene between a minotaur, a giant octopus and a sex-crazed werewolf? Want to rename some of the characters as yourself or someone you fantasize about? 

Its all possible, and if it goes well, there will be many more to come!

What We Need & What You Get

I've set the budget for this at a measly $500 bucks. In terms of the technical nitty gritty, that money will go towards the following things:

  • Formatting for CreateSpace
  • Printing and shipping actual copies of the physical books
  • Cover design
  • Professional editing and proofreading
  • Additional marketing of the finished product
In exchange, here are some of the awesome perks that will be available to anyone who decides to back this project!
  • Rename a character after yourself
  • Direct the story arc of that character towards a sexy encounter (or something else!)
  • Work directly with me to design the character to your specifications
  • Help me choose the cover design
  • Have your name listed on the inside of the book as a part of my Elite Design Team
  • Receive a complimentary signed copy of the novella with your name on it
  •  Digital copies of various selections of the rest of my digital catalog (over 90 titles!)
  • And much more!

The Impact

I love to write, and honestly even if this project isn't an amazing success, I will continue to do so. 

But, on the other hand, if it DOES succeed, then there will be many more to come! My dream is to make it big in the world of self-publishing, and short erotica will only take you so far. If you want to get noticed, then you need to create longer works. As we all know, bigger is better ;)

This is the first step on that journey. But I can't do it alone - I need you guys to help me. 

With over 90 titles at the time of this writing, to say I'm prolific would be an understatement. The book will get finished, make no mistake about it. You can see evidence of my work ethic my visiting my Amazon author pages here and here.

Help me get to the top of the best seller lists. Who knows, it may be a character named after you that people fall in love with, that they buy book after book because they just can't wait to see what happens next.

Risks & Challenges

To be honest, none really. This is something that I've been doing for a while, so I have a system that works. I have ideas for the novel, and you have the option of working with me to develop the creative side of the project. 

As far as the logistics are concerned, formatting and printing the books seems like it would be the most difficult part. But at the end of the day, all I need to do is make sure the books look nice and then send them out to those of you who have ordered physical copies.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to help, there are many things you can do. Obviously, you can support this campaign with a donation.

But if you don't want to do that, then simply visiting my author page and reading some of my books would be great. I always have free promotions going on for my digital copies of the short stories. In fact, if you're reading this, then that's probably how you discovered my work.

You can also choose to leave an honest review on the book that you read - that would be fantastic, as reviews will heavily influence any potential future purchases and downloads.

That's about it! Thank you for reading till the end and let's make this happen!
story_txt:
Short Summary Hello everyone! As you may or may not know, my name is Sylvia Parker (I also write under the pseudonym Diamond Foxx) and I make a living self-publishing erotic short stories to Amazon. You can see everything I've written by clicking this link.
I love to write, and often times can sit down and crank out five thousand words a day like it was nothing! 
Like most people who spent the better part of their youth getting a degree from a 4 year university, I realized that I didn't want to confine myself to the trappings of a 9-5. After a bit of research into self publishing with Amazon, I put up my first stories, made a few sales, and was instantly hooked.
So here's the deal: with this campaign, I'd like create something with a bit more meat than just a short story or anthology. I want to get my feet wet publishing a novella, ~40,000 words or so. And what better way to do it than with crowdfunding?
I love writing short stories (especially the sexy parts), but sometimes I also feel the desire to develop the story and characters a bit more. With short erotica, that can be quite difficult to do in 5000-10000 words without feeling rushed. 
My novel is much more ambitious, and that's why I need your help. I'm offering you guys the chance to help me create my story - anything from the characters, plot lines, even just a scene or two that you'd like to see inserted.
Want to name a character? Want to see a crazy sex scene between a minotaur, a giant octopus and a sex-crazed werewolf? Want to rename some of the characters as yourself or someone you fantasize about? 
Its all possible, and if it goes well, there will be many more to come!   What We Need & What You Get I've set the budget for this at a measly $500 bucks. In terms of the technical nitty gritty, that money will go towards the following things:



Formatting for CreateSpace


Printing and shipping actual copies of the physical books


Cover design

Professional editing and proofreading
Additional marketing of the finished product

In exchange, here are some of the awesome perks that will be available to anyone who decides to back this project!


Rename a character after yourself


Direct the story arc of that character towards a sexy encounter (or something else!)


Work directly with me to design the character to your specifications


Help me choose the cover design


Have your name listed on the inside of the book as a part of my Elite Design Team


Receive a complimentary signed copy of the novella with your name on it


 Digital copies of various selections of the rest of my digital catalog (over 90 titles!)

And much more!
   The Impact I love to write, and honestly even if this project isn't an amazing success, I will continue to do so. 
But, on the other hand, if it DOES succeed, then there will be many more to come! My dream is to make it big in the world of self-publishing, and short erotica will only take you so far. If you want to get noticed, then you need to create longer works. As we all know, bigger is better ;)
This is the first step on that journey. But I can't do it alone - I need you guys to help me. 
With over 90 titles at the time of this writing, to say I'm prolific would be an understatement. The book will get finished, make no mistake about it. You can see evidence of my work ethic my visiting my Amazon author pages here and here.
Help me get to the top of the best seller lists. Who knows, it may be a character named after you that people fall in love with, that they buy book after book because they just can't wait to see what happens next.   Risks & Challenges To be honest, none really. This is something that I've been doing for a while, so I have a system that works. I have ideas for the novel, and you have the option of working with me to develop the creative side of the project. 
As far as the logistics are concerned, formatting and printing the books seems like it would be the most difficult part. But at the end of the day, all I need to do is make sure the books look nice and then send them out to those of you who have ordered physical copies.
    Other Ways You Can Help If you want to help, there are many things you can do. Obviously, you can support this campaign with a donation.
But if you don't want to do that, then simply visiting my author page and reading some of my books would be great. I always have free promotions going on for my digital copies of the short stories. In fact, if you're reading this, then that's probably how you discovered my work.
You can also choose to leave an honest review on the book that you read - that would be fantastic, as reviews will heavily influence any potential future purchases and downloads.
That's about it! Thank you for reading till the end and let's make this happen!

story:
Short Summary

“Fail and fail better.” 

“Fail forward”

“My success has been built one failure at a time”

We all hear the musings about failure and we agree that it’s sage advice. After all, mistakes are just part of our journey. But there hasn’t really been a roadmap that teaches people how to make the most of their bumps and bruises along the way. Until now!!

As an international speaker, writer, teacher and certified life coach I’ve accumulated and developed some the most practical tools around and helped people across the globe meet their personal and professional goals. 

I’ve taken the most effective and easiest to use methods I know and combined them into the life-transforming FAIL to Win (For All Is Love) program.  

I've helped CEOs, Foreign Exchange traders, Trauma/Illness survivors and many more ditch their paralyzing, default beliefs and build happy, fruitful lives and businesses based on their authenticity and intrinsic personal values. 

                 This is more than motivation - this is practical application!

FAIL to Win is chock full of easy to learn, easy to execute tools and techniques that are specifically designed to slide right into your everyday life. Effecting real and lasting change in our lives takes time and practice and we’re more likely to use do what it takes when it is easy to add. 

That’s why FAIL to Win is so transformative. It takes all of those things we know we “should” be doing and makes them doable. The idea is to integrate small shifts in order to create lasting results. 

What I Need & What You Get

The bulk of the amount being raised will go to editing. I’ve already chosen the best contextual editor around to help me make the book cohesive and easy, easy, easy to use and implement. I’ve got a second editor that will do the nuts and bolts pieces - I’d love to avoid the mental equivalent of the fingernails on the chalkboard by keeping my grammar and punctuation sound.  
Current Editing Estimate: $2500 - 3000

Additionally there is:

Graphic and Interior design ~$1500

I’ve budgeted for 250 books in the first round of printing ~$1000

Ebook conversion is a flat fee =$250

Estimated shipping ~$900

Printing 100 spiral bound workbooks ~$900

                          I want these tools in as many hands as possible!!

These perks are fun AND help you integrate the material for real and lasting change.

Contribution at any level includes 60 days FREE membership to my Lovely Members program. That includes, in part, free coaching, archived recordings, access to wonderful people building great things in their lives while you begin conditioning heart and mind to all that is possible just for being an early adopter of the book and program. 

Did you notice there are options that include powerful one on one coaching? 

Inevitably, others interact differently with us when we evolve and improve our lives. Often, they want what we're having. That's why I included levels specifically designed to include family, friends and communities into the process with additional materials meant for sharing. 

There are even options that include FAIL to Win Seminars for up to 50 people for people who are really serious about changing the direction of their organizations or management teams. (Workshops and Seminars need to either be within a 100 mile radius of Highlands Ranch or conducted via some virtual medium like Skype. Unless you're willing to pay travel expenses...then by all means...live and in-person it IS!)

I understand that this whole campaign could be it’s own anecdote for the next edition if I don’t meet my goal. Should that happen, the only thing that will change is the timeline.
I will honor my promise to edit and print this book using my own personal funds as I can accommodate it which means it may take a little longer to pay for the bits and pieces.
The benefits of the costs going straight to publishing and shipping expenses is that with fewer pre-purchases there is less of an investment in the first run and in mailing fees so I’m confident that it won’t be too much of a wait and I’ll stay in touch with you so you won’t be left hanging. 

The Impact

Imagine that person who is absolutely ready commit to finding the peace within that builds the best possible future yet is afraid to make the investment in themselves. Their first tentative step would be a book that they could readily afford and work on privately. 

The FAIL to Win Tele Course is currently priced to be highly accessible to people who are ready to create positive change in their lives. I understand, too, that there are people like I described who are ready for that transformation but to whom the course is still out of reach. 

When you contribute to this campaign you not only get all of the benefits of being an early adopter and all of the perks that come with your contribution you also become instrumental in giving someone a chance at a new, empowered beginning in all of their endeavors. You could be a hero!!

Risks & Challenges

Let’s get real. In every opportunity there is risk. While it is not in my business plan to jump into a ceiling fan and concuss myself into amnesia, my deathly fear of spiders means that scenario is not entirely off of the table. So let’s talk about what happens when…

We’ve already talked about what happens if the campaign is not fully funded

     … some of that risk is mitigated by the fact that publishing and printing expenses decrease as well 

     … making adjustments may push out the timeline a bit but I have great relationships with my team and have adjusted some other business expenditures to be able to set aside a bit of a safety net as well. 

     … this book WILL get published. 

I’m a perpetual learner and take advantage of continuing education opportunities. What happens if I learn new tools or make improvements to the program?

     … the book hasn’t been edited yet so there is always time to add or change material to improve the product before delivery,

     ... and if there's a way to bring you more - I will bring you more.

What if you hate the book?

     … it’s quite simple, I’ll refund your money. Seriously though...hate?? I'd be surprised.

What if it gets lost in the mail?

     … You and I will hold intent that it landed in the hands of the person who needed it most and I will send you another one.  

Other Ways You Can Help

I’m so glad you found FAIL to Win and are giving me the opportunity to be of service to you. 

I want these techniques readily available to anyone who is ready to change their story and their life and one of the biggest benefits of using a campaign like this is that it broadens my audience reach beyond what I could do on my own. 

There are a lot of people you know that may not look for resources through crowd funding but who will benefit from this program. 

If you can think of 1-3 people who would enjoy the benefits of early adoption there are two ways you can share this opportunity:
1) If you’re at the computer you can simply use the Indiegogo share tools. They're at the top with social media options and quick embed and link options for emails. 
2) if you’re out and about you can tell people to search "fail to win" on the search bar here at Indiegogo. 

Credit Where Credit is Due

I want to immediately give credit to an amazing group of people who have helped me put together the video and brand for this campaign. If you like what you see I will connect you to my talented crew, Julie Miller - Digital Media Specialist and Videographer, Kayleen Burke - Branding Experience Designer,  Photographer/Videographer, Andrew Peevler - Sound Technician and Media Expert, Justicia Vargas - Artist and Home Design.

story:
Short Summary

We are raising funds to publish a special anthology of disability-themed speculative fiction, Accessing the Future, co-edited by Kathryn Allan and Djibril al-Ayad, to be published by Futurefire.net Publishing.

Futurefire.net Publishing is the publisher of both The Future Fire magazine of social-political speculative fiction, and of two previous anthologies, Outlaw Bodies (2012, co-edited by Lori Selke) and We See a Different Frontier (2013, co-edited by Fabio Fernandes). Djibril al-Ayad, a historian and futurist, co-edited both volumes and has edited TFF since 2005.

Kathryn Allan is an independent scholar of feminist SF, cyberpunk, and disability studies, and is the inaugural Le Guin Feminist Science Fiction Fellow (2013-14). She is editor of Disability in Science Fiction: Representations of Technology as Cure (2013, Palgrave MacMillan), an Associate Editor and Reader of The Future Fire, and her writing appears in both academic and popular venues. She tweets and blogs as Bleeding Chrome.

This anthology will call for and publish speculative fiction stories that interrogate issues of disability—along with the intersecting nodes of race, nationality, gender, sexuality, and class—in both the imagined physical and virtual spaces of the future. We want people of all abilities to see themselves, as they are now and as they want to be, in our collective human future. The call for stories will open immediately after this fundraising campaign ends.

What We Need & What You Get

Our minimum target is to raise $4000 so that we can publish a semi-pro anthology with approximately 10-12 stories paid at a rate of $0.03/word. If we raise this much funding, we’ll go ahead with the project in this relatively modest form.

But we want to do more!

Help us reach our first stretch goal of $7000 and we will raise the pay rate to the level of $0.06/word and publish and market a full, professional anthology. This money would cover the cost of paying around $300 for each of 12 stories, plus cover art, publicity and advertising, review copies, rewards for supporters, and all the other bits and bobs that come with publishing an all-original collection of exciting speculative fiction.

And we don’t need to stop there. Once we reach the $7000 target, more stretch goals will be announced, including a larger anthology, higher pay rates, and internal artwork.

We’re very excited about the rewards and perks on offer to our contributors: as well as e-book or paperback copies of the anthology itself (and other Futurefire.net Publishing volumes, if you like), we will be producing a limited edition hardcover version of the anthology in 50 copies only, not available except to supporters of this campaign! *New!* You can now also claim an exclusive poster print of the cover art (not shown, as not finished yet; recent cover art above) by our fantastic artist Robin E. Kaplan. You'll have to trust that this art will be just beautiful, but if you don't believe it, check out her portfolio and Etsy store!

If you’re a writer, you can also bid for a story critique from one of the TFF editors (up to 10,000 words; only six available) or a novella critique from professional copyeditor and script doctor Maureen Kincaid Speller (up to 40,000 words, only three available). We’re offering a limited number of copies of an e-book bundle: all three Futurefire.net anthologies, the five volumes of Lyda Morehouse’s multiple award-winning AngeLINK series, generously donated by Wizard's Tower Press, *plus* a revised and otherwise-unavailable short story by Lyda Morehouse set in the AngeLINK universe: “The Case of the Missing Devil Child”. There’s also a very limited, one-of-its-kind print bundle, the three FFN anthologies, plus first editions of the first three volumes of Lynda Williams’s Okal Rel Saga, signed and containing unique memorabilia (e.g., manuscript pages). At the higher levels, you have the opportunity to have characters in forthcoming works named after you (or a person of your choice) by amazing authors such as Lyda Morehouse (AngeLINK series), Morgan J. Locke (Up Against It) (taken), Steve Gould (Jumper) (taken), Tiptree Award-winner Nisi Shawl (taken) and multiple award-winning Nicola Griffith (Ammonite; Hild) (taken).

We've already reached the first target of $4000, and are well on the way to our first stretch goal of $7000 for a full-size, professional rate paying anthology. We'll post more stretch goals when we get closer.

The Impact

Inspired by the cyberpunk and feminist science fiction of yesterday and the DIY, open access, and hacktivist culture of today, Accessing the Future will be an anthology that explores the future potentials of technology to augment and challenge the physical environment and the human form—in all of its wonderful and complex diversity.

We are particularly interested in stories that interrogate issues of disability—and the intersecting nodes of race, nationality, gender, sexuality, and class—in both physical and virtual spaces. Disability is a social construct, and all bodies do not fit into or navigate the material environment in the same way(s). Personal and institutional bias against disability marginalizes and makes “deviant” people with certain differences, but it doesn't have to be that way.

We are asking:

  • How will humanity modify the future world?
  • What kinds of new spaces will there be to explore and inhabit? Who will have access to these spaces and in what ways?
  • Given that we all already rely on (technological) tools to make our lives easier, what kinds of assistive and adaptive technologies will we use in the future?
  • How will augmentations (from the prosthetic to the genetic) erase or exacerbate existing differences in ability, class, gender, sexuality, nationality, and race?
  • What does an accessible future look like?

Accessing the Future will be a collection of speculative fiction that places emphasis on the social, political, and material realms of being. We aren’t looking for stories of “cure,” that depict people with disabilities (or with other in/visible differences) as “extra special,” or that generally reproduce today’s dominant reductionist viewpoints of disability as fixed and a problem to be solved. We want stories that place emphasis on intersectional narratives (rejection of, undoing, and speaking against ableist, heteronormative, racist, cissexist, and classist constructions) and that are informed by an understanding of disability issues and politics at individual and institutional levels. We want to hear from writers that think critically about how prosthetic technologies, new virtual and physical environments, and genetic modifications will impact human bodies, our communities, and the planet.

We have both edited collections of academic essays. In addition, Futurefire.net published two previous fiction anthologies, and ran a successful crowdfunding campaign for We See a Different Frontier, and has the experience and network to produce and market a professional anthology.

Risks & Challenges

There are always risks associated with a publishing venture like this: we might not receive as much funding as we need (in which case we’ll produce a more modest anthology, or special themed issue of the magazine); we might not receive as many truly awesome stories as it would take to fill the volume (in which case we’ll reopen the call for submissions and get more creative with reaching out to the writing community); or the volume might not sell many copies (in which case at any rate the bases are covered, the authors are paid, and we may just be a bit less excited and ambitious next time).

We honestly don’t think any of these are high risks, because this is an awesome project and many people are supporting us already, but as editors and publishers we know things don’t always go as well as we hope, and so we have strategies for dealing with these sorts of problems. Even if the worst comes to the worst, we’re confident of being able to deliver the perks for your support, and the anthology will happen come hell or high water.

Other Ways You Can Help

Have a minute to spare? We would be grateful for any support and signal boosting for our fundraising campaign. Please tweet, blog, and share links to our campaign for Accessing the Future. We talk about this campaign at the TFF blog, at Djibril and Kathryn’s Twitter accounts, and Facebook. You can also use the buttons here on Indiegogo to share this fundraiser with your friends and contacts.

At the higher levels, you have the opportunity to have characters in forthcoming works named after you (or a person of your choice) by amazing authors such as Lyda Morehouse (AngeLINK series), Morgan J. Locke (Up Against It) (taken), Steve Gould (Jumper) (taken), Tiptree Award-winner Nisi Shawl (taken) and multiple award-winning Nicola Griffith (Ammonite; Hild) (taken).We've already reached the first target of $4000, and are well on the way to our first stretch goal of $7000 for a full-size, professional rate paying anthology. We'll post more stretch goals when we get closer.The ImpactInspired by the cyberpunk and feminist science fiction of yesterday and the DIY, open access, and hacktivist culture of today, Accessing the Future will be an anthology that explores the future potentials of technology to augment and challenge the physical environment and the human form—in all of its wonderful and complex diversity.We are particularly interested in stories that interrogate issues of disability—and the intersecting nodes of race, nationality, gender, sexuality, and class—in both physical and virtual spaces. Disability is a social construct, and all bodies do not fit into or navigate the material environment in the same way(s). Personal and institutional bias against disability marginalizes and makes “deviant” people with certain differences, but it doesn't have to be that way.We are asking:
How will humanity modify the future world?
What kinds of new spaces will there be to explore and inhabit? Who will have access to these spaces and in what ways?
Given that we all already rely on (technological) tools to make our lives easier, what kinds of assistive and adaptive technologies will we use in the future?
How will augmentations (from the prosthetic to the genetic) erase or exacerbate existing differences in ability, class, gender, sexuality, nationality, and race?
What does an accessible future look like?
Accessing the Future will be a collection of speculative fiction that places emphasis on the social, political, and material realms of being. We aren’t looking for stories of “cure,” that depict people with disabilities (or with other in/visible differences) as “extra special,” or that generally reproduce today’s dominant reductionist viewpoints of disability as fixed and a problem to be solved. We want stories that place emphasis on intersectional narratives (rejection of, undoing, and speaking against ableist, heteronormative, racist, cissexist, and classist constructions) and that are informed by an understanding of disability issues and politics at individual and institutional levels. We want to hear from writers that think critically about how prosthetic technologies, new virtual and physical environments, and genetic modifications will impact human bodies, our communities, and the planet.We have both edited collections of academic essays. In addition, Futurefire.net published two previous fiction anthologies, and ran a successful crowdfunding campaign for We See a Different Frontier, and has the experience and network to produce and market a professional anthology.Risks & ChallengesThere are always risks associated with a publishing venture like this: we might not receive as much funding as we need (in which case we’ll produce a more modest anthology, or special themed issue of the magazine); we might not receive as many truly awesome stories as it would take to fill the volume (in which case we’ll reopen the call for submissions and get more creative with reaching out to the writing community); or the volume might not sell many copies (in which case at any rate the bases are covered, the authors are paid, and we may just be a bit less excited and ambitious next time).We honestly don’t think any of these are high risks, because this is an awesome project and many people are supporting us already, but as editors and publishers we know things don’t always go as well as we hope, and so we have strategies for dealing with these sorts of problems. Even if the worst comes to the worst, we’re confident of being able to deliver the perks for your support, and the anthology will happen come hell or high water.Other Ways You Can HelpHave a minute to spare? We would be grateful for any support and signal boosting for our fundraising campaign. Please tweet, blog, and share links to our campaign for Accessing the Future. We talk about this campaign at the TFF blog, at Djibril and Kathryn’s Twitter accounts, and Facebook. You can also use the buttons here on Indiegogo to share this fundraiser with your friends and contacts.

story:
Are you a spiritual seeker? Are you trying to make sense out of this life? Are you interested in shifting your inner and outer reality towards life and goodness? Me too!

Shalom, Hello, 

I am Pesach Dahvid Stadlin. 

I just finished writing my first book Sustainable Bliss a Paradigm Shift. It is filled with sacred secrets, medicine stories, poems, insights and perspective shifts. 

Some of the chapter titles are: Change Happens In One Moment, Light in the Dark, Closeness, Pilots of the Inter-Outer States, Semipermeable Auric Membrane, Love Pain, Surrender, Love Warrior, Nothing Ever Just Dies, You Should, Say What You Mean, The Medicine is in the Moment, Missin’ the Train, Un-hog-tying Your Dreams, Why We Do Anything, Katusha’s and Free Time, and a Hug Around Jerusalem.

The book is filled with life hacks, adventure stories, and practical wisdoms from around the world. I like to call it a get rich quick book (as our sages teach that, who is rich? Is s/he who is happy with what s/he has). 

A lot goes into producing, publishing and promoting a book. Cover artist, interior designers, copy editors, web designers, printers, promotional videos like this and more!

Please feel free...and feel free to help me make this book a reality. You can pre-order your 1st run limited edition copy of the book here. 

If you wish to help with production costs you will get the book along with other perks like music and artwork.

I also just launched a new web-page which has lots more info on the book, pictures and videos, and ways you can bring me to your community to teach and song lead and more.

I also offer online spiritual life coaching.

Please share and post this video with your world.

Thank you!

Big Blessings!

Pesach Dahvid Stadlin

story:
For Orders - Please visit 

Sigalitlandau.com

 

 

THE BOOK

Landau invites us to embark on a journey facilitated by the unique feature of one natural resource, salt. Drawing inspiration from the topographical, historical, biblical, cultural, political and environmental realms of the Dead Sea, she turns to the natural process of salt crystallization, exclusive to the Dead Sea, for her unique artistic techne. Baptizing profane objects in its waters, Landau relies on the Dead Sea to breathe life into inanimate objects, which emerge from their submersion as if belonging to a different time system, a different logic, or another planet yet their transformation unveils the divine and the eternal in nature.

Marking Landau's 15-year oeuvre and fascination with the Dead Sea, ‘Sigalit Landau: SALT YEARS’ sheds new light on the fundamental leitmotiv that underlies her multifaceted artistic creation. Offering insights to the artist's visions, this volume explores Landau's career reflecting the breadth of her oeuvre, including exclusive works of art created specifically for this book, behind the scenes photos, personal working notes and perceptive essays. It is an invitation to take part in the transformative power of art and Landau's transformation of the Dead Sea into a laboratory and medium for new experiments, ideas and heart/ground breaking understandings, revealing the death bearing to life sustaining alchemy of salt. 

 

 

Book Details

‘Sigalit Landau: SALT YEARS’ will be produced in 19 × 26 cm (7½ × 10¼ in.) format, with 400 pages, Weight: 1.3 kg (2.65 lb). Texts in English and mostly large images printed in full color with spot varnish on 150 gr. LuxoArt Samt paper. Six “cahiers” will be spread throughout the book printed on 150 gr. Heaven 42 paper.

The standard edition will be thread-sewn with Otabind cover, glossy lamination and long flaps, case bound with a photographic cover and satin Mylar lamination.

*A Hebrew supplement can be purchased in addition to the book.

 

Personal Note

We are on a journey to and from, in and out, under and over – and hopefully even across a unique lake: the Dead Sea. A place In which for the last years we have been creating art in collaboration with nature and  time. It is a site with strange and different rules. An ex-territory.

The works I make in the Dead Sea relate to history, found everyday objects and the body. Considering the scope of the experiences and achievements – A book is the best way to collect and to share this project. This book aims to “crystallize” a part of my story with new texts and images, archival and recent documentation.

Now, as we are approaching the final design stage, the costly step of printing the book is our next challenge. By purchasing the publication you are enabling its production, and becoming our salt partners!

 

‘Salt Crystal Bridal Gown Ⅲ & Ⅵ’, 2014

 

About Sigalit Landau

Born in Jerusalem in 1969, Sigalit Landau is an interdisciplinary artist who works with installation, video, photography and sculpture. One could say Landau's varied œuvre is auto-bio-topo-graphical in as much as it deals with writing (graph), of life (bio), in a locale (topos), and writing of a locale in life. While rooted in the realm of the reality, her work carries a larger weight, exploring the transformations of the cold, hard facts of the world into beautiful, often formidable, yet tender work. 

Projects 87: Sigalit Landau, MoMA, 2008, installation view: ‘Barbed Hula’ 

 

EDITORIAL

Book Design: Studio Michael Gordon.

For the last 30 years, Michael Gordon is a leading figure in the field of fine art and architecture book design. “The interpretative process of conversion from one medium to another – from what is no more than a collection of raw texts and images to what is a new whole, a book – is inspired by grace” [Mordechai Omer, foreword to Michael Gordon: Imprints (Tel Aviv Museum of Art, 2003)].

Book Editor: David Goss (PhD), artist, researcher and lecturer of contemporary design history and theory; painting and drawing; African art and design.

Writers:

Rona Cohen, (PhD) in philosophy from Tel Aviv University. She is an art scholar and researcher in aesthetics and continental philosophy. 

Dalia Manor (PhD), art historian and curator; Director and Chief Curator, The Negev Museum of Art (Dec. 2010), and Museum of Islamic and Near Eastern Cultures (2013), Be'er Sheva, Israel.

Amitai Mendelsohn (PhD). Senior Curator and Head of the Department of Israeli Art, The Israel Museum, Jerusalem.

Eli Raz (M.A), geologist, biologist, researcher and environmental consultant at the Dead Sea & Arava Science center specializing in environmental changes of the Dead Sea region. He is a member of kibbutz Ein-Gedi.

Tal Sterngast is a writer and artist working in Berlin.

Photographers: Yotam From, Shaxaf Haber, Igal Pardo, Eyal Segal.

Translations from Hebrew : Einat Adi, Richard Flantz, Ami Asher.

Text editors: Daphna Raz, Hannah Braun.

 

A crystallized salt lamps in the Dead Sea, summer 2016

 

Sigalit Landau graduated from the Bezalel Academy of Art and Design in Jerusalem in 1994. After several years in Europe and in the United-States, she returned to Tel Aviv, and currently lives and works in Israel. Throughout her career, Landau has received significant awards including the America-Israel Cultural Foundation Scholarship (1994), the Ingeborg Bachman Scholarship, established by Anselm Kiefer (1998); Artistin- residence at the Hoffmann Collection, Berlin (1999); the ArtAngel/Times commission, London (2000); IASPIS Artist-in-residence, Stockholm (2003); the Nathan Gottesdiener Foundation Israeli Art Award, Tel Aviv Museum of Art (2004); the Beatrice S. Kolliner Award for a Young Israeli Artist, The Israel Museum, Jerusalem (2004); and the Sandel Family Foundation for Sculpture Award, Tel Aviv Museum of Art (2007), The Sandberg Prize for Israeli Art, The Israel Museum, Jerusalem (2016), French Republic Chevalier decoration of the Ordre des Arts et des Lettres (2017), Honorary Doctorate degree from the Ben Gurion University of the Negev (2017).

 

Landau's work can be found in many major collections, including The Brooklyn Museum, MACBA, MoMA and Centre Pompidou and has exhibited in museums and leading venues including: MOMA, New York; The Brooklyn Museum of Art; MAGASIN III, Stockholm; Yokohama Triennale, Japan; KW Institute for Contemporary Art, Berlin; The Israeli Pavilion, The Venice Art Biennale (1997 & 2011); Documenta X, Kassel; and the MACBA (Museu d'Art Contemporani de Barcelona), and many more.  

 

‘Post Card Display’, 2017, installation view

 

REWARDS

 

Postcard set No.1

Working boots which were suspended in the Dead Sea until they were covered with salt crystals - we then took to Poland and placed on the surface of a frozen lake ...

 

‘Salted Lake’, 2011

Six postcards (21 × 12 cm / 8¼ × 4⅝ in.), Offset print with varnish on heavy, high quality paper.

 

Postcard set No.2 

“Formally, Landau’s DeadSee recalls Robert Smithson’s massive Spiral Jetty (1970), constructed in Utah’s Great Salt Lake. Unlike Smithson’s monumental earthwork, however, the focus of Landau’s piece is her own naked body; its vulnerability accentuated by the wounded flesh of the floating watermelons. The Dead Sea, she says is ‘so extreme, it’s like a text. Something that is so lifeless and so physical’.” 

Aaron Rozen from his book Art & Religion in the 21st Century (Thames & Hudson, 2015).

‘DeadSee’, 2005

Twelve postcards (21 × 12 cm / 8.¼ × 4⅝ in.), Offset print with varnish on heavy, high quality paper. 

 

Special editions


Dégagé

A crystallized ballet Tutu dress is being raised from the sea and is revealed in the early morning sun, reflecting in the water.

Dégagé, 2017

Silk Screen prints on paper (75 × 75 cm / 29½ × 29½ in.)

Edition of 36 [4 AP] signed and numbered

 

‘Salt Wedding’ Box of Etchings

A series of 13 etchings made in 2016 at The Gottesman Intaglio Press Studio.

‘Salt Wedding’, 2016

13 etchings (30.5 × 41 × 2.7cm / 12 × 16 × 1 in.), signed and numbered, edition of 45

 

Untitled

Volcano or torso? (perception games). An edition which was made in collaboration with "STUDIO" magazine. These were tests [negative/positive], signed, unnumbered.

‘Untitled’, 1997 

Silk Screen prints on paper (23 × 59 cm / 9 × 23 in.)

 

Salt Crystal Bridal Gown

Since its creation in 2014, this series of eight photographs taken under the water of the Dead Sea, showing the transformation of a black gown into a white wedding gown made of salt, intrigued and mesmerized millions of viewers throughout the world.

A special B&W silk screen collector’s edition of ‘Salt Crystal Bridal Gown’ series is being printed and offered to our supporters.

‘Salt Crystal Bridal Gown VII’, 2014-2017

A series of eight silk screen prints (98 × 68 cm / 38⅝ × 26⅞ in.)

Edition of 17 [+ 1 AP] signed and numbered series.

 

These special editions were made in collabouration, with the generous support of our friends and partners at Harel Printers and publishers

Book project schedule: 

2016 - 2017: Photography, archive work, writing, editing, and translating. Remaking of missing works and preparation of new installations & documentation.

- Dec. 2017 - May. 2019- Book's design, book printing.

- Jun. 2019 - Aug. 2019 - book's binding and delivery.

- All editions and rewards will ship to you with the books.

 

THANK YOU

The thought of reaching our goal and completing this project successfully is extremely exciting to us. Yotam and I are waiting eagerly to send you your books, post cards and prints.

 

We want to thank you for your attention and support

and we hope you join us and share this

with your friends!

 

 

Q&As

 

Q. What is the situation of the Dead Sea today?


A. Not only is the sea level dropping faster and faster, consequently sink holes are opening in the vicinity of the sea, rendering the "real shores" of the Dead Sea almost inaccessible - damaging but also beautiful: scientists are trying to at least predict and minimize the immediate danger and results of these sudden deep gaps and holes in landscape — like living on a volcano, we vaguely remember the lake when it was full, and we witnessed the rapid evaporation and the destruction of the shores in the northern part of the sea along the years. Dr. Eli Raz who is the leading expert geologist researching the causes for the current situation has written an updated report (not in academic jargon) for our book, in which he explains the circumstances and history of this disappearance and man-made catastrophe.

Here is a film made with Dr. Raz explaining the phenomena of the sink holes and the situation at large :

 

 

"Today, the effect of natural causes on the Dead Sea level is negligible, with the main changes caused by human interference. In Israel and the riparian entities, this interference increased with time: the Degania Dam across the Jordan River at the southern exit of the Sea of Galilee was heightened, other diversions and damming projects in the lake’s drainage basin were added, and pumping from the Dead Sea itself to industrial evaporation pools for the production of minerals, increased with the expansion of the pool areas, that now cover the entire southern basin, on both sides of the border."

(Dr. Eli Raz, 'The life Story of the Dead Sea', from 'Sigalit Landau: SALT YEARS', 2018)

 

Q. Why an independent book?


A. Independency means that the process is 100% in tune to what the book needs to convey without other considerations and limitations. A publication is a good way to bring together this journey linking major exhibitions, achievements, experiments, and projects. This book is not linked to one specific exhibition. We approached our colleagues, curators and writers, to relate and to elaborate on subjects and different aspects of this corpus of work. A book can collect together images and memories, bringing back experiences. It enables one to discover the impact of fifteen years of projects in a layered way - the way we envisioned this publication together with our editor David Goss and designer Michael Gordon.
While collecting and going through the archives - we realized that some early works and installations were not documented well enough to be included in the book and were not available (some were thrown away in the deinstallation of exhibitions). We decided to redo the works which were missing. The last two years were devoted to making, reconstructing, and creating some new and some old salt sculptures. These salt works we then composed and installed in our studio near the Dead Sea.

 

Q. What is the Dead Sea for you?

 

A. I know the sea and this area since I can remember myself. As a child I used to see it from the window of my home in Jerusalem. The years of working with the heavy liquid solution of the Dead Sea are connected not only to my personal and physical memories, but also to long gone memories of landscapes covered with snow and to a process of mourning; seeking to heal and to repair something through this dialogue with nature. Frozen, yet concieved by the desset sun and firy-waters, the sculptures are for me like personal archeological testimonies crystallized and immortalized. 

 

www.sigalitlandau.com

 

Press Materials:

For high-res images, sample spreads, and a prospectus visit: https://goo.gl/TQA3NM

It enables one to discover the impact of fifteen years of projects in a layered way - the way we envisioned this publication together with our editor David Goss and designer Michael Gordon.While collecting and going through the archives - we realized that some early works and installations were not documented well enough to be included in the book and were not available (some were thrown away in the deinstallation of exhibitions). We decided to redo the works which were missing. The last two years were devoted to making, reconstructing, and creating some new and some old salt sculptures. These salt works we then composed and installed in our studio near the Dead Sea. Q. What is the Dead Sea for you? A. I know the sea and this area since I can remember myself. As a child I used to see it from the window of my home in Jerusalem. The years of working with the heavy liquid solution of the Dead Sea are connected not only to my personal and physical memories, but also to long gone memories of landscapes covered with snow and to a process of mourning; seeking to heal and to repair something through this dialogue with nature. Frozen, yet concieved by the desset sun and firy-waters, the sculptures are for me like personal archeological testimonies crystallized and immortalized.  www.sigalitlandau.com Press Materials:For high-res images, sample spreads, and a prospectus visit: https://goo.gl/TQA3NM

story:
Want to get your hands on a real Runner book?

So would I! Self-publishing differs from traditional publishing in the sense that I have to fund every part of the process, myself. From hiring an editor and cover artist to listing the ebook on Amazon and ordering paperbacks, it all adds up! That's why I'm calling upon you, my ever-supportive readers and true fans of The Runner Series, to help bring this story from Wattpad to your bookshelf.

 

About me

My name is Katie Baker and I'm the author of The Runner Series, a trilogy of action/adventure novels starring a rebellious thief and set against the backdrop of a dystopian wasteland. The Runner Series has been enjoyed by millions of people on Wattpad and was awarded a Watty in 2015.

 

Your contribution

Every last penny raised from this campaign will go directly towards polishing and priming the first book of The Runner Series for sale on Amazon. For $5 I will gift you with an e-book of The Runner, and if I reach my campaign goals then I will give contributors of $35 or more a paperback!

With your help, here's how I plan to bring Kay's story from screen to page:

  1. $3000: Hire a professional editor
    An editor will go through the book and help to iron out the creases, ensuring that, at the end of the day, we are releasing a story that I can be proud to share with you.
  2. $3300: Commission a cover
    Hiring a designer to create a professional, eye-catching book cover made with original assets.
  3. $3500: List the e-book on Amazon
    The completed e-book will be listed on Amazon so that anybody can purchase their very own copy!
  4. $6000: Print and ship paperback versions
    If we manage to reach the funding goal then I can go to print and put a paperback version of The Runner up for sale. Check out the rewards if you want to get a head start on the action!
    *Note: At this time, the cost of shipping is included only for residents of Canada and the US. International contributors should contact me directly to arrange shipping.

 

Rewarding your support

Your contributions will not go unnoticed! Check out the rewards in the sidebar to see what you can earn. I truly appreciate your support and I will do everything I can to make sure that fans of The Runner Series get to see the results of their generosity!

 

Other ways you can help

Just because you can't contribute, doesn't mean you can't help! Please share The Runner Series with your friends and family and spread the word about this fundraiser any way you can :)

How to share:

Twitter
Instagram
Wattpad

Thanks in advance to my amazing squad of ever-supportive runners. I love you guys!

xx
Kate

story:
Hi. I'm Brooks Palmer and I'm raising funds to cover the completion of my humor and cartoon book, Better Late Than Dead! I'm a humorist, writer, artist, and musician. Better Late Than Dead! is a compilation of some of my best humorous short stories, words of wisdom, and cartoons. I wrote and drew these pieces to make people laugh and think. It's my way of making the world a more fun and kind place to be. By contributing to my campaign, you can help me help the world to laugh and enjoy itself.

The book has endorsements from multiple comedy writers, including David Walbridge, President of Pro Comedy Writing, who said,

“Better Late than Dead is either a stand-up comedy routine or a book of Zen koans or a series of fortune cookies written by a hipster; either way it's funny and delightful. Mr. Palmer's books have been translated into 13 languages, but this one won't make a lick of sense in Swahili. It’s the perfect book to give as a gift, especially for humans, and is conveniently lunch-box portable (unlike say, a surfboard).”

Through this campaign I'm raising $780 to pay for the formatting of the inside and outside of the book. The formatting will be done by Colleen Sheehan at Write Dream Repeat You can find her at http://www.wdrbookdesign.com/. Better Late Than Dead! has been fully compiled and edited. Now it just needs the formatting for it to be out in the world. I'll be self-publishing and selling the book through Amazon where people will be able to buy a Kindle or paperback version.

I want to give back to you for giving to me. If you donate $35 to my campaign, I will send you a signed paperback version of Better Late Than Dead! If you donate $50, I will send you a signed paperback version of Better Late Than Dead! that will include a personally hand drawn cartoon especially for you. If you donate $150, I will send you a signed paperback version of Better Late Than Dead! with a personally hand drawn cartoon especially for you, as well as an unframed 11"x14" pastel drawing created with you in mind.

The world needs more kind humor. With your contribution, you'll help make people's hearts laugh. Laughter connects us rather than divides us. My two previous books, Clutter Busting: Letting Go of What's Holding You Back, and Clutter Busting Your Life: Clearing Physical and Emotional Clutter to Reconnect with Yourself and Others, were books about how to let go of what's no longer serving you so you can enjoy your life. Those books were bestsellers that have been translated into eight languages. My hopes are that Better Late Than Dead! will also speak to a great many people, and help open their hearts with humor.

Once Better Late Than Dead! is for sale to the public, I will heavily promote it. I will use some of the same channels that were used to promote my two previous books. I'm a personable salesperson. I have a way of talking about things that gets people interested. I will also be asking fans of my previous work to help spread the word. I can also use your help in getting the word out about Better Late Than Dead! Your help means a lot to me.

If you can't contribute financially, I would ask if you can help others know about this campaign and the book. You word is powerful. I'm deeply grateful if you choose to support Better Late Than Dead! Indiegogo has share tools that make spreading the word easier. Thanks!

If I raise more than $780, I will put the money towards the marketing of Better Late Than Dead!

Here's a sample from Better Late Than Dead!:

"A guy is digging a hole in his backyard and gets about three feet into the ground and hits something. He can’t tell what it is, so he digs it up and puts it on the ground above him so he can take a look at it.

He gets out and sees it is a tombstone and his name is written on it.

Due to shock from seeing this, plus exhaustion from digging all day, he passes out, falls into the hole, the dirt caves in on him and he dies.

Sometimes, things work out."

story:
We did it!  Thank you for your support - for believing in me and this work.

- Aimee Suzara, 6/29/11

My Story

In late 2008, I began a piece about skin color and how women, see ourselves, in light of our histories of colonization and racism, the media and cosmetic industry.  I had been curious about why, both in the United States, and in the Philippines, women would want to change the way we look, and I wanted to know what events might have led to this self-perception.


And so I began writing.  With dancer Frances Sedayao, I crafted a small piece focusing on whitening cosmetics that we showed at CounterPULSE in San Francisco.  I delved into research on Filipino history around the turn of the 20th century, conducted interviews with women of color of various ages about their skin color, talked with bright minds, and wrote, wrote, wrote. I began working with Aimee Espiritu, who brought both her scholarship as well as her visual artist's eye to develop projections to pair with the script. I crafted characters including a Fil-Am undergoing whitening treatments, a woman on display at the the 1904 World's Fair, and the ghost of a woman victim of femicide, commenting on the ways women's bodies have been fragmented and exploited.  Actual interview subjects performed on stage, giving testimony to common experiences of feeling ostracized or judged because of darker skin tones.

Kularts, Inc. hosted us in a Fall residency within which we gave two arts workshops, and participants were so enthusiastic that several of them joined our cast and crew!  We showed two nights of work-in-progress performance at the Bayanihan Center, and had a lively talkback session with the audiences.  Tears were shed, hearts were opened, and we all learned a great deal about one another. Audiences clearly want more.

So now, I'm back to the drawing board with the script, with powerful community input, more interviews, more stories to craft, and I'm tasked now to pull it together, weave, and make it into a cohesive work.  This requires time, focus and workshopping, and so I was excited to be selected for the ATLANTIC CENTER FOR THE ARTS' RESIDENCY in PLAYWRITING this summer!  It's in Florida, and will be 3 weeks among other playwrights, with mentorship from the award-winning playwright, ANNIE BAKER.  This is why I am asking for your support now - to help send me to that residency.

The Impact

The goal of this play is to bring awareness to important Filipino-American histories and bring healing to the often-fragmented Filipino/a and woman of color in America. We have already seen that the work-in-progress has been successful in these goals, but now it's time to take it to the next level!  Your support for this IndieGogo campaign allows me to complete a full draft of the script this summer at the Atlantic Center for the Arts.  Next year, I plan to produce the show as a full-length piece. Though it's hard to ask for help, this is just one small expense towards the larger picture. I believe in the power of communities to make art and change happen when we all put our forces together.  These are hard times for the arts, and so it's really up to us - the people who believe in, consume and create the art - to hold up what grants and commercial sources do not.  Those of you who contributed to the Kickstarter Campaign in 2010 saw us create 2 nights of multidisciplinary performance, and we couldn't have done it without you!

What We Need & What You Get

The Atlantic Center for the Arts offers a partially-subsidized three weeks of mentorship, workshopping with peers, and writing space, food and lodging. I need $550 for the residency an an additional $700 for the plane ticket and other travel costs  - I am also squeezing in a research trip to St. Louis, Missouri, the location of the 1904 World's Fair, where Filipinos were displayed.  I am also taking off the summer to work on the play, and this means I'll have no employment income to cover my living expenses.  To offset these costs, and to make this work really happen, I need your help to raise $1000 in 18 days.

For any donation, you'll get the invaluable gift of knowing my play is being put into the world.  But there are material gifts as well.  For a donation of $20 or more, you'll get a glossy production Photo.  For $35 or more, I'll send you a DVD of the 50-minute Work-in-Progress from 2010, so you can see what you are fostering into an evening-length work.  For $60 or more, you can get both this DVD as well as a copy of the recently re-released and very polished audio soundtrack featuring original music and theatrical scenes from Pagbabalik, my first play (musical direction and composition by Ron Gabriel Quesada of Kulintronica). For $100 or more, you can also get a copy of my chapbook, the space between.  For $200 you get the above, plus a one-on-one 1-hr consultation with me on a poetry, fiction or play manuscript.  Everyone will receive acknowledgement for your donation, unless you specify otherwise.

Other Ways You Can Help

This is a very short-term, relatively small campaign and so we need to operate with a swiftness. Please pass it on to your friends to make a quick donation!  Think of the 2 $4.50 soy mochas or the 1 movie or dinner you can forgo once to help me put this art into the world.  You can also join the circle of supporters of A History of the Body: several people are throwing small house parties to raise funds for the production of the play (costs will be over $20,000).  You can also volunteer to be an interview subject, help with research, join the production team, or sign up for a writing workshop when it's next offered.

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

Excerpt from "Pieces of Me" : "  A woman possesses the true power that men think they do. We do not do one thing. We do many things well. I am not just a woman. I am not just a writer. I hurt. I love. I frown and I smile. I party and I pray. The names have been changed but the pain remains the same. I am a whole and these are the pieces of me."

story:
INTRODUCTION

Hello! Irvin here. I am a fashion and portrait photographer (www.graphicsmetropolis.com) and I started A BOOK OF (www.abookof.us) a few years ago with the goal to make a collection of photos and stories with the topics and ideas that I love. It is an ambitious attempt to create a publication that can provide a venue to share stories with creative freedom. In doing so, I also thought of my creative friends and colleagues in mind. What if I create something that can not only share stories but also make a proactive impact that goes beyond the pages of the magazine?

When I first conceived A BOOK OF, I remember writing on the subway ride home how I envision each issue to support a charity or a cause. In that way, you as the reader also participate in the process.

A BOOK OF's title exists to place whatever story we are telling to the forefront. In our publication, Story rules. Whatever the method and the medium, our mission is to share the best stories to our audience.

A BOOK OF can be a book of anything. The possibilities are endless!

WHAT WE NEED

The contents and the shoots are all done and ready. We just need a little help in the $$ department to print the issue, distribute it, and set-up a launch event. Any help would go a long way. You can help us by sharing this to your social media friends and help us spread the word. You can also help by donating whatever you can.

WHY CONTRIBUTE

Because you love the arts and you want to support your fellow artists. Because you believe that print is alive. Because you know that there is power in storytelling. Because you will help us create and curate more stories for you.

You will help us print the book, distribute it to a larger audience, and YOU are going to be a part of it.

TIMELINE

August 29 – target launch date and event

End of September – Distribution and shipment of Perks

WHAT YOU WILL GET

Depending on the level of donation that you give, you will get a variety of perks from us- contributor credit, producer credit, poster, stickers, physical copies of the magazine, photoshoot with me (www.graphicsmetropolis.com), art print of a photo taken by Irvin from any of the stories inside the magazine, complimentary advertising space for web and for print.  

OTHER WAYS TO HELP

Any help, even just by sharing this link to your friends or people you think who may care helps a lot.

story:
James Kelly is an Author and Host of the Radio Show "Aspects of Writing". Rafael Lujan is the Father of two children and works at a Major Las Vegas Resort.


We are trying to raise the funds necessary to complete and promote this work. Promotion and printing costs are the only major hurdles. The more we raise, the bigger the promotion campaign. Our book:

Weird Combinations of Food Women Crave When Pregnant, and more... Written by Two Men

A complete guide to having a baby -

has been a fun adventure. What originally started out as a novelty book about strange food cravings, soon took off in several different directions.

The idea came about when one of our pregnant co-workers dipped a slice of green apple into her salsa. Rafael, being the father of two children, began to remember the strange cravings his wife had during both of her pregnancies. From there the book was born. James, the fact finder, began his research and discovered a host of other interesting suggestions and facts to incorporate into Weird Combinations of Food Women Crave When Pregnant, and more... Written by Two Men.

This book includes :

  • Strange Food Cravings
  • Things You Should NEVER Say When Your Spouse is Pregnant
  • It's Called COUVADE - Weird Cravings Are Not Just for Mom (Dad may get them as well)
  • Foods and Other Things to Avoid During a Pregnancy  
  • What an Expectant Mother Should be Eating
  • What is Pica? 
  • The Baby Shower
  • Baby Showers for Fathers
  • Baby Names
  • Morning Sickness
  • First Trimester
  • Second Trimester
  • Third Tirmester
  • How to Prepare for Baby

...and much, much more. This is an all inclusive book for the first time Mom, or Mom's who may want to learn more before giving birth to another child. It is both humorous and informative. We took a very serious look at what it takes to bring a child into the world today, including how to prepare financially for that little bundle of joy.


A twice published author, James Kelly will be responsible for publishing this project. The book has already been edited and is currently going through the typesetting process. The cover has already been designed. A printer has already been selected (turn around time of three days), and the ISBN has been registered with Bowker. This book will be ready for the limited edition printing by the time this campaign is over.

Please share this project page with your friends.
story_txt:
James Kelly is an Author and Host of the Radio Show "Aspects of Writing". Rafael Lujan is the Father of two children and works at a Major Las Vegas Resort.

We are trying to raise the funds necessary to complete and promote 
this work. Promotion and printing costs are the only major hurdles. The 
more we raise, the bigger the promotion campaign. Our book:
Weird Combinations of Food Women Crave When Pregnant, and more... Written by Two Men 

A complete guide to
having a baby - 
has been a fun adventure. What originally 
started out as a novelty book about strange food cravings, soon took off
 in several different directions. 
The idea came about when one of
 our pregnant co-workers dipped a slice of green apple into her salsa. 
Rafael, being the father of two children, began to remember the strange 
cravings his wife had during both of her pregnancies. From there the
 book was born. James, the fact finder, began his research and 
discovered a host of other interesting suggestions and facts to 
incorporate into Weird Combinations of Food Women Crave When Pregnant, and more... Written by Two Men.
 This book includes : 

Strange Food Cravings
Things You Should NEVER Say When Your Spouse is Pregnant
It's Called COUVADE - Weird Cravings Are Not Just for Mom (Dad may get them as well)
Foods and Other Things to Avoid During a Pregnancy  
What an Expectant Mother Should be Eating
What is Pica? 
The Baby Shower 
Baby Showers for Fathers 
Baby Names 
Morning Sickness
First Trimester
Second Trimester

story:
Story of My Book

3-Win Sponsorship is a detailed look at the evolution of marketing in the sports & entertainment industry.

My name is John Balkam and I am the author of 3-Win Sponsorship. I wrote this book because I am a passionate believer in the power of sports and entertainment to be a positive force for social good in the world.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover how purpose and social good is the key to successful sponsorship marketing in the 21st century. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for social impact sponsorship in you. And then ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you apply lessons from the leading purpose-driven marketers in the world.

In this book, you'll learn about the importance of Intentionality and Ownership in sponsorship, such as:

  • How the organizers of Super Bowl 50 executed the most giving, most sustainable Super Bowl ever.
  • Why NIKE stood by NFL athlete turned social justice activist, Colin Kaepernick, and how their business thrived because of that stand.
  • How Maple Leaf Sports & Entertainment teamed up with Hellman’s to get fans engaged in the critical social issue of food waste in Canada.

 

You will love this book if you are a sports fan who is also passionate about social impact and marketing.

3-Win Sponsorship is a non-fiction book that speaks to brand marketers and sponsorship professionals who are looking at the intersection of cause marketing and major sponsorship deals for the first time.

 

The Book - 3-Win Sponsorship

The book is written in 3 Parts.

Part 1 contains the introduction + Chapters 1-3. You will learn about the history of modern sponsorship marketing how the LA84 Olympics created a blueprint for all sponsorship marketing today. You’ll also learn about the Rise of the Conscious Consumer, and its implications on how we build our marketing campaigns.

Part 2 contains Chapters 4-8. In this section, you will learn the 5 Principles of 3-Win Sponsorship, and how to apply them and recognize them in your work. Hear from industry leaders like Ania Sponaski from GMR Marketing, Neill Duffy from Purpose + Sport, Dave Newport from CU Boulder, and many more, on how these principles have been applied in their own journeys.

Part 3 contains a brief look at the path forward. Hopefully, you will be inspired by the opportunity ahead in the coming decade to truly transform the sports & entertainment industry into a leading force for good in the world. You’ll explore some ideas on how marketers in North America and beyond can take full advantage of the 3-Win Sponsorship framework for events like the 2026 World Cup and the 2028 LA Olympics.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
 

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2019
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this Winter.

 

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

 

About the Author

John Balkam is the founder of Third Win Group (TWG), a purpose-driven sports and entertainment marketing firm. TWG helps talent, properties, and brands come together to create and execute effective social impact sponsorship programs which both do good for consumers and do well for their businesses.

Balkam’s dream is that sports and entertainment becomes the leading global industry for social good, equality, empowerment, and sustainability. He is a firm believer in Nelson Mandela’s message, which he originally shared at the 2000 Laureus World Sports Awards, that “Sport has the power to change the world.”

Along with his passion for sports, music, and entertainment, Balkam is a 3-time marathon finisher, a frequent pick-up basketball player, and a volunteer supporter of entrepreneurs in his community in the Washington, D.C. region.

For more information you can connect with John at john@thirdwin.com and @JohnBalkam on Twitter.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #3WinSponsorship and tag me @JohnBalkam as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
  • Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

 

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!
-John Balkam
