story:
Story of My Book

Have you ever been told to “suck it up!”? Have you ever said to yourself, “My voice isn’t worth it. I’m crazy!”?
You’re going to mess up. The person sitting next to you will, too. Let’s talk about it.

We all make mistakes. We all experience immense shame and guilt. And we all use our voices to spread a message. In VulnerABLE: How to Notice the Power of Vulnerability through Lettuce, Laundry, and Love, you'll notice the power in one's voice, and how to recognize what you were meant to share with the world. By exploring the meaning of vulnerability versus oversharing, and the importance of understanding ourselves and each other, we will look at lettuce, laundry, and love in a different way. We will explore the true meaning of connection.

My name is Julia Ruggiero and I am the author of VulnerABLE. I wrote this book because I never wanted anyone to feel stuck or alone for being themselves. I did not want to see any more people changing just to please others, and losing a grasp on what they truly love. I see the power in other people's voices, and want to help everyone and anyone feel like they do not need to withhold what they are meant to share with the world.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover the meaning behind vulnerability in a relatable and unique manner. I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for your voice in you. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you to embrace the imperfect and encourage others to love themselves and one another.

In this book, you'll learn how to notice vulnerability and gain the confidence in knowing you are not alone through three parts:
  • How our own voices and thoughts hold us back from embracing our worth
  • How other's voices, criticism, and opinions influence how we look at ourselves
  • How to notice the bigger, realistic meaning of love and connection

You will love this book if you ever experience doubt, sadness, confusion, or loneliness; people who are in a transition period in their lives whether a student, graduate, new parent, or someone who thinks they need to be somebody they are not to succeed. Notice how people can feel confident to use their voices, but also listen and accept other's voices. Realize that everyone is going through small and large changes in their lives, and we all handle stressors differently. VulnerABLE: How to Notice the Power of Vulnerability through Lettuce, Laundry, and Love, is a non-fiction book that speaks to people going through a time of transition looking to reframe their mindset, and notice the power in their voices.

 

The Book - VulnerABLE: How to Notice the Power of Vulnerability through Lettuce, Laundry, and Love

The book is written in three parts: Lettuce, Laundry, and Love. In Part 1, Lettuce, the chapter titles are the words we say to ourselves that hinder us from embracing vulnerability. Whether through doubt or self deprecation, we need to notice the harmful statements that hinder us from accepting ourselves. Hear from Julia, other women of all ages, and men discuss mental health barriers and the way we tend to view ourselves in times of stress.

In Part 2, Laundry, the chapter titles are quotes other people say to us that influence how we use our voices. Too many people give up knowing that we cannot control what others say to us, or the things that happen to us. Part 2 helps us navigate through situations that feel insurmountable, and learn how to accept and reason with others.

In Part 3, Love, the chapter titles focus on how we can work together to realize the realistic meaning of love, commitment, and connection. Julia speaks from personal experience about romantic and family relationships, doubts, and creating a safe space for vulnerability.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in July, 2019

The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!

The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)

The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication

The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this July.

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive... 

  • a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

About the Author

Julia Ruggiero is a motivational speaker and the creator of Campus Oils, a health and wellness outlet for people around the world, especially students, to learn about essential oils and self care. Graduating in May 2019 from John Carroll University, she specializes in Communications with a concentration in Integrated Marketing and Leadership Development. Her passions include speaking about student entrepreneurship, mental health awareness, and the power of vulnerability. Her energy and vulnerability empowers human after human to feel confident in their own skin, noticing that everyone has something special within themselves to share with the world. Throughout the book VulnerABLE, Julia invites people to join her on her journey while creating their very own. By “positively exposing” herself, she hopes that we too, will notice the worth in our voices, feeling comfortable in our own skin. Through sharing personal stories from her own life, as well as from mothers, men, women, and students in other walks of life, every reader can find a glimpse of wisdom to notice the rocky but powerful path of vulnerability.

For more information you can connect with Julia at www.juliaruggiero.com, jruggiero19@jcu.edu, and @juliacruggiero and/or @campusoils on Instagram.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
  • Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #vulnerABLEbook2019 and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
  • Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

I am excited to invite you to join my journey while creating your very own!

Sincerely,

Julia Ruggiero

story:
STORY OF MY BOOK:
I call my book a mixtape because that's how I think of this collection of poems. Across the book, I tell a "love" story in five parts. Between these sections are poems — some long, some short — which lean into the tone and emotional space of each part of the story. The intention is for the pieces to be felt more like songs than prose. 

I'm delighted to be coming out with this book because the work is a culmination of a many-years long journey. As some of you may know, I resisted creative writing for a long time and I'm finally giving into my passion. Publishing this collection is both vulnerable and exciting for me. I'm proud to say a number of the included pieces have been edited in their early stages by recent Nobel Prize winner Louise Glück and honored that a piece in the collection will also appear this summer in The Threepenny Review (where Louise often chooses to publish her own work). 

ABOUT THE AUTHOR:
Julia is a senior at Yale studying Film and Media with a focus on screenwriting and a developed interest in poetry. 
She was born and raised in various parts of Southern California and is currently very cold in her New Haven apartment.
For more information you can email her at julia.leatham@yale.edu. 
Or, you can follow her on Instagram at @juliamorgan_writer. 
To read some past essays, check out Julia Leatham in the Yale Daily News.

PERKS OF PRE-ORDERING:
* You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
*Packaging designed by yours truly.
* Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book. 
* You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review these sections and give me feedback if you wish to do so!
* You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover. 
* You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
* I will write you a personalized note! 

WHY I NEED YOU:
This book will be published with New Degree Press, which is a hybrid publisher. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
* The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2021.
* The cover design of my book. 
* The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
* The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
* The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this in April.

It really takes a village! I could not have embarked on this crazy long process without all of the immense help from New Degree Press, and we need to support all they are doing to make this book a reality. 

I would love to sell 150 copies of my book during the Pre-Sale campaign to cover the costs of publishing.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP:
Some people just can't contribute monetarily, right now. If you can't, please don't stress. I would be honored and grateful if you helped in any of the following ways:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #lovemixtape and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!
warmly,
Julia

RISKS & CHALLENGES:
The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
story_txt: STORY OF MY BOOK:I call my book a mixtape because that's how I think of this collection of poems. Across the book, I tell a "love" story in five parts. Between these sections are poems — some long, some short — which lean into the tone and emotional space of each part of the story. The intention is for the pieces to be felt more like songs than prose. I'm delighted to be coming out with this book because the work is a culmination of a many-years long journey. As some of you may know, I resisted creative writing for a long time and I'm finally giving into my passion. Publishing this collection is both vulnerable and exciting for me. I'm proud to say a number of the included pieces have been edited in their early stages by recent Nobel Prize winner Louise Glück and honored that a piece in the collection will also appear this summer in The Threepenny Review (where Louise often chooses to publish her own work). ABOUT THE AUTHOR:Julia is a senior at Yale studying Film and Media with a focus on screenwriting and a developed interest in poetry. She was born and raised in various parts of Southern California and is currently very cold in her New Haven apartment.For more information you can email her at julia.leatham@yale.edu. Or, you can follow her on Instagram at @juliamorgan_writer. To read some past essays, check out Julia Leatham in the Yale Daily News.PERKS OF PRE-ORDERING:* You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.*Packaging designed by yours truly.* Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book. * You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review these sections and give me feedback if you wish to do so!* You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover. * You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.* I will write you a personalized note! WHY I NEED YOU:This book will be published with New Degree Press, which is a hybrid publisher. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. story:
Story of My Book

Period? Life with Menstruation is a collection of short stories focused on women and their experiences surrounding menstruation. The book aims to make bodily awareness more accessible using a mix of storytelling and humor.

My name is Miriam Prosnitz, and I am the author of Period? Life with Menstruation. I wrote this book because menstruation is an uncomfortable topic for many and talking about periods gives us better tools to understand and manage our own bodies.

Rather than follow the status quo and pretend menstruation doesn't exist, I decided to write a book sharing the awkward, funny, and bloody moments of being a woman with a period. My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that while every woman has a unique relationship with her body, and periods aren't scary. You can even laugh about them. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to learn about menstruation, understand the impact menstruation has on people’s lives, and acknowledge the importance of bodily education.

In this book, you'll encounter multifaceted dimensions of the human female and her not-so-mystical vagina through narratives about:

  • Buying a pregnancy test at Target while praying not to be recognized.
  • What really happens when a tampon is flushed down the toilet.
  • Trying a menstrual cup for the first time with vigor.

 

Get the idea? There are 15 stories in this book, and they are all WILD while also being honest and relatable. You will love this book if you need a laugh, have always wondered if your body/vagina is "normal", or simply enjoy human stories.

Period? Life with Menstruation speaks to women and open-minded men who want to grapple with how women and society treat menstruation.

Ultimately, I hope that Period? Life with Menstruation inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

  • Why does birth control suck?
  • What is a menstrual disc and why did school teach me more about the British Monarchy than about period products? Henry VIII is never relevant, and I get my period every 30ish days.
  • Why is there so much stigma around menstruation? Pad commercials used viscous blue fluid to show “blood” until literally 2020 when they switched the color to red (any other year and that would have trended on twitter)

 

I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. I believe discussing women's health and women's bodies will change us all for the better.
 

The Book - Period? Life with Menstruation

The book consists of an Author's note, fifteen short stories, and an epilogue. The stories show diverse experiences with/without menstruation. I promise, when you read, it'll be self-explanatory
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Summer.

 

When I pre-sell 120 paperback copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

 

About the Author

Miriam Prosnitz is a product manager in the technology space who has worked on 3D printers, search engine optimization, big data, and more at companies ranging from tech behemoths (Wayfair and Google) to small startups. Prior to working in technology, Miriam graduated from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology with a degree in Computer Science and Electrical Engineering and a minor in Economics. During her studies, Miriam also spent a year at Cambridge University in their engineering department. This is all to say, Miriam has spent a lot of time being the only woman in a room.

Miriam is proud to be a woman. She enjoys being feminine and wearing dresses. She also recognizes that many women don’t like dresses and choose to define themselves without the stereotypical trappings of femininity. No matter how they express themselves, almost all women (and others) still have to deal with their period; a monthly/irregular/rare nuisance/blessing, depending on who you ask. Miriam wrote this book to show the diversity of experience around menstruation, and to break down societal taboos on the topic with comedy.

When not working in tech or writing her book, Miriam loves to hike, bake, and host dinner parties. She makes a mean flourless chocolate cake, which is good because she has a powerful sweet tooth (and a severe nut allergy).

For more information, you can connect with Miriam at MiriamOnMenstruation@gmail.com and at @miriam_on_menstruation on Instagram.

 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please send me a private message.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Clubhouse, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #MiriamOnMenstruation and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

 

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Miriam Prosnitz aka the Vagina Book Lady

story:
Story of My Book

My name is Tiffany Mosher and I am the author of Beauty Beyond the Threshold. I feel that my book offers readers a different perspective on how powerful the act of stepping out of their comfort zone truly can be in helping regain confidence and happiness within. As an introvert and someone who is naturally very shy, traveling solo was so frightening yet incredibly freeing at the same time. Overcoming depression and building confidence can be achieved by taking a step across the threshold, or, in other words stepping out of the comfort zone, and doing something a little terrifying yet a little exciting. For me personally, this meant traveling to volunteer in disaster response and school restoration projects. For others, those comfort zones can be something completely different. An example of this would be an aspiring singer who wants to get their name out there can take that step and sign up to sing at an open mic night. Every person knows what their individual thresholds are, and when we identify those and push ourselves to do something that can bring us happiness and joy, despite it being a little bit scary, there is so much beauty that can be discovered.

My hope is that, in reading this book, readers will be inspired to take healthy risks for the sake of learning more about themselves and bettering themselves. For those who are feeling sad, depressed, and anxious, don’t give up or lose hope. There is so much beauty beyond the threshold and all it takes to discover it is taking that first step.

You will love this book if you are someone who enjoys reading success stories of people who were able to overcome obstacles in unique ways, someone who enjoys reading about travel experiences, or someone who wants to get more out of their travel experiences. Beauty Beyond the Threshold speaks to readers who are seeking an alternative way to battle depression or anxiety or to readers who simply want to gain confidence and self-esteem. Reading my story can help you find inspiration and motivation to want to try something new.

Ultimately, I hope that Beauty Beyond the Threshold inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

  • What is my “threshold”? What is holding me back?
  • Some of the coping skills I tried in order to alleviate my depression and anxiety aren’t working. How can I help break the cycle of depression and anxiety within myself?
  • What are some new things I can experience that will help me build my confidence and self-esteem?
  • In what ways can I help and encourage someone who is battling depression and anxiety?

 

I really look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. Coming together and discussing the intersection of depression and recovery and the importance of building confidence and self-esteem will change us all for the better.

 

The Book - Beauty Beyond the Threshold

Part 1 contains the Prologue and Chapters 1-5. In these chapters, I share the background of the circumstances that led to my severe depression and anxiety which led me to the brink of suicide. Suddenly faced with being a single mom in my early 20s with two young children, I developed an immense fear of abandonment that sent my mind into a downward spiral of paranoia, anxiety, and depression. You will read about the difficult emotions I experienced and about the various coping skills that I used (which ultimately didn’t work out in my favor).

Part 2 contains Chapters 6-11. In these chapters, you will read about how I started my path of recovery. You will see how I became empowered and inspired after I made a spontaneous decision to travel by myself to the small town of Barranquitas, Puerto Rico to volunteer in disaster response after Hurricane Maria. Having never done any sort of construction work prior to going to Puerto Rico, it was amazing how helping completing a concrete roof repair for a gentleman named Israel changed my life for the better. You will also read some other fun and inspiring stories that involve me pushing myself out of my comfort zone all while dealing with new experiences of pain and heartache, like my amusing first attempt at acting while volunteering with the local emergency response team and my wild adventure of traveling solo to the jungle of Mexico (in other words, the trip where everything went wrong!).

Part 3 contains Chapters 12-19. In these chapters, you will read about my fun and wild adventures traveling all the way across the world to Nepal where I volunteered in earthquake relief and helped build two schools. I was literally terrified to travel all that way by myself. However, Nepal was on my bucket list! I was determined to go, so I took the risk and went. The different types of work I helped with like mixing cement, making bricks, and backfilling dirt all took a physical toll on my body that was already exhausted from the jet lag. However, the most beautiful thing was seeing the hope and gratitude in the eyes of the Nepali children who would be attending the schools after they were completed. Knowing that I was going to be making a difference in those children’s lives and for generations to come was a priceless gift for my mind, body, and soul.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2020
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this winter

 

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

 

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your name will appear in a Special Acknowledgements section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my book and some additional sections of my manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to be involved and give me feedback in selecting my book cover
  • An invitation to my book launch party
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

 

About the Author

Tiffany Mosher is an author and Logistics Analyst in Norfolk, Virginia. She graduated from the University of Maryland with a Bachelor of Science in Social Science with concentrations in Anthropology and Sociology. As a current graduate student studying Human Security and Resilience at Embry-Riddle Aeronautical University, her research emphasis is focused on human and ecosystem resilience as well as resource insecurities within ethnic minorities and indigenous societies amid natural disasters, intra- and international conflicts, and mass migration. She will be graduating this October.

Tiffany has found solace in the numerous volunteer opportunities that she has participated in. She is the International Missions Director for AIDNOW, a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization based in Virginia Beach, Virginia whose mission is to bring education, health, sanitation, and physical resources together to assist individuals in South Eastern Virginia, Nationally, and Globally. AIDNOW’s Jump Start project is an annual event that is held for approximately 500 students in the Virginia Beach City Public Schools System identified as homeless and marginalized to receive much-needed supplies and services, such as backpacks, school supplies, clothing, haircuts, eye exams, toiletries and shelf-stable food. Project Fostering Hope is a partnership between AIDNOW and Dreams for Mayan Children that focuses on the restoration of the grounds of the Francisco Gonzalez Baconegra Preescolar in the indigenous Mayan village of Nuevo Durango, Quintana-Roo, Mexico. The mission of Fostering Hope is to build resilience in the children of the village by creating a fun and safe learning environment.

As a disaster response volunteer with All Hands and Hearts, Tiffany participated in concrete roof repair and mold sanitation in Barranquitas, Puerto Rico after Hurricane Maria, mucking, gutting, and critical home repairs in Bayboro, North Carolina after Hurricane Florence, and assisted in earthquake recovery for the rebuild of two schools (Thakureshwor and Janakalyan) in Marin, Nepal. She has also volunteered with Positive Legacy and Dreams for Mayan Children in Dos Palmas and Chemuyil, Mexico, and with the Community Emergency Response Team in Chesapeake, Virginia.

When Tiffany isn’t working, studying, or writing, she enjoys spending time with her family. She is an avid learner and is interested in researching different cultures around the world and loves going to museums. Her guilty pleasures include reading travelogues, drinking hot tea (even if it is 95 degrees outside), listening to the Avett Brothers, going to concerts (especially to see the Avett Brothers), playing the guitar and piano, and watching Jeopardy! and marathons of the Golden Girls. If you happen to be sitting with Tiffany while she has a margarita in hand, you never know what silly directions the conversation will go in!

For more information, you can connect with Tiffany at tmosher.author@gmail.com, on Facebook @TiffanyMosherAuthor, on Instagram @author_tiffany_mosher and LinkedIn linkedin.com/in/tiffany-mosher-11534b117.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
  • Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #beautybeyondthethreshold and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
  • Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Tiffany Mosher

I was literally terrified to travel all that way by myself. However, Nepal was on my bucket list! I was determined to go, so I took the risk and went. The different types of work I helped with like mixing cement, making bricks, and backfilling dirt all took a physical toll on my body that was already exhausted from the jet lag. However, the most beautiful thing was seeing the hope and gratitude in the eyes of the Nepali children who would be attending the schools after they were completed. Knowing that I was going to be making a difference in those children’s lives and for generations to come was a priceless gift for my mind, body, and soul. 
What I Need & What You'll Get
This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2020
The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this winter

 
When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
 

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
A personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
Your name will appear in a Special Acknowledgements section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
Early access to the Introduction of my book and some additional sections of my manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
The opportunity to be involved and give me feedback in selecting my book cover
An invitation to my book launch party
I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
And more...

 
About the Author
Tiffany Mosher is an author and Logistics Analyst in Norfolk, Virginia. She graduated from the University of Maryland with a Bachelor of Science in Social Science with concentrations in Anthropology and Sociology. As a current graduate student studying Human Security and Resilience at Embry-Riddle Aeronautical University, her research emphasis is focused on human and ecosystem resilience as well as resource insecurities within ethnic minorities and indigenous societies amid natural disasters, intra- and international conflicts, and mass migration. She will be graduating this October.Tiffany has found solace in the numerous volunteer opportunities that she has participated in. She is the International Missions Director for AIDNOW, a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization based in Virginia Beach, Virginia whose mission is to bring education, health, sanitation, and physical resources together to assist individuals in South Eastern Virginia, Nationally, and Globally. AIDNOW’s Jump Start project is an annual event that is held for approximately 500 students in the Virginia Beach City Public Schools System identified as homeless and marginalized to receive much-needed supplies and services, such as backpacks, school supplies, clothing, haircuts, eye exams, toiletries and shelf-stable food. Project Fostering Hope is a partnership between AIDNOW and Dreams for Mayan Children that focuses on the restoration of the grounds of the Francisco Gonzalez Baconegra Preescolar in the indigenous Mayan village of Nuevo Durango, Quintana-Roo, Mexico. The mission of Fostering Hope is to build resilience in the children of the village by creating a fun and safe learning environment.As a disaster response volunteer with All Hands and Hearts, Tiffany participated in concrete roof repair and mold sanitation in Barranquitas, Puerto Rico after Hurricane Maria, mucking, gutting, and critical home repairs in Bayboro, North Carolina after Hurricane Florence, and assisted in earthquake recovery for the rebuild of two schools (Thakureshwor and Janakalyan) in Marin, Nepal. She has also volunteered with Positive Legacy and Dreams for Mayan Children in Dos Palmas and Chemuyil, Mexico, and with the Community Emergency Response Team in Chesapeake, Virginia.When Tiffany isn’t working, studying, or writing, she enjoys spending time with her family. She is an avid learner and is interested in researching different cultures around the world and loves going to museums. Her guilty pleasures include reading travelogues, drinking hot tea (even if it is 95 degrees outside), listening to the Avett Brothers, going to concerts (especially to see the Avett Brothers), playing the guitar and piano, and watching Jeopardy! and marathons of the Golden Girls. If you happen to be sitting with Tiffany while she has a margarita in hand, you never know what silly directions the conversation will go in!For more information, you can connect with Tiffany at tmosher.author@gmail.com, on Facebook @TiffanyMosherAuthor, on Instagram @author_tiffany_mosher and LinkedIn linkedin.com/in/tiffany-mosher-11534b117.
 
Risks & Challenges
The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 
Other Ways You Can Help Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #beautybeyondthethreshold and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.
You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!Thanks again,Tiffany Mosher

story:
The Campaign

Our dear friend Kristin recently found out that she has breast cancer. We started this campaign to make sure Kristin can keep doing everything she loves. Eat yummy food. Practice yoga. Read lots of books. Have her friends and family by her side. She has the best of the best doctors to take care of her body, we can all help take care of her soul. Keep Kristin Comfy. 

How You Can Help

We need to raise money to buy things for Kristin that will make her smile. You choose what you want to donate, we will go out and purchase, and together we'll all present the gifts you've generously donated to Kristin at a party in her honor. If you'd rather just donate money, we'll keep a running list of all of the donors as well. When it prompts you to enter your address after donating please do, so we can send you a thank you letter after the party. Details on the party TBA.

The Impact

Geez! The impact is HUGE. It's going to be a tough year, but Kristin is so strong, and what better way to show your support than to contribute something you know will make her little heart flutter. As she would say, oh melt my heart!

Other Ways You Can Help

We've designed the campaign keeping in mind that some of you might not have much money to contribute. You can donate one of the $25 gifts or even $5 in cash. Also, if you want to join together with a few people and pool your money to put it towards something more expensive, like a flight for Kristin's parents to come visit, that's another option. Anything you can do will help. And, of course, we hope you'll all make it to Kristin's party. 

Thank you so much!

<3 Paige & Graham

story:
I’m 17, have been writing since before I can remember just as a hobby, and now I realize I can hopefully use it to impact the world. I’ve been playing the piano since I was 6 or 7, Viola since I was 12 and singing loosely on the side, been in some high school choirs. Was in my high school piano class for a while, maxed that out and am continuing in the orchestra.

Plot synopsis: Five prestigious individuals assigned to save Earth from an incoming comet decide humanity is already a dead race. Desperate to free themselves from it, they develop a synthetic planet with the intent of shuttling the good men and women of the world there to restart humanity. The five all have different ideas of how this Utopia should run, and those clashing ideas quickly turn to factions. In essence, it’s a caricature on where we’re headed, why, and how to stop it.

All contributors will help me self-publish the book with the help of Abbott Press.

The package I would like to buy from them, which professionally publishes paperback and hardcover copies as well as e-books and disseminates the novel to a large number of distributors, costs exactly $3,000.

Depending on how much you fund, I can give you a paperback copy, hardcover copy, or an online key that acts as a token to receive an e-book. If the funds aren’t entirely met, I’m sure I can cover the rest.

From Worlds for Throng:

“You don't know what it’s like to care. Every day is exhausting and horrifying, because no one else feels to such an extent. They don't comprehend it. You don't get their oblivious, mindless, unconscious trek to wherever they're told to go, and they don't get you. Its enraging not to be able to communicate with them. You feel like you want to just lose yourself and fall into that sea of apathy, but you also want to remain a man and individual. Sensitivity is a gift above all. It gives life spark and meaning. But surrounded by those who feel nothing, it becomes hell. One seemingly insignificant and arbitrary thing can set you off. It breaks your heart and then you obsess on it. You have to fix it. And everyone thinks you're crazy to have something this odd affect you this much, but you know exactly why, you can feel it, but you can't quite put it into words. It’s beyond that. All you know how to say is, its empathy and love. I want you. I want to make sure you're okay, and that you always will be. People treat death like a status or a number. And in questing for power for whatever reason, it becomes a minor set-back, you mourn and keep going. People comfort themselves by saying they've moved on and they're in a better place. Like their suffering is over. You forget that life is the heaven we've been looking and waiting for. And we waste it by fighting and killing, trying to get to it. It’s here, now. Just covered by everything we've filled it with. Everything's so rushed and mechanic. Inhuman. Ambition will come naturally if we just leave everyone alone. And right now contentment is the most sought after and impossible want to obtain. There's something very wrong with that. We're all constantly working to stay alive until the day we die. That's not natural, that's just the corner we've forced ourselves into. And with all we've discovered and all we've created up until now, fighting to live everyday of our lives, is the last position we should be in.”

If you can or cannot pay, either way, please get the word out. The novel is important to me, and I hope you connect with the excerpt , and agree that it can make an impact, if read.

Support it here > http://www.facebook.com/FiveUnite

Read it here > http://teenink.com/novels/sci_fi_fantasy/book/84069/Worlds-for-Throng/

story:
Hello, my name is JD Spivey and I am student, artist and writer who. I am working on my first children’s picture book and I need your help.

Recently, there’s been a string of murders in my neighborhood. The culprits responsible for these murders were younger than 18. For the past couple of years, I have wanted to combat the surge in violence that has happened in my neighborhood and in the country, but I just didn’t know how.

With the recent Sandy Hook shootings, everyone has been trying to combat the recent surge in violence by discussing gun-laws, mental health, demographics you name it. As I stood back at home watching TV with politicians and commentators going at it, I asked myself what could I do to help out? I don’t have money to throw at the situation, I’m not expert in addressing mental health issues and I don’t want to get caught up in the bickering of whether guns laws will really do trick because let’s face it the jury it still out on that; not to mention it’s a crazy uphill battle to enact or revoke anything. And then it hit me.

Seeds of wisdom and peace must be planted in our youth early to equip them to make wise decisions in their life. What better way to this by writing a children’s book series called The Adventures of Audio and Billy Bob Dragon.

My goal is to not only entertain kids with silly jokes, but address social issues such as bullying, divorce, violence and death. There is even a story that teaches them to speak up for help when they are touched inappropriately. These stories could really make a difference. That’s where you come into play.

The money that you send will be used to buy an art tablet for drawing on my computer (yes I will illustrate too), fees for publishing on demand, marketing, editing, and buying software for illustrating.

And here’s the greatest part!

The first book will be available as a FREE e-BOOK download. I bet you’re excited now?  

I want my stories to leave a lasting impact on our youth. Imagine the possibilities of living in a safer world where our children make wise decisions. Can you help me?

If you can’t contribute, I understand. But you can still help. Please get the word out and make some noise about this campaign. Use the Indiegogo share tools!

J.D. Spivey

story:
Tengo el compromiso de publicar todo mi trabajo en español. Las traducciones pueden ser muy complicadas y toman una gran cantidad de tiempo y recursos. Mi meta es tener una versión en español de este libro en abril de 2014, el cual estará disponible en tiendas de Colombia y en todo el mundo a través de plataformas en la red.

The Story

I moved to Colombia and fell in love with a beautiful country and the friendliness and openness of the Colombia people. 

After eight months of research and writing I was able to produce a travel guide of many regions of Colombia, but I fell short of producing a book on the whole country and had to leave the country due to a lack of finances.

Many people in Colombia and around my life ask me similar questions all the time:

  • What happened during this eight month period?
  • Why did I walk away from the project?
  • Why would a teacher quit his secure job and try to publish books with no experience as a writer or in the book industry?
  • Why did I choose Colombia to be the first country that I created a book on?
  • What would possess me to ride a motorcycle around one of the world's most perceived dangerous countries?
  • Where did I go too and why am I back in Colombia with a new blog and my first book back on the market?

My Return to Colombia

In July of 2013, I returned to Colombia to continue my project. I created a new team of ten freelancers to help design a new company. I launched a blog and within a few weeks I was getting thousands of hits. My goal is to write a book on all of Colombia in 2014 and continue to develop my blog, but I first want to document what has happened with my experiences in the form of a memoir.

The Book

My Epic Failure And Slow Rise From The Abyss will be an inside look into the my story. I will document my experiences from when I left the United States to when I traveled and lived in Honduras, Colombia, Taiwan, and Cambodia.

I will recollect the events and people that have lead me to my current situation.

The story has many twist and turns and includes dozens of interesting people from many different countries.

I estimate the book will be around 400 - 500 pages in length.

The book will be available as a paperback and hard copy.

The books will be printed in the United States and be available for worldwide shipping. Due to shipping costs only the autographed version will be available outside the United States.

My goal is to have the books shipped by the last week of February, 2014. This is a reasonable goal as the book is mostly written and I have an editing system in place. It still takes time to produce a book and this date gives me a buffer zone for the inevitable issues on these type of projects. 

The Rewards

The rewards are straightforward and the cost decreases when you buy more books. This is due to a lowered shipping cost by sending multiple copies.

PDF - Will be sent electronically when the print books ship.

Paperback and hard copy - These books will be printed in the United States.

Autographed book - Please be aware I have the handwriting of a 1st grader. If you do not want your book to be autographed and you choose the international order option please tell me and I will not sign it.

Hard copy - These books will be numbered by how many are sold through this Indigogo campaign (max. number - 313). The backers will be giving the lower number by the order of the purchase.

Signed promotion posters - Explore Travel Guides Colombia had 100 small posters printed in Colombia for promotions in businesses. We have many hanging in hostels and other locations in Colombia. This poster will not be reprinted due to design changes in the future. I will sign the back of the poster and may one day be considered a limited edition item. 

Trip to Colombia -  Do you want to come to Colombia, but are looking for a personal guide? Choose the high roller option and I will give you a tour of Bogotá and/or the North Coast of Colombia for two people for up to seven days. This package includes accommodations, food and basic tours. Please contact me for more info, (does not include international or domestic airfare).

Budget

The money will go towards editing, graphic design, marketing, my basic living expenses and other book related expenses.

Once my 35 day Indigogo campaign is over I will send a detailed budget of the project to my backers. 

The initial $9,000 is budgeted to finance getting the book into English. All money raised past this will go towards having the book put into Spanish. I would need around $18,000 total to do this and will post more information on the numbers if I´m lucky enough to have achieved my first goal of $9000.

What success of this Indigogo campaign means

If this campaign reaches $9000 successfully there will be many positive situations created.

I will have the ability to tell my story to many people in Colombia and the world.

My freelancers will continue to have an income to support their educations and families. They also will be able to build their resumes and gain practical work experience.

My company will have a product with a cash value to help fund our future growth.

I will be able to bring money into Colombia and be able to create work opportunities for Colombians with challenging and rewarding positions.

Many people will get to read and learn about the beauty and positive side of Colombia versus the negative image that most people have of Colombia around the world.

Thanks for supporting my project!


    www.gotocolombia.com

If this campaign reaches $9000 successfully there will be many positive situations created.
I will have the ability to tell my story to many people in Colombia and the world.
My freelancers will continue to have an income to support their educations and families. They also will be able to build their resumes and gain practical work experience.
My company will have a product with a cash value to help fund our future growth.
I will be able to bring money into Colombia and be able to create work opportunities for Colombians with challenging and rewarding positions.
Many people will get to read and learn about the beauty and positive side of Colombia versus the negative image that most people have of Colombia around the world.
Thanks for supporting my project!





    www.gotocolombia.com

story:
Hello everyone,

 

My name is Dawn Marie Gordon, and I am a writer to my very core; it defines all aspects of my personality and guides all I endeavor to accomplish both within and outside of the literary industry.

Fifteen years ago, a major life event forced me to place my writing career on hold. At that time, I had already stockpiled nine thriller/suspense novels at various stages of development (five of which were completed drafts), as well as a half dozen children’s books set aside to await the magic of an illustrator. It was my intention to write until I felt my voice was strong enough to rise above the slushpile. Once there, I'd work my way up the ladder toward my ultimate goals. Unfortunately, shortly after reaching that first proud milestone, everything screeched to a halt.

This research project was formally developed after receiving an offer for a funding loan from someone acquainted with my background, my aspirations of seeing my name on the New York Times bestseller list, as well as my dreams of sponsoring the organizations dedicated to fighting the horrors of crimes against children. This US trip was to allow me to gather enough area research and American authenticity to support all present and future creative works. It would also provide me with the time required to polish Remember to Forget and at least one additional novel. The industry has experienced many changes since my departure. It is critical I rebuild my understanding of the literary world as it stands today. Sadly, however, this offer in its entirety was recently withdrawn.

I have waited fifteen years to return, and I cannot give up now. But I cannot do this alone.

It is my deepest hope that all those who know me believe in their hearts I have earned this chance to resume the pursuit of my dream, and that they will ripple that faith across the world for all to hear.

For every share and every contribution this campaign is awarded, I will do everything in my power to make you proud.

I am a writer to my very core; and my word is my honor.

****

Throughout the span of this campaign I will continue to add information regarding my research interests and their purpose, as well as more about myself. Please stay tuned for new details!

****

Below please find a brief description of the first title to be polished during this trip and first to be published. It has endured a number of intense revisions since its inception, including updating to current day (events, laws, etc.). One more go-around and it's ready.

 

Remember to Forget – Novel Pitch

by DM Gordon

 

Twenty-six years ago a man took his daughter through the forest with thirteen containers of ashes and bone to sprinkle into the creek, making a child the only accomplice to scores of unsolved disappearances. Homicide detective Simone Rocher can’t even recall the last time she thought about her childhood, much less cared. However, when two victims are discovered four hours apart—already embalmed and bearing an unnerving resemblance to Simone—it triggers a succession of nightmares and flashbacks that not only fail to coincide with her conscious memories, but also don’t appear to connect to each other. Enigmatic and hardheaded at the best of times, and more determined than ever to raise the emotional barricade between herself and her partner, Lewis Hamilton, Simone leaves herself nowhere to turn when the details of victim five are confirmed identical but for one crucial change—the killer is left-handed. She can run but she cannot hide from herself. Not now, when one of the killers they seek might just prove to be the woman she no longer recognizes in the mirror.

****

 

PROJECT COST OVERVIEW

 

LIVING EXPENSES x 2 months $5,800

(Minimum listed; maximum would be four or five months; includes furniture rental and reference material; in honor of all campaign contributors, majority of household items purchased outright will be donated to a family-oriented charity at time of departure)

DAMAGE DEPOSIT $1,000

(Any amount reimbursed will be applied to the same necessity upon returning home)

EQUIPMENT $500

(Minimum listed; minimum refers to GPS and camcorder; maximum $2800 and would also include desktop computer, printer, MS Office, desk and chair)

RESEARCH TRIPS $1,000

(Minimum listed; maximum $6,000 to research all intended points; amounts illustrated refer to fuel, meals, and accommodation, as well as area-specific research material)

TRIP TO $1,600

(Minimum listed; maximum $2,200 to include all cities of interest; refers to fuel, meals, and accommodation, as well as area-specific research material)

TRIP FROM $1,600

(Minimum listed; maximum $2,200 to include all cities of interest; refers to fuel, meals, and accommodation, as well as area-specific research material)

TRAVEL INSURANCE $500

(Cost may vary up or down based on coverage days required)

VEHICLE $3,000

(Current vehicle is scrap worthy)

LTD EDITION BOOK PRINT $5,000

(Estimate includes cover design to be paid separate from publication costs to artist Elizabeth Munro)

Hello everyone,
 
My name is Dawn Marie Gordon, and I am a writer to my very core; it defines all aspects of my personality and guides all I endeavor to accomplish both within and outside of the literary industry.
Fifteen years ago, a major life event forced me to place my writing career on hold. At that time, I had already stockpiled nine thriller/suspense novels at various stages of development (five of which were completed drafts), as well as a half dozen children’s books set aside to await the magic of an illustrator. It was my intention to write until I felt my voice was strong enough to rise above the slushpile. Once there, I'd work my way up the ladder toward my ultimate goals. Unfortunately, shortly after reaching that first proud milestone, everything screeched to a halt.
This research project was formally developed after receiving an offer for a funding loan from someone acquainted with my background, my aspirations of seeing my name on the New York Times bestseller list, as well as my dreams of sponsoring the organizations dedicated to fighting the horrors of crimes against children. This US trip was to allow me to gather enough area research and American authenticity to support all present and future creative works. It would also provide me with the time required to polish Remember to Forget and at least one additional novel. The industry has experienced many changes since my departure. It is critical I rebuild my understanding of the literary world as it stands today. Sadly, however, this offer in its entirety was recently withdrawn.
I have waited fifteen years to return, and I cannot give up now. But I cannot do this alone.

story:
Short Summary

Strength Hope Encouragement (SHE)

 

“We Are Real“

 

Hello! Thanks for your interest in the SHE (Strength Hope Encouragement) for women We are Real writing project. The basis of this project is to build an anthology of women’s personal stories. If done correctly it will help us to discover that as women we share more similarities than we do differences, and second it will provide support for each of us as we continue on our journeys towards personal empowerment and personal sustainability. That is why we need your help.

 This is how it works; each young woman will write a story on one of the following topics:

                 (a) AN EVENT THAT HAS OCCURRED IN YOUR LIFE THAT HELPED YOU GROW

 

                 (b) AN EVENT THAT HAS OCCURRED IN YOUR LIFE THAT CAN INSPIRE OR MOTIVATE ANOTHER YOUNG WOMAN

 

                (c) AN EVENT THAT DEMONSTRATES HOW YOU CONTRIBUTE TO WOMEN’S EMPOWERMENT

Afterward, I will edit the anthology and divide it into specifc catagories such as "Women and Money," or "Women and Detemination." You get the idea. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need two very important things that will make SHE a reality. We need marketing and we need support to publish the anthology,

In order for the project to work it needs to reach more women. Your contribution will help us do just that. We also need funds to promote the anthology once it is complete. YOUR CONTIBUTION WILL BE BROKEN DOWN LIKE SO:

%25 of the funds used to advertise for submissions for SHE

%50 of the funds used for the creation of the antology (paying cover artist, printers,copyer,etc)

%25 used to return perks for your support 

The Impact

The difference your contribution will make:

This endeavor cannot be achieved alone. With your contribution SHE will reach more women and therefore impact more lives. The anthology will include the following:

  • A letter to our daughters (from an elder of our choosing)
  • Universal topics that impact young women (love, money, sex, career, body image, family, self-esteem)
  • A letter from the editor
  • Pictures of the SHE team 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Tell as many friends and family as possible be sharing SHE through your social networking sites
  • If you are 17 or older and want to share your story email: brittaneydharden@gmail.com 

And that’s all there is to it. THANK YOU!

story:
Not Music, Doing Music Things. 

***CLICK THE GALLERY TAB FOR SPOKEN WORD VIDEOS***

WHY DO I WANT TO PRESS A 7" RECORD: 

I'm proceeding this art project of recording and pressing these four poems because I've always wanted to release something in my favorite musical format, vinyl. But I want to do it differently. I've collected records for years and what I come to love about them is that they feel like the next best thing to seeing the band live. I'm trying to recreate that effect, but with my Spoken Word.

I've always approached "Trey the Ruler" as if it were a band, being on tour for months at a time, printing merch, and now soon; releasing records. This is all rooted from my upbringing in the music scene, later to be my love for the hardcore/punk scene where I learned my DIY ethic approach when it comes to what I do. That's why I perform at shows without other spoken word artists, that's why I tour with bands. Because that's what I love and what I write applies very deeply to people like me who are found in the hardcore scene. 

I plan on still sticking to those DIY ethics, even if with your finachal investment and involvement. For instance I plan on ordering the records, jackets, and bags all from different distributors (thanks to my friend Cassidy from Better Days Records) to keep it affordable. I'll be assembling all records by hand.  Mailing/selling/distro will all be done by me. I still control all the orders, and connections to find tours. It's all still me. 

By doing this I am by no way saying that you need money to do Spoken Word, because you don't. You need only your own voice. This fundraiser is me saying I'd like to take my Spoken Word to the next level, by becoming a part of your record collection. Neighboring all those other records by bands that I look up to. This gives me a chance to do it in a timely manner to release these pieces where they are still very relevant to me and world we live in. 

If you donate to help me make this finally happen, thank you so much. If you took the time to read this, thank you as well. I'd love to make this happen but only can if people get involved with an understanding that they can be a part of something that can change the way people think about recording Spoken Word. If the goal is exceeded, every dollar will go to the kick off for this record and making it a worthy celebration where the record will be affordable. So please share this page with your friends and family. The first poem of this record is titled "Deth Cvlt" and you can check that out on this page.

Thanks again for all your support! 

-Trey

If you live near any of these areas feel free to visit me and talk about this project I'll be tour managing for Heart to Heart this summer. 

07/12 Charleston, SC @ The Skatepark of Charleston
07/13 Wilmington, NC @ Soapbox Landro-Lounge
07/14 Nashville, TN @ The End
07/15 South Bend, IN @ Generic
07/16 Chicago, IL @ Fireside Bowl
07/17 Des Moines, IA @ Vaudeville Mews
07/19 Denver, CO @ Marquis Theatre
07/21 Boise, ID @ The Venue
07/22 Seattle, WA @ Studio Seven
07/23 Portland, OR @ Branx
07/25 San Francisco, CA @ DNA Lounge
07/26 Anaheim, CA @ Chain Reaction
07/27 Rancho, CA @Nitty Gritty
07/28 Phoenix, AZ @ The Underground
07/29 Lubbock, TX @ Jake's Sports Cafe
07/30 Dallas, TX @ Tom Cats West
07/31 Little Rock, AR @ Downtown Music
08/01 Evansville, IN @ The Hatch
08/02 Toledo, OH @ Frankies
