story:
SUMMARY OF THE GLOBAL SENSE PROPOSAL

GLOBAL SENSE reveals the way the world really works and how a sense of our global oneness empowers us to change the world from within ourselves.

Uniting inner spirituality and personal growth with ecological awareness and grassroots politics, Global Sense brings our highest ideals down to earth where we can use them. Inspired by Thomas Paine’s history-changing 1776 essay, Common Sense, Global Sense: The 2012 Edition offers reasons for hope in these times that try our souls.

If you support robust marketing, printing and international distribution of my award-winning book, Global Sense: The 2012 Edition, you can help to awaken people worldwide. (Please visit the book website at GlobalSense.com)

Please see the growing list of contributors with links their websites posted at GlobalSense.com/community/crowdfunders/

About the Book

  • Global Sense explains and promotes the power of our global interactivity to transform the world through our individual actions (this very same connectivity empowers crowdfunding). Global Sense aims to help society reach the pivotal "tipping point" before it's too late.
      
  • Uniting spiritual enlightenment and personal growth with global thinking and grassroots politics, Global Sense brings our highest ideals down to earth where we can use them.

Audience for the Book

  • Multiple research sources show that a core group about 15 percent of all adults in the world's industrialized nations have developed a global sensibility. This percentage is slightly lower in the so-called "third world" countries.
      
  • Given 4.9 billion adults among 7 billion people on the planet, that 15 percent equals at least 500 million people with global sense on earth today. Growing this base of global thinkers can transform society and help us resolve our global crises together.
      
  • If one percent (1 percent) of the 500 million audience reads Global Sense, this would mean 5 million copies of the book influencing individuals and society as a whole, speeding up the day when we create a sustainable future.

Why crowdfunding is needed

  • I am currently printing Global Sense for online sales of a trade paperback edition through digital print-on-demand presses in the U.S., UK and (soon) Australia. This involves little up-front capital on my end, however....
       
  • Physical bookstores and libraries almost never order print-on-demand books. They want hardcover (cloth cover) books, which requires traditional advance printing, This severely limits the potential reach of Global Sense and its benefits.
      
  • The solution is printing clothcover books in advance, so one or more of the top book distributors will agree to carry and promote the book to stores and libraries around the world, or at least in the English-reading nations.
      
  • Conventional cothcover book printing can be pricey. The cost-per copy hinges on the amount of copies printed once the presses are running. The more books that I can afford to print at once, the lower the unit cost for these books.
      
  • Strong support for this crowdfunding campaign is essential for persuading one or more top distributors to carry Global Sense, since they will see the book has a strong market base.

How your contribution will be used

  • Your contribution will support printing clothcover editions of Global Sense after securing trade distribution to retail chains, independent booksellers, libraries, colleges, and universities throughout the English-reading world.
      
  • Reaching the full $22,000 goal will allow the printing and distribution of clothcover books throughout English-reading nations. Lesser funding will support printing and distribution at a proportional level.

  • If total funding is below $5,000, since that will not be enough for advance printing of a hardbound edition, your contribution instead will go toward the marketing the POD edition, so I can earn enough though online sales to print the clothcover edition.

My qualifications to do what I propose

  • I was trained in book marketing and publicity by the same people who trained Deepak Chopra, Jack Canfield, Mark Victor Hansen, John Gray, Robert Kiyosaki, and other best-selling authors who started as unknowns.

  • Along with 30 years of professional experience as a local to global journalist, I've managed marketing, public relations and advertising campaigns for major organizations and cultural institutions. I'm already applying this skill toward marketing Global Sense assertively.

  • My extensive book industry knowledge flows from membership and leadership in such trade organizations as the Independent Book Publisher Association (IBPA), American Society of Journalists and Authors, Colorado Independent Publishers Association, Colorado Authors League, and Denver Press Club. I founded the 900-member Denver Book Club. Also, I serve diverse clients as a book publishing coach through my own Hoku House in Hawaii.
      
  • View my bio profile for more information on my experience and abilities.

Benefits from supporting Global Sense

  • First and foremost, you contribute to people on earth awakening to the deep power of global consciousness as a means for personal and social transformation. You help empower more people to change the world from within themselves, which helps build momentum for the urgently needed quantum cultural shift of humanity into enlightenment. 

  • You can choose from a set of "perks" that may be personally helpful to you and perhaps your organization, depending on the level you choose.

Who else backs the project?

  • Global Sense has been endorsed by such thought leaders as Bill McKibben, Vandana Shiva, Thom Hartmann, Francis Moore Lappe, Micheal Lerner, and others.

  • The Global Sense campaign breaks new ground on Indiegogo by featuring win-win mutual support cooperation with other Indiegogo campaigners. I'm promoting their crowdfunding campaigns in trade for them promoting mine. Therefore, please visit and support these campaigns:
    > Crowdocracy - iVigil - The Viral Cause Marketing Tool
    > Ian Gachichio - Exygen's Green Energy Solution
    > Ryan Gaspar - Karma Change
    > Angela Krout - Rogue Waters
    > Filipe Masetti Leite - JourneyAmerica
    > Joshua McMahon - Ecotexture: Off-Grid Water Management
    > Angele Miller - Stylish Eco Friendly & Vegan footwear
    > Mutisya Ndunda Jr - Exygen's Green Energy Solution
     
  • Other campaign allies include:
    > Jerry Ashton - Written Off: America and Americans
    > Gabrial Dayan - Gabriel Dyan International

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute financially, you still can help:

  • Please post comments about the project here at Indiegogo.
  • Please get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools to post on your social networks!
     
  • Want to do more? Please contact me about joining the campaign team.

THE FULL PROPOSAL FOR GLOBAL SENSE:

Please consider supporting international printing and distribution for the new 2012 edition of my award-winning book, GLOBAL SENSE: A spiritual handbook on the nature of society and how to change the world by changing ourselves.

Global Sense explains and promotes the power of our global interactivity to transform the world through our individual actions -- the exact same power of connectivity that fuels global crowdfunding on Indiegogo.

Global Sense won the 2012 Silver Nautilus Award for Best Social Change Book. Previous editions have won awards for best social change book and best personal growth book along with being featured on C-SPAN Book TV (USA). The revised edition is a full rewrite and expansion with a major focus on practical tools and tips that readers can apply in real life.

Uniting spiritual enlightenment and personal growth with global thinking and grassroots politics, Global Sense brings our highest ideals down to earth where we can use them.

Inspired by Thomas Paine's history-changing 1776 essay, Common Sense, the 2012 edition of Global Sense offers reasons for hope in these dark times that try our souls. We truly can build our world anew in the 21st century.

At the heart of the book is an historical investigation into the causes of today's global environmental and economic crises, which I identify as "alpha male rule" and "authority addiction." My solutions for individuals and society are mindful self rule and personal democracy, which the last two sections of the book show how to practice. The book offers many examples to help readers visualize themselves making life choices that make global sense.

Interweaving the investigation and how-to sections are scenes from my own life story, such as childhood abuse and teenage rebellion, Vietnam war protests in Washington DC (eerily akin to today's Occupy movement), a youthful taste of spiritual enlightenment, joining and leaving a cult, entering journalism, speaking about new media in Bogota, landing in Fiji during a military coup, sensing ghosts at Hagia Sophia in Istanbul, being dumbstruck by touring Gandhi's home in Mumbai, meeting the woman of my dreams online, honeymooning in the UK, standing alone inside Stonehenge at sunset, and more.

In essence, because we all are globally interconnected, everything we think, feel, say and do impacts the world (by design or default), so we may as well live deliberately. Through our daily choices, each of us can help build the momentum for a quantum shift of humanity into global consciousness. Global Sense can help us reach the "tipping point" before it's too late.

How big is the global audience for Global Sense?

The book publishing industry estimates the likely market for any title by calculating the total number of possible readers and then asking what happens if one percent (1%) of them actually buy the book. If this number is enough for the book to be profitable after all related expenses (e.g., design, printing, distribution, and marketing), then the business proposition is valid, and the project is worth backing.

What about the market for Global Sense? From my own market research over the past decade, I’ve identified a dozen “psychographic” interest groups that exhibit awareness of our global connectivity:

  • Human Potential Seekers     
  • Spiritual Growth Seekers    
  • Conscious Consumers    
  • Technology Futurists     
  • Natural Capitalists      
  • Environmentalists
  • Educationâ€ˆ& Literacy Activists
  • Gender Liberation Activists
  • Economic Justice Activists
  • Workers’ Rights Activists
  • Civil Rights Activists 
  • Peace Activists

When I account for overlap, the members of these interest groups represent about 15 percent of all adults in industrialized nations. (The 15 percent figure was calculated from total subscriber and member counts for relevant special interest publications and organizations in the United States, then extrapolated internationally.)

  • My own findings are backed up by the Natural Marketing Institute, which in 2011 reported that 13 to 19 percent of all U.S. adults comprise a robust $290 billion market of conscious “LOHAS” consumers (Lifestyles Of Health And Sustainability). These "cultural creatives" make purchases based upon ethics as much or more than price. They favor natural foods, holistic health, hybrid cars, ecotourism, voluntourism, solar and wind power, plus other sustainable goods and services. The Nuovon consultancy in Australia estimates the global LOHAS market at about $600 billion annually.
       
  • If a core group of at least 15 percent of all adults in industrialized nations think globally, if we add 10 percent in developing lands, plus 5 percent in undeveloped nations, given 4.9 billion adults on earth over age 15, this equals at least 500 million people with global sense on earth today. Your presence at Indiegogo suggests you are among those with global sense.

If one percent (1 percent) of the 500 million global audience reads Global Sense, this would mean 5 million copies influencing individual lives and society as a whole, speeding up the day that we reach the pivotal tipping point where we can create a sustainable future.

Frankly, I'd be grateful to see a "market penetration" at a tenth of one percent, yielding 500,000 copies sold, or a hundredth of one percent, yielding 50,000 copies sold. In terms of my business model, either would be profitable. However, my primary goal here is global change, and for this to happen, if I am going to be true to my soul, I cannot afford to play small.

Why seek crowdfunding for the book?

I am now publishing Global Sense through print-on-demand (POD), which supports online sales through bookseller websites serving the U.S., Canada, UK, Europe, and soon Australia. I also am publishing the 2012 edition as an ebook, which is ideal for online sales and downloads.

  • My problem is that actual bookstores and libraries rarely order print-on-demand books, which still carry the stigma of low quality. This stigma is fading, partly because of books like mine that meet the highest publishing industry standards for editing and design, but the barriers to traditional market entry for POD books remain high.

  • Crowdfunding will support advance printing of a hardbound (clothcover) edition of my book for distribution to retail chains, independent booksellers, public libraries, colleges, and universities throughout the English-reading world. Online sales of "click-and-order" POD copies require little up-front capital for me, but supplying the "brick and mortar" outlets with clothcover books will require thousands of books being printed in advance, which requires more money than I have available. Your support can enable international book printing and distribution.   

What can be achieved with your support?

Given our pressing need for a profound change in cultural mass consciousness, if you contribute to the printing and distribution of Global Sense, your support can produce global reverberations.

Once Global Sense is printed for international distribution (with your help), I'm well-grounded in the principles and practices of book promotions.

For starters, I graduated from the Million Dollar Author and year-long Quantum Leap marketing trainings offered in Philadelphia by Bradley Communications. These are the same people who trained Deepak Chopra, Jack Canfield, Mark Victor Hansen, John Gray, Robert Kiyosaki, and other best-selling authors.

When promoting prior editions of Global Sense, for example, I did interviews aired on more than 100 U.S. radio stations, including the nationwide Thom Hartmann Show. I produced a one-hour program on Thomas Paine and Common Sense for a national cable network, C-SPAN's BookTV. For the new 2012 edition of Global Sense, I've already published book excerpts on major websites in the U.S. and UK, and I've barely begun marketing.

As the son of an advertising and marketing executive who literally learned the craft at his father's knee, I've managed many marketing, public relations and advertising campaigns for major organizations and cultural institution. These include the Colorado Symphony, Denver Jazz festival, The Jason Project at the Denver Museum of Nature and Science (live and interactive satellite telecasts from the bottom of the Mediterranean Sea), and numerous big environmental education projects for John Denver's Windstar Foundation based in Aspen, Colorado.

As for book industry knowledge, before my move to Hawaii in 2010, I served as the trade shows chairperson on the board of directors for the Colorado Independent Publishers Association. I also served as president of the Colorado Authors League and two terms on the board of directors for the Denver Press Club. Further, I am the founder of the 900-member Denver Book Club. Nationally, I'm a past-member of the American Society of Journalists and Authors and a current member of the Independent Book Publisher Association (IBPA). All of this publishing industry knowledge is evidenced by my growing base of clients as a book publishing coach at Hoku House in Hawaii.

Given what I know about how to publish and promote quality books, your support for printing and distribution could truly empower Global Sense to go global.

Look at your daily news headlines to see the need for books like mine that can significantly help us to change the world from within ourselves.

  • Your support (at any level) really can help humanity reach the "tipping point" when global sense makes common sense. Indeed, everything you do every day already matters to us all, so why not use your power wisely?

What exactly will your money do?

The book publishing business, like any business, is about thin profits in the margins. Among the many expenses determining the net revenues, printing and distribution costs (such as warehousing and shipping fees) can mean the difference between profit and loss for any independent publisher.

In book printing, the first cost is setting up the printing presses, which tends to be a relatively fixed cost. The chief variable is the amount of copies printed once the presses are running. Printing a lot of books at once is the best way to obtain the lowest unit cost, that is, the lowest cost-per-book. Where on the planet a book is printed affects this unit cost, too. I will find the most affordable green and ethical printer available.

My 276-page trade paperback book costs around $5 (USD) per copy to print-on-demand with digital presses located in the U.S., UK and soon Australia. When I am selling online, after my discount to the online retailers (so they can earn their profits margins, too), I make about $4 per copy sold. From this income, I need to cover all my marketing and business administration costs, leaving me with at best $1 or less net per book, if even that. This makes it very hard to expand outreach.

  • If your support of $10,000 to $20,000 or more allows me to print 5,000 to 10,00 of clothcover (hardbound) books in advance, my unit cost can come down, perhaps to $2-3 per copy, which will mean a viable net profit per book, which I will reinvest to pay for significantly expanded distribution and marketing.
          
  • By printing a lot of books in advance, one or more of the top book distributors likely will agree to carry and promote the book, which means Global Sense no longer will be locked out of sales to bookstores and libraries, including the big chain stores, such as the airport bookstores. Incrementally, month by month and year by year, the vision of 5 million copies in print can be realized, strengthening us all for transforming our world.

Reaching the $22,000 goal will allow the printing and distribution of books throughout the English-reading nations. Surpassing the goal will enable even greater outreach. (I will do separate crowdfunding and crowdsourcing projects for translations.) If the entire goal is not reached, your funding still will go toward printing and distribution proportional to the amount raised.

If total funding is below $5,000, since that will not be enough for advance printing of a hardbound edition, your contribution instead will go toward the marketing the POD edition, so I can earn enough though online sales to print the clothcover edition.

Do my "perks" provide incentives for you? I hope you see a value in what I'm offering to do for you. If you are considering a contribution for the weekend workshop on Kauai, thank you, and I strongly suggest that you contact me through my website (GlobalSense.com) before making your contribution to guarantee we can make arrangements that work for you.

With advance printing and expanded distribution, I will still net roughly $1 per book, keeping Hoku House in business, but what really matters is that more books will be read overall, which means Global Sense can have a greater social and cultural impact in a shorter period of time, which helps increase the likelihood humanity will make the global changes we urgently need to make now.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute financially, you still can help:

  • Please post comments about the project here at Indiegogo.
  • Please get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools to post on your social networks!
     
  • Want to do more? Please contact me about joining the campaign team.
     
  • The Global Sense campaign breaks new ground on Indiegogo by featuring win-win mutual support cooperation with other Indiegogo campaigners. I'm promoting their crowdfunding campaigns in trade for them promoting mine. Therefore, please visit and support these campaigns:
    > Crowdocracy - iVigil - The Viral Cause Marketing Tool
    > Ian Gachichio - Exygen's Green Energy Solution
    > Ryan Gaspar - Karma Change
    > Angela Krout - Rogue Waters
    > Filipe Masetti Leite - JourneyAmerica
    > Joshua McMahon - Ecotexture: Off-Grid Water Management
    > Angele Miller - Stylish Eco Friendly & Vegan footwear
    > Mutisya Ndunda Jr - Exygen's Green Energy Solution
     
  • Other campaign allies include:
    > Jerry Ashton - Written Off: America and Americans
    > Gabrial Dayan - Gabriel Dyan International

For more information about Global Sense, its growing social media community, a list of major online booksellers carrying the POD book, an evolving section of resource links, and more, please visit the book website, GlobalSense.com.

The evolution revolution is here.

(For a low-resolution version of the video, click http://youtu.be/9P-GJ1MFJLk.)

What people say about Global Sense:

"I have just finished reading your book, and I feel happy. I easily can follow your thoughts and explanations, and it makes so much sense to me! It feels very real, practical, down to earth. at the same time showing a direction where to go. You explain it so clearly and simply. Many pieces of a puzzle lost in my brain were put together. You see, I love it. I'm European, and not easily carried away by American dreams. I hope that this book reaches a lot of people. I'm sure reading it could help desperate souls regain hope. Every thought, every smile makes a difference!"

  • Anna Barbara Dütschler, Classical Musician, Switzerland

"Global Sense explodes the old myths that we are essentially evil, that hierarchy and dominance are natural law. Judah Freed reveals how ancient 'male rule' and 'authority addiction' restrain our innate power for self government. Democracy can work, he argues, when we are willing to do the personal and spiritual growth needed to manage our freedom and society responsibly."

  • Thom Hartmann, syndicated radio talk show host, author, Last Hours of Ancient Sunlight, Rebooting the American Dream, Threshold, Cracking the Code, Unequal Protection, The Edison Gene, What Would Jefferson Do?

"Global Sense is about personal and social transformation, starting with the inner self feeling a genuine recognition of our rights and responsibilities. The book is a declaration of our global interdependence rooted in Gandhi's principle of personal sovereignty."

  • Dr. Vandana Shiva, scientist, environmental activist, author, Stolen Harvest, Water Wars, Earth Democracy

"Thomas Paine rallied Americans to a new sense of themselves and their possibilities. Judah Freed does likewise for citizens of the planet."

  • Bill McKibben, author, Deep Economy, The End of Nature, and Eaarth  

"There is a hunger for this kind of integrative global perspective. I am extremely enthusiastic about the book!"

  • Frances Moore Lappe, author, Diet For a Small Planet, EcoMind

"Modern culture struggles at the crossroads of reckless technology and the duty to uncover the spirit on which the healing of mankind rests. Global Sense helps us choose the path of healing."

  • Malidoma Some, author, Of Water and the Spirit   

"Judah Freed proposes a cultural/political Big Bang. He argues that we can best empower one another by empowering ourselves. The breakthrough idea of this important book is that with personal growth and global thinking, we can have both safety and liberty."

  • Dave Wann, co-author, Affluenza; author, Simple Prosperity, Rebuilding Community

"Judah Freed reminds us of the continuing relevance of American patriot Thomas Paine while transforming Paine's message of democracy and human rights into the spiritually-rich and psychologically-informed discourse of the 21st century."

  • Rabbi Michael Lerner, author, The Left Hand of God; editor, Tikkun magazine 

"It makes 'global sense' to read Judah Freed's book, and then to act mindfully to make a difference in the world."

  • Thomas Crum, author, The Magic of Conflict, Three Deep Breaths  

"Global Sense is the handbook needed by the Occupy Wall Street movement."

  • Jerry Ashton, The Huffington Post; author, Written Off: America and Americans

"Read this book!"

  • Pete Seeger, folk singer and activist
story_txt:
SUMMARY OF THE GLOBAL SENSE PROPOSAL


GLOBAL SENSE reveals the way the world really works and how a sense of our global oneness empowers us to change the world from within ourselves.
Uniting inner spirituality and personal growth with ecological awareness and grassroots politics, Global Sense brings our highest ideals down to earth where we can use them. Inspired by Thomas Paine’s history-changing 1776 essay, Common Sense, Global Sense: The 2012 Edition offers reasons for hope in these times that try our souls.
If you support robust marketing, printing and international distribution of my award-winning book, Global Sense: The 2012 Edition, you can help to awaken people worldwide. (Please visit the book website at GlobalSense.com)
Please see the growing list of contributors with links their websites posted at GlobalSense.com/community/crowdfunders/
About the Book


Global Sense explains and promotes the power of our global interactivity to transform the world through our individual actions (this very same connectivity empowers crowdfunding). Global Sense aims to help society reach the pivotal "tipping point" before it's too late.  
Uniting spiritual enlightenment and personal growth with global thinking and grassroots politics, Global Sense brings our highest ideals down to earth where we can use them.

Audience for the Book


Multiple research sources show that a core group about 15 percent of all adults in the world's industrialized nations have developed a global sensibility. This percentage is slightly lower in the so-called "third world" countries.  
Given 4.9 billion adults among 7 billion people on the planet, that 15 percent equals at least 500 million people with global sense on earth today. Growing this base of global thinkers can transform society and help us resolve our global crises together.    

If one percent (1 percent) of the 500 million audience reads Global Sense, this would mean 5 million copies of the book influencing individuals and society as a whole, speeding up the day when we create a sustainable future.

Why crowdfunding is needed


I am currently printing Global Sense for online sales of a trade paperback edition through digital print-on-demand presses in the U.S., UK and (soon) Australia. This involves little up-front capital on my end, however....   
Physical bookstores and libraries almost never order print-on-demand books. They want hardcover (cloth cover) books, which requires traditional advance printing, This severely limits the potential reach of Global Sense and its benefits.  
The solution is printing clothcover books in advance, so one or more of the top book distributors will agree to carry and promote the book to stores and libraries around the world, or at least in the English-reading nations.  
Conventional cothcover book printing can be pricey. The cost-per copy hinges on the amount of copies printed once the presses are running. The more books that I can afford to print at once, the lower the unit cost for these books.  
Strong support for this crowdfunding campaign is essential for persuading one or more top distributors to carry Global Sense, since they will see the book has a strong market base.

How your contribution will be used

Your contribution will support printing clothcover editions of Global Sense after securing trade distribution to retail chains, independent booksellers, libraries, colleges, and universities throughout the English-reading world.   
Reaching the full $22,000 goal will allow the printing and distribution of clothcover books throughout English-reading nations. Lesser funding will support printing and distribution at a proportional level.

If total funding is below $5,000, since that will not be enough for advance printing of a hardbound edition, your contribution instead will go toward the marketing the POD edition, so I can earn enough though online sales to print the clothcover edition.

My qualifications to do what I propose

I was trained in book marketing and publicity by the same people who trained Deepak Chopra, Jack Canfield, Mark Victor Hansen, John Gray, Robert Kiyosaki, and other best-selling authors who started as unknowns. 

Along with 30 years of professional experience as a local to global journalist, I've managed marketing, public relations and advertising campaigns for major organizations and cultural institutions. I'm already applying this skill toward marketing Global Sense assertively.

My extensive book industry knowledge flows from membership and leadership in such trade organizations as the Independent Book Publisher Association (IBPA), American Society of Journalists and Authors, Colorado Independent Publishers Association, Colorado Authors League, and Denver Press Club. I founded the 900-member Denver Book Club. Also, I serve diverse clients as a book publishing coach through my own Hoku House in Hawaii.  
View my bio profile for more information on my experience and abilities.

Benefits from supporting Global Sense


First and foremost, you contribute to people on earth awakening to the deep power of global consciousness as a means for personal and social transformation. You help empower more people to change the world from within themselves, which helps build momentum for the urgently needed quantum cultural shift of humanity into enlightenment.  

You can choose from a set of "perks" that may be personally helpful to you and perhaps your organization, depending on the level you choose.

Who else backs the project?


Global Sense has been endorsed by such thought leaders as Bill McKibben, Vandana Shiva, Thom Hartmann, Francis Moore Lappe, Micheal Lerner, and others.

The Global Sense campaign breaks new ground on Indiegogo by featuring win-win mutual support cooperation with other Indiegogo campaigners. I'm promoting their crowdfunding campaigns in trade for them promoting mine. Therefore, please visit and support these campaigns:> Crowdocracy - iVigil - The Viral Cause Marketing Tool > Ian Gachichio - Exygen's Green Energy Solution> Ryan Gaspar - Karma Change> Angela Krout - Rogue Waters > Filipe Masetti Leite - JourneyAmerica > Joshua McMahon - Ecotexture: Off-Grid Water Management> Angele Miller - Stylish Eco Friendly & Vegan footwear> Mutisya Ndunda Jr - Exygen's Green Energy Solution 
Other campaign allies include:> Jerry Ashton - Written Off: America and Americans> Gabrial Dayan - Gabriel Dyan International



Other Ways You Can Help


If you can’t contribute financially, you still can help:

Please post comments about the project here at Indiegogo.
Please get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
Please use the Indiegogo share tools to post on your social networks! 

Want to do more? Please contact me about joining the campaign team.



THE FULL PROPOSAL FOR GLOBAL SENSE:


Please consider supporting international printing and distribution for the new 2012 edition of my award-winning book, GLOBAL SENSE: A spiritual handbook on the nature of society and how to change the world by changing ourselves.
Global Sense explains and promotes the power of our global interactivity to transform the world through our individual actions -- the exact same power of connectivity that fuels global crowdfunding on Indiegogo. Global Sense won the 2012 Silver Nautilus Award for Best Social Change Book. Previous editions have won awards for best social change book and best personal growth book along with being featured on C-SPAN Book TV (USA). The revised edition is a full rewrite and expansion with a major focus on practical tools and tips that readers can apply in real life.
Uniting spiritual enlightenment and personal growth with global thinking and grassroots politics, Global Sense brings our highest ideals down to earth where we can use them.
Inspired by Thomas Paine's history-changing 1776 essay, Common Sense, the 2012 edition of Global Sense offers reasons for hope in these dark times that try our souls. We truly can build our world anew in the 21st century.
At the heart of the book is an historical investigation into the causes of today's global environmental and economic crises, which I identify as "alpha male rule" and "authority addiction." My solutions for individuals and society are mindful self rule and personal democracy, which the last two sections of the book show how to practice. The book offers many examples to help readers visualize themselves making life choices that make global sense.
Interweaving the investigation and how-to sections are scenes from my own life story, such as childhood abuse and teenage rebellion, Vietnam war protests in Washington DC (eerily akin to today's Occupy movement), a youthful taste of spiritual enlightenment, joining and leaving a cult, entering journalism, speaking about new media in Bogota, landing in Fiji during a military coup, sensing ghosts at Hagia Sophia in Istanbul, being dumbstruck by touring Gandhi's home in Mumbai, meeting the woman of my dreams online, honeymooning in the UK, standing alone inside Stonehenge at sunset, and more.
In essence, because we all are globally interconnected, everything we think, feel, say and do impacts the world (by design or default), so we may as well live deliberately. Through our daily choices, each of us can help build the momentum for a quantum shift of humanity into global consciousness. Global Sense can help us reach the "tipping point" before it's too late.
How big is the global audience for Global Sense?

The book publishing industry estimates the likely market for any title by calculating the total number of possible readers and then asking what happens if one percent (1%) of them actually buy the book. If this number is enough for the book to be profitable after all related expenses (e.g., design, printing, distribution, and marketing), then the business proposition is valid, and the project is worth backing.
What about the market for Global Sense? From my own market research over the past decade, I’ve identified a dozen “psychographic” interest groups that exhibit awareness of our global connectivity:

Human Potential Seekers     
Spiritual Growth Seekers    
Conscious Consumers    
Technology Futurists     
Natural Capitalists      
Environmentalists
Educationâ€ˆ& Literacy Activists
Gender Liberation Activists
Economic Justice Activists
Workers’ Rights Activists
Civil Rights Activists 
Peace Activists

When I account for overlap, the members of these interest groups represent about 15 percent of all adults in industrialized nations. (The 15 percent figure was calculated from total subscriber and member counts for relevant special interest publications and organizations in the United States, then extrapolated internationally.)

My own findings are backed up by the Natural Marketing Institute, which in 2011 reported that 13 to 19 percent of all U.S. adults comprise a robust $290 billion market of conscious “LOHAS” consumers (Lifestyles Of Health And Sustainability). These "cultural creatives" make purchases based upon ethics as much or more than price. They favor natural foods, holistic health, hybrid cars, ecotourism, voluntourism, solar and wind power, plus other sustainable goods and services. The Nuovon consultancy in Australia estimates the global LOHAS market at about $600 billion annually.     

If a core group of at least 15 percent of all adults in industrialized nations think globally, if we add 10 percent in developing lands, plus 5 percent in undeveloped nations, given 4.9 billion adults on earth over age 15, this equals at least 500 million people with global sense on earth today. Your presence at Indiegogo suggests you are among those with global sense. 


If one percent (1 percent) of the 500 million global audience reads Global Sense, this would mean 5 million copies influencing individual lives and society as a whole, speeding up the day that we reach the pivotal tipping point where we can create a sustainable future.
Frankly, I'd be grateful to see a "market penetration" at a tenth of one percent, yielding 500,000 copies sold, or a hundredth of one percent, yielding 50,000 copies sold. In terms of my business model, either would be profitable. However, my primary goal here is global change, and for this to happen, if I am going to be true to my soul, I cannot afford to play small.
Why seek crowdfunding for the book?
I am now publishing Global Sense through print-on-demand (POD), which supports online sales through bookseller websites serving the U.S., Canada, UK, Europe, and soon Australia. I also am publishing the 2012 edition as an ebook, which is ideal for online sales and downloads.

Crowdfunding will support advance printing of a hardbound (clothcover) edition of my book for distribution to retail chains, independent booksellers, public libraries, colleges, and universities throughout the English-reading world. Thomas Crum, author, The Magic of Conflict, Three Deep Breaths

Jerry Ashton, The Huffington Post; author, Written Off: America and Americans

"Read this book!"


Pete Seeger, folk singer and activist

story:
I was in the middle of a book.

In October 2009, between Paris and San Francisco, a comedy solo tour on gender in five languages, a book, a screenplay, and workshops on queer creativity for Europunks, I talked my mom into letting me weave her fifty life stories into mine, to create a two-generation political memoir. Life was about to get busy.

My mother was a fashion diva born in the Weimar republic and raised in the Third Reich, where she was made to salute the swastika, say Heil Hitler instead of hi, wear the uniform of child fascists, and work in a Nazi weapons factory. After the war, a commie aptitude test decided she wasn’t geared to be a dress designer after all, but a machinist in grey coveralls, again. On her way to another hell job with dirty old men under other authoritarians, she jumped the iron curtain and fled to the west. If she were going to work for an allied power, it would be a civilized one. She flirted her way into working for the Americans. Her heroes, who in one way had burned down her house, killed her father, imprisoned her mother behind the iron curtain, and taken everything, had liberated her from a life of dread and repression. It was complicated.

She married my dad. They flew to the states and in 1958 had me. My babysitter was a library instead of a TV. They showed me the world, from the Berlin wall to Anne Frank’s house to Auschwitz, from the backcountry of the Sierras to the Haight, all the while interpreting it in terms of freedom.

That’s where I got my crazy ideas about right and wrong and what to do about it.

Cut to the fall of 2009. Mom was eating, drinking and being Mary with her gay pals in Berlin, like every year on vacation. I was on tour while remotely fighting an eviction. My future was uncertain and the end was always near.

Just outside of Santa Fe, I got the call. Mom had been found on the bathroom floor of a hair salon, with a stroke that left her brain-damaged and half paralyzed. I called the hospital.

She said, “I’m ok.”

OK is what she always was, especially when she wasn’t.

I flew to Berlin. Leaning on her hospital bed, I recited the only prayer she ever taught me as a child, a German one: “Dear God, make me pure so I can go to heaven.“

“Yeah, but not now,” she retorted.

Mom stroke plus eviction equals snake eyes! I was going to be evicted. Mom couldn’t live alone. I’d give up my charmed life and become a stay-at-home dad with a 150-pound baby. But first, months of stabilizing in Berlin hospitals, navigating legal, medical, insurance and emotional mazes in German and English, organizing friends to visit before Mom left her home town never to return, calming abused nurses, crying in ante rooms, and sometimes laughing.

If I’d lost my mother all at once I wouldn’t have broken open so slow.

I tried to reach what I thought to be her now basic thought processes.

“Mom, when life gives you lemons, make lemonade. “

She said, “Why would anyone make lemonade to feel better. They ought to make a martini.”

I’d come out, done drugs, got sober, toured the world, come out again as trans. I’d been a comic, writer, director, actor, homocore yeller, but my biggest transition was yet to happen.

Queer Moves Back to Childhood Home, read local headlines.

The docs said Mom wasn’t going to get better. She was lucky to be alive. I doubt she would have called it that.

Hey Mom, would you rather be brain damaged in a wheelchair, or die?

“Dead,” she’d have deadpanned.

Mom was a fighter. She might, like the heroes of stroke recovery books, crawl on the ground until she learned to walk, but more likely she’d choose not to and demand to be waited on. Indeed, when she figured out she wasn’t going to be walking, the first thing she asked for was a motorized wheelchair. I told her vehicular manslaughter was the last thing we wanted to add to her list of woes.

The worst part was she fought everyone who tried to help. After decades of building a network of friends and learning to communicate appropriately, she now drove us away, threw things, yelled, kicked caregivers and cussed them out, called for the police, and told me what a loser I’d always been, as if this was all my fault, everyone’s fault. Her old shame blame manipulate, the-best-defense-is-attack pre-evolution tactics came out. She was possessed. She needed a truck full of meds to knock her out and still woke up every two hours shouting my name, the one guy she had come to trust. As soon as I got out of bed, she unloaded her entire stash of old wounds ammo. She had flashbacks. She didn’t understand. She said her cool black and red sheets I put on her bed were the Nazi flag.

In blind grief and a caffeine-driven attempt to hold shit together, I devised a nonprofit ride service called Homobiles, inadvertently creating what’s now known as the community ride share, to cart around strippers, fags, transwomen and queens, the people mom loved, who shared her seen-it-all outlook and exquisite sense of style.

With some juggling and credit cards, I was able to arrange help for mom, but stopped mid-roll was my research for our book. From ‘07 to ‘09, in my girlfriend’s Pigalle apartment, I had been studying the world of genocide, repression, bombs, rape and starvation in which mom grew up, and the civil rights and anti-war movements of the 60’s in which I grew up. I studied our hearts, the innocence of children twisted in atmospheres of police states, death camps, world wars, invasions, coups, assassinations, and the executions of the leaders and righteous citizenry who demanded change, all tempered by parents’ attempts to protect and teach in the midst of terror.

Set to a soundtrack by Glenn Miller, Duke Ellington, Ella Fitzgerald, Marlene Dietrich, Elvis, Bob Dylan, James Brown, Muhammed Ali, Jimi Hendrix, Patti Smith, and Bob Marley, our childhoods were laid like secret code into the environments that swirled around us, long before we understood politics, in the heat of hate, shonde, revolt and the feminist cry, “the personal is political.” We were melted down in fascist crucibles, pounded by songs of freedom into blades to cut through bullshit.

Our post-stroke thread of mother love and the bureaucracy that tried to thwart it connects history from the Third Reich to communism, democracy, feminism and civil rights, to Harvey Milk, The Plague, punk, Queer Nation and a divided nation, to America’s first black president, and how we’ve inspired each other to stay.

My mother, body twisted, war trauma triggered, not all there, still here, and me, on the glaring hot salt flats of acceptance, we have become a better son and a better mom, finding our footing on wheels, even if there is no redemption.

We want to draw you closer to us, and in so doing, closer to your own family, when understanding them becomes impossible. Their struggle is yours. We hope our story helps you keep loving them through anything.

-- -- -- 

All funds raised will go towards completing the book: writing, editing, compiling photographs, publishing.  If we don't make it to $30,000 all funds that are raised will go towards as many hours of completing the book as possible.  
Help us get there without spending a dime--share the campaign on your Facebook/Twitter/etc!  
And check back here often for more pictures, book snippets, updates on mom (and Lynnee), and more!
